events.id: Michelangelo — A Different View-Tākina Wellington Convention and Exhibition Centre-Wellington NZ
events.name: Michelangelo — A Different View
events.venue: Tākina Wellington Convention and Exhibition Centre
events.long_description:
There’s no need to look up to see true greatness. The intricate beauty of Michelangelo’s Sistine Chapel ceiling will be on full display at Tākina over summer. Michelangelo — A Different View invites you to experience the genius of the sixteenth-century artist from an entirely new perspective. You get to be above and up close. 
Under license from the Vatican Museums, this exhibition offers a complete and authentic reproduction of over 50 stunning works. This once-in-a-lifetime exhibition allows you to experience the colour and detail of multiple works from just two meters away.

events.id: Waiora Te Ūkaipō — The Homeland-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Waiora Te Ūkaipō — The Homeland
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The impact of colonisation and urban drift are themes in a theatrical reboot at the next Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts. ‘Waiora Te Ūkaipō — The Homeland’ was originally commissioned by the festival in 1992. Its return 34 years later at the 2026 festival is highly anticipated. It has become a landmark piece of New Zealand theatre — exploring the tension between past and future. Set in the summer of 1965, the play follows Hone, who brings his family from New Zealand’s East Cape to the South Island in search of a better life. As they gather for a beachside birthday hāngī with their Pākehā guests, buried secrets and cultural tensions rise to the surface. Far from their  tīpuna , the family must navigate questions of identity, belonging, and survival. 
Waiora Te Ūkaipō was conceived, written and directed by Hone Kouka (Ngāti Porou, Ngāti Raukawa, Ngāti Kahungunu). The multi-award-winning writer/director has penned 13 plays. Many have been staged in Aotearoa and further afield in Canada, South Africa, New Caledonia, and the UK. Waiora Te Ūkaipō is presented in partnership with the Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts, Te Ahurei Toi o Tāmaki Auckland Arts Festival, Auckland Theatre Company and Tawata Productions.

events.id: Wellington Phoenix — 2025/26 A-League Season-Sky Stadium | Porirua Park, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Wellington Phoenix — 2025/26 A-League Season
events.venue: Sky Stadium | Porirua Park, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The beautiful game is back in Wellington, and you won’t want to miss a moment of the action. Since rising from the ashes of the New Zealand Knights in 2007, the Wellington Phoenix has become a must-watch sport in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. Now, both the men’s and women’s teams are ready to ignite the 2025/26 A-League season, bringing world-class football to the capital. 
This season promises electric matchdays, three thrilling double-headers, and two home New Zealand derbies. Whether you’re cheering from Sky Stadium in the central city or out at Porirua Park, get ready for passion, energy, and unforgettable football moments. Round up your friends and whānau , grab your tickets, and be part of the action as the Wellington Phoenix take the field.

events.id: Heathers the Musical-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Heathers the Musical
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
It’s Westerberg High, where popularity is a matter of life and death. Welcome to ‘Heathers the Musical”. Based on a movie with the same name, the show is a coming-of-age story dealing with love, heartache, defying expectations, and being true to yourself. It originally premiered in Los Angeles in 2013. Since then, the musical has had record-breaking seasons across the globe. It now makes its professional New Zealand debut in 2026, and Wellington is in line to join the school assembly. Described as a high-octane, black comedy rock musical, Heathers is packed with a mix of ballads and showstoppers. The catchy tunes are written by Kevin Murphy (Desperate Housewives) and Laurence O’Keefe (Legally Blonde: The Musical). 
The 1989 film starred Winona Ryder and Christian Slater. It quickly achieved cult status among audiences. Both the movie and musical follow high school student Veronica Sawyer. Veronica is just another nobody until she’s unexpectedly taken under the wings of the beautiful and cruel Heathers. When mysterious teen rebel J.D. arrives, Veronica learns that it might kill to be a nobody, but it's murder being a somebody. 
This special production will feature a stellar Australasian cast. So grab your scrunchies, break out the Corn Nuts and wait for the bell to ring.

events.id: Christmas Day at The Dragon 2025-The Welsh Dragon Bar,10A Cambridge Ter, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Christmas Day at The Dragon 2025
events.venue: The Welsh Dragon Bar,10A Cambridge Ter, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Christmas Day at The Dragon 2025
It’s the most wonderful time of the year! We look forward to Christmas Day all year round (or, at least as soon as we’ve finished mid-winter Christmas).

Our famous Christmas Day celebration is a private, daytime event where we, and our guests can enjoy the pub to ourselves for an exclusive, once a year experience.

A Christmas feast will be served throughout the day, with a celebratory five-course menu. The day is always the best of laid-back Kiwi style, very relaxed and friendly, with of course the true Welsh Christmas spirit and hospitality that you know and love.

If you make the good list there will be a visit from Santa too. We organise a Secret Santa present swap, presided over by the big man himself – our guidelines are a $10 op shop gift so let your imagination run wild.

The day begins at 2pm with a welcome drink, and food served from 2.30pm.

This event tends to sell out quickly, so early booking is definitely recommended.

The dress code is dress to impress – whatever that means to you. Three-piece dinner suit? Christmas t-shirt? Elf costume? Whatever makes you feel fabulously festive.
We can’t wait to see you there. And from all of us at the Dragon, Nadolig Llawen!

**Full price is $115. This includes your welcome drink, a delicious 5-course Christmas feast, all whilst enjoying the day's festivities exclusively in our pub.**

events.id: Self-Guided Tour of Stonehenge Aotearoa-Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Self-Guided Tour of Stonehenge Aotearoa
events.venue: Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton
events.long_description:
Explore Stonehenge Aotearoa at Your Own Pace

Our self-guided tour includes a map and a 12-minute audio-visual presentation to help you uncover the secrets of the henge. Afterward, head down to the stone circle and try out its unique acoustics — clap your hands and hear the echo respond, or whisper and see how far your voice carries.

A self-guided tour typically takes around 30 minutes, but many visitors stay longer simply because it’s so much fun. The bigger your group, the better the experience!

Please arrive at least 30 minutes before closing time.
Available during our opening hours: 10 AM – 4 PM.

Join a Shared Guided Tour and experience Stonehenge Aotearoa through the eyes of an expert. In this 90-minute journey, you’ll uncover how ancient cultures measured time, tracked the Sun and Moon, and connected the heavens with life on Earth.

Your experience begins with a captivating introduction and a 15-minute audio-visual presentation explaining how the Henge works. Then, step outside with your guide for a detailed tour of the stone circle, where astronomy, archaeology, and mythology come together in one unforgettable setting.

Perfect for visitors seeking a deeper understanding of the stars and stories that shaped human history.

events.id: Christmas Day at The Dragon 2025-10A Cambridge Ter, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Christmas Day at The Dragon 2025
events.venue: 10A Cambridge Ter, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
It’s the most wonderful time of the year! We look forward to Christmas Day all year round (or, at least as soon as we’ve finished mid-winter Christmas).
Our famous Christmas Day celebration is a private, daytime event where we, and our guests can enjoy the pub to ourselves for an exclusive, once a year experience.
A Christmas feast will be served throughout the day, with a celebratory five-course menu. The day is always the best of laid-back Kiwi style, very relaxed and friendly, with of course the true Welsh Christmas spirit and hospitality that you know and love.
If you make the good list there will be a visit from Santa too. We organise a Secret Santa present swap, presided over by the big man himself – our guidelines are a $10 op shop gift so let your imagination run wild.
The day begins at 2pm with a welcome drink, and food served from 2.30pm.
This event tends to sell out quickly, so early booking is definitely recommended.
The dress code is dress to impress – whatever that means to you. Three-piece dinner suit? Christmas t-shirt? Elf costume? Whatever makes you feel fabulously festive.
We can’t wait to see you there. And from all of us at the Dragon, Nadolig Llawen!
**Full price is $115. This includes your welcome drink, a delicious 5-course Christmas feast, all whilst enjoying the day's festivities exclusively in our pub.**

events.long_description:
Hippo’s turning the New Year’s Eve celebration up a notch. We’re ready to toast the year that was (and is) the only way we know how — with a little harbour sparkle, a lot of flavour, and a healthy dose of Hippo charm.
Join us for a three-course set menu by Chef Antoine featuring your choice of one of three dishes per course. Each plate blends classic French technique with the best of New Zealand’s produce.
Kick things off with Champagne on arrival, dance to the beat of live music, and the kind of flavour that keeps the night flowing.
It’s time to celebrate new beginnings, old friends, new friends and the magic of being back together — the Hippo way.
Tickets are $119 per adult for a 1.5-hour session from 5:30pm – 9:30pm (last sitting), open until late.

events.name: Robin Hood - The Pantomime
events.venue: 1A Taranaki St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Adventures of the original working-class hero and man in tights!
Robin Hood steals from the rich and gives to the poor in an oldie timey place where people are struggling and homeless, and the landed gentry hoard the money all for themselves – Wellington 2025.
Robin must stop the Evil Sheriff from running roughshod over the citizens! But this quest is far from easy… there is archery, swordfights, and a lot of dance numbers to get through. Our hero is grateful for help from spies on the inside: Maid Marion and her bolshie handmaiden (Pantomime Dame Jthan Morgan).
Come one and come all to see the slings and arrows of outrageous panto!

events.venue: Le Ciel Bakery, 100 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Christmas Feast for Two – A Magical Dinner Experience

Celebrate the joy of Christmas with an intimate dining experience designed just for two. Le Ciel invites you to indulge in a festive evening filled with warmth, flavour, and sparkle — a beautiful way to share the season’s magic.

Each table for two will be adorned with candlelight, evergreen touches, and a hint of gold. Our specially curated five-course Christmas menu brings together the nostalgia of traditional holiday dishes and the elegance of modern cuisine. Expect luxurious flavours, handcrafted details, and a little surprise treat to take home.

Whether it’s a romantic evening, a celebration with a dear friend, or a thoughtful gift experience, this dinner promises to be one to remember.

Available Dates: December 24th – 28th
Seating Times: 7:00 PM
Pricing: $120 per pair ($60 per person)

Bookings are essential — limited tables available each night.

Sample menu:
CHRISTMAS DINNER MENU
A festive evening celebrating Kiwi flavours with a refined holiday twist.
TO START — Choose 1
• House-Baked Focaccia with rosemary, sea salt & olive oil
• Garlic & Herb Bread Rolls with whipped butter
• Warm Ciabatta with sundried tomato pesto
MAINS — Choose 2 Proteins
• Slow-Roasted Lamb Shoulder with garlic, rosemary & red wine jus
• Honey-Glazed Champagne Ham with mustard & clove glaze
• Baked Salmon Fillet with miso, citrus & toasted sesame
• Free-Range Chicken Ballotine with spinach, ricotta & thyme jus
• Vegetarian Pumpkin & Sage Wellington with pecan crumble
SIDES — Choose 3
• Classic Kiwi Potato Salad with egg, dill & mustard mayo
• Roasted Baby Potatoes with garlic & herb butter
• Summer Greens & Pomegranate Salad
• Avocado, Citrus & Feta Salad
• Roasted Kūmara with maple & toasted seeds
• Grilled Asparagus with lemon & parmesan
DESSERT PLATTER — Shared
• Mini Pavlovas with seasonal fruit
• Salted Caramel Chocolate Tarts
• Christmas Mince Pies
• Fresh Berries & Cream
• Vanilla Bean Crème Brûlée
DRINKS AVAILABLE FOR PURCHASE
Non-alcoholic: Gingerbread Kombucha • Sparkling Juices
Wine: Chilled Bubbles • Red & White Selection
Cocktails: Festive Negroni • Pine-Infused G&T • Spiced Rum Sour
PRICE
$120 per couple
Festive shared dining experience

events.id: new moon at moon - a summer solstice celebration-167 Riddiford St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: new moon at moon - a summer solstice celebration
events.venue: 167 Riddiford St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
new moon at moon
a summer solstice celebration
the end of 2025 is approaching fast, and what better time to gather with others to celebrate this shift than a new moon??
with several live solo electronic artists this new moon at moon gig will be the perfect opportunity to reflect and celebrate your progress this year, (or to dance away blocks stopping you from moving forward!) and connect with others.
this new moon also coincides with the summer solstice, marking the halfway point of the tauhou māori, making it an even better time to gather with others, celebrate, reflect and bask in the joy of the sunshine + renewed energy that comes with summer !
the artists who will be guiding you through this night are:
hazel elder
vanessa tottle (AUK)
talmar (AUK)
modern dialogue
beet-wix
but as well as music there will be…
koha tarot readings
a raffle
koha second hand clothing
with profits going to Outline Aotearoa
https://outline.org.nz/
while this time of year can be a wonderful time to reconnect with your roots, this same exact reason can make the holidays an especially rough time for some - particularly for some LGBTQIA+ / queer people who may not be supported by their families / be feeling disconnected from community at this time.
to recognise this at the gig we will be having a second hand clothing rack + raffle as a fundraiser for Outline Aotearoa, a charity that provides mental health support to Takatāpui, MVPFAFF+ and Rainbow communities, their friends, whānau, and those questioning.
some profits from the tickets will also be going towards Outline Aotearoa as well as supporting local queer / femme and trans artists !

accessibility info / general tikanga for gig
please come if you are nice and stay home if you are not. this is a queer-friendly space and we will not tolerate racism, homophobia, transphobia, sexism, ableism or general shit behaviour of any kind.
please do not come if you are sick. sickness spreads like hell at gigs and we want to keep our vulnerable communities safe. there will be masks available for those who would like them.
venue is wheelchair accessible and has an accessible bathroom. please contact Lucky / beet-wix at beetwixmusic@gmail.com if you have any further accessibility enquiries
come along, help support a great cause and gather with everyone in queer community to celebrate this shift in our year !
beautiful poster by Ursa Bennett!
https://www.instagram.com/hazelastridelder/
https://www.instagram.com/vanessa_t_music/
https://www.instagram.com/talmarmusic/
https://www.instagram.com/m0derndial0gue/
https://www.instagram.com/beetwix4breakfast/
https://www.instagram.com/another.lucky.omen/
https://www.instagram.com/sulauroar/

this new moon also coincides with the summer solstice, marking the halfway point of the tauhou māori, making it an even better time to gather with others, celebrate, reflect and bask in the joy of the sunshine + renewed energy that comes with summer !
the artists who will be guiding you through this night are: hazel elder vanessa tottle (AUK) talmar (AUK) modern dialogue beet-wix but as well as music there will be… koha tarot readings a raffle koha second hand clothing with profits going to Outline Aotearoa https://outline.org.nz/ while this time of year can be a wonderful time to reconnect with your roots, this same exact reason can make the holidays an especially rough time for some - particularly for some LGBTQIA+ / queer people who may not be supported by their families / be feeling disconnected from community at this time.

please contact Lucky / beet-wix at beetwixmusic@gmail.com if you have any further accessibility enquiries come along, help support a great cause and gather with everyone in queer community to celebrate this shift in our year !

events.id: Sunset Guided Tour-Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Sunset Guided Tour
events.venue: Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton
events.long_description:
Experience Stonehenge Aotearoa at its most breathtaking — as the sun dips below the Wairarapa horizon.
Our Sunset Guided Tour blends astronomy, storytelling, and the natural beauty of twilight for an evening you will never forget.

Led by one of our knowledgeable guides, this 90-minute experience explores how ancient cultures used the Sun to track time and mark the turning of the seasons. You’ll discover the scientific and cultural thinking behind the Henge’s unique Southern Hemisphere design before watching the sunset alignment from inside the stone circle.

Weather permitting, you’ll witness how the setting Sun interacts with the structure — a striking moment that links ancient knowledge with the rhythms of the natural world.

Duration and Schedule
• Allow: Approximately 90 minutes
• Start Time: Begins one hour before sunset
• Availability: Offered any day with advance booking

events.long_description:
Christmas Buffet at Oak & Vine Wellington
Christmas plans? We’ve got you covered. Join us for a festive buffet on Christmas Eve or Christmas Day at Oak & Vine Wellington.

About this Event


🎄 Christmas Eve Lunch & Christmas Day Dinner at Oak & Vine Wellington
Oysters, sizzling grills, glazed ham and festive desserts. Christmas tastes better when someone else does the cooking.
Join us for a relaxed celebration at Oak & Vine Wellington with a generous buffet and a two-hour drinks package including house wines, beer and soft drinks. Start with a glass of bubbly and a freshly shucked oyster, then explore live grill stations, a curated charcuterie spread, seasonal salads and indulgent mains. Save room for dessert — we’re serving pavlovas, chocolate fondue and Christmas pudding with brandy sauce.
Whether you're joining us for lunch on Christmas Eve or dinner on Christmas Day, expect good food, good company and zero washing up.
Event Details
📅 Christmas Eve Lunch: Wednesday 24 December 2025
🕒 12:30PM to 3PM
📅 Christmas Day Dinner: Thursday 25 December 2025
🕒 6PM to 8:30PM
💰 $169 per adult | $59 per child (ages 5–12)
Location
Oak & Vine Wellington, Oaks Wellington Hotel
89 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington, 6011
Questions?
Email our events team at





CHRISTMAS BUFFET MENU
Includes house wines, beer & soft drinks
Glass of bubbly with freshly shucked oyster with mignonette dressing & lemon on arrival

APPETIZERS
Cream of Mushroom Soup
Earthy and rich, made with sautéed mushrooms and finished with cream, garlic croutons.
Cheese & Charcuterie Station
A curated selection of aged cheeses, cured meats, olives, nuts, and dried fruits, served with artisan breads, crackers, chutneys, and honeycomb.

SALADS
Build-Your-Own Salad Station
Salad bar featuring two types of lettuce, assorted nuts, corn, chickpeas, cranberries, capsicums, cherry tomatoes, pickles, and a variety of dressings.
Apple, Walnut & Celery
Crunchy and refreshing, tossed in a light yogurt dressing with crisp apples, celery, and toasted walnuts.
Roasted Beet & Feta
Sweet roasted beets paired with arugula, walnuts, and creamy feta, finished with a balsamic glaze.
Pear & Blue Cheese
Juicy pears, candied pecans, and creamy blue cheese served over mixed greens for a festive flavour balance.
Kale & Pomegranate
Massaged kale leaves tossed with pomegranate seeds, pumpkin seeds, and a creamy tahini dressing.

MAINS
Live Grill Station
Free Range Chicken Breast, Prawns, Grass Fed Beef, Market Fish
Accompaniments: Red Wine Jus, Mushroom & green peppercorn sauce, Chimichurri
Carving Station
Glazed Ham
Slow-roasted ham glazed with cloves and brown sugar for a sweet and savory finish.
Butternut Squash Risotto
Creamy Arborio rice cooked with roasted butternut squash, parmesan, and a hint of nutmeg.
Sweet Potato & Lentil Bake
Layers of spiced lentils and mashed sweet potato, baked with a crunchy topping.
Sautéed Seasonal Asparagus with Balsamic
Tender asparagus spears lightly sautéed and drizzled with aged balsamic glaze.
Garlic & Herb Tossed Jersey Benne Potato
Baby Jersey Benne potatoes roasted and tossed with garlic, herbs, and olive oil.

Live Pasta Station (Kid friendly)
Freshly cooked pastas: Gnocchi, Penne, Spaghetti
Sauces: A classic Marinara, Alfredo, Herb Pesto
Condiments: Cherry tomatoes, capsicum, mushroom, sun dried tomatoes, capers

DESSERT
Christmas Pudding with Brandy Sauce
Traditional steamed pudding made with dried fruits and spices, served warm with rich brandy sauce.
Fruit Pavlovas
Individual meringue nests topped with whipped cream and a medley of fresh seasonal fruits.
Fruit Mince Pies
Buttery pastry filled with spiced dried fruits and citrus peel, baked until golden.
Hummingbird & White Chocolate Mousse
Silky smooth chocolate mousse served.
Seasonal Fresh Strawberries with Whipped Cream
Juicy strawberries served with lightly sweetened whipped cream.
Chocolate Fondue with Condiments
Warm melted chocolate served with marshmallows, seasonal fruits, and lady fingers for dipping.

events.id: O come let us adore him: Christmas Services at St Peter's, 2025-St Peter's Anglican Church, 211 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: O come let us adore him: Christmas Services at St Peter's, 2025
events.venue: St Peter's Anglican Church, 211 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us for one or more of our Christmas services,
to celebrate the Feast of the Incarnation — the Coming of God amongst us in our own skin; the miracle of the Word, which spoke all life into being, now made vulnerable in human form.
We begin on Christmas Eve with singing Christmas carols and reading Christmas poetry, at 11pm.
Midnight Mass, begins at 11.30pm.
It is a magical time, with twinkling lights and the anticipatory atmosphere of the midnight hour.
Then on Christmas Day we have Christmas Communion at both 8am and at 10am.
There will be carols sung at both services, and the opportunity to ring bells before and after the 10am service.
We look forward to seeing you.
Bring a friend!
All are welcome.
Come, let go into the wonder and joy and hope - come, let us adore him, Christ the Lord.

events.id: Botanical insights display - Ancient plants-Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Botanical insights display - Ancient plants
events.venue: Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington
events.long_description:
Ancient plants and a few animals

A boom in ‘modern’ palaeobotany started in the early 19th century and continues to the present day. A pictorial display at Wellington Botanic Garden’s Tree House highlights key discoveries in this long trek, and also gives us a glimpse of some of the animals that shared the world with plants.
The display is in two halves. From 1 November to mid-December, the ‘scene’ is set, and includes a look at the landscape preceding the rise of trees. It then moves on to the Silurian, Devonian and Carboniferous periods, characterised by the appearance of the likes of scale trees, seed ferns and calamites…. and the swamp forests that gave rise to the production of coal.
The mid-December to 31 January half focuses on the Permian period, including Gondwana before its eventual breakup, and the beautiful, strange, gymnosperm Glossopteris that was widespread in the ancient southern continents. It then, finally, progresses to the world of ‘living fossils’ such as ginkgo and the even more primitive horsetails.
A public talk associated with the display will be held at the Tree House on 2 December.

Treehouse Visitor Centre
1 Nov 2025 to 31 January 2026
Monday - Friday 9am - 4pm
Weekends & Public holidays 10am - 4pm
Closed Christmas Day
Free

events.id: Colossal Squid: Freaky Features-Cobblestones Museum & Early Settlers Village, 169 Main Street, Greytown-Event Finder
events.name: Colossal Squid: Freaky Features
events.venue: Cobblestones Museum & Early Settlers Village, 169 Main Street, Greytown
events.long_description:
Colossal Squid: Freaky Features comes to Cobblestones, Greytown

The ever-popular Te Papa exhibition Colossal Squid Ngu Tipua opens at Cobblestones on 11th December 2025 and runs through until 1st February 2026.

The Colossal Squid is so rarely seen that only eight adult colossal squid have ever been scientifically reported. Now venue name, in co-operation with Te Papa, is set to reveal some of the fascinating science and wonderful secrets of one of New Zealand’s most significant natural history specimens.

Te Papa's Head of Natural History, Phil Edgar, said, “In learning about this weird and mysterious creature, we hope visitors will have a greater appreciation for life in the deep sea, much of which remains undiscovered.”

The Colossal Squid is one of the most iconic specimens at Te Papa, and while touring the complete specimen is impossible, some of the important parts of the squid have found their way to Cobblestones.
Te Papa’s Curator of Invertebrates, Dr Rodrigo Salvador, explains how important the Colossal Squid has been for the science community, and how popular it has been among the public.

“Te Papa’s Colossal Squid has been a major source of information for scientists and the museum’s most popular exhibit since its debut. They live in the deep Antarctic waters, and despite being one of the largest invertebrate species in existence, they are very rarely captured”.

Colossal Squid Ngu Tipua centres around an interactive table displaying many different objects, including the lens from an eye of the Colossal Squid, part of a tentacle, and a complete tiny squid, a miniature of its colossal relative. Touchable rotating models of a squid’s tentacle hook and the Colossal Squid's beak are also on display.

The exhibition also displays two documentaries which show life in the depths of the Southern Ocean, and how the most complete Colossal Squid ever found ended up at Te Papa.

The public can continue the experience and learn beyond the exhibition with a new Te Papa press book for children, Whiti: Colossal Squid of the Deep, and online Te Papa resources, including a free downloadable Colossal Squid Activity Book.

“Thanks to the support of WBS and Te Papa, Cobblestones is delighted to be bringing this fascinating exhibition to Wairarapa during the summer holidays. It’s a must-see exhibition for the young and young at heart to learn about this fascinating creature, its world, and habitat.”

Colossal Squid Ngu Tipua is developed and toured by the Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa.

For further information, please contact:
Cobblestones Museum - 063049687 or cobblestonesmuseumgreytown@gmail.com

events.id: Michelangelo - A Different View-Tākina Wellington Convention Centre, 50 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Michelangelo - A Different View
events.venue: Tākina Wellington Convention Centre, 50 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington
events.long_description:
Last 4pm last entry

Under license from the Vatican Museums, this exhibition offers the most complete and authentic reproduction of Michelangelo’s beautiful ceiling frescoes of the Sistine Chapel to be shown outside the Vatican.

Featuring over 50 stunning pieces, including a life-sized reproduction of The Genesis, famously painted on the Sistine Chapel ceiling. But instead of craning your neck to look up, A Different View invites you to experience Michelangelo’s genius from an entirely new perspective – from above and up close.

This immersive experience, completed with guided audio, allows visitors to admire every intricate detail of Michelangelo’s work, many from just two metres away – offering a far more intimate and comfortable viewing experience than the Vatican itself, where some 20,000 people queue daily for a glimpse.

With no time constraints, visitors can allow these masterpieces to truly soak in.

As an addition to – and to complete – Michelangelo — A Different View, reproductions of 14 of these impressive frescoes await visitors inside the exhibition. Scenes from the lives of Jesus and Moses, painted by Sandro Botticelli, Pietro Perugino, Domenico Ghirlandaio and Cosimo Rosselli, provide additional historical background and allow for a deeper insight into this epoch.

Enhancing the exhibition further, VIP guided tours will be led by Dr Christopher Longhurst, a theologian and aesthete who served for 17 years as an operatore didattico at the Sistine Chapel, St Peter’s Basilica, and the Vatican Museums' Papal Art Galleries.

* Booking and credit card fees apply

events.id: Informal field trip - ramarama mapping and Gastrodia spotting-43 Woodmancote Rd, Khandallah, Wellington 6035, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Informal field trip - ramarama mapping and Gastrodia spotting
events.venue: 43 Woodmancote Rd, Khandallah, Wellington 6035, New Zealand
events.long_description:
I'm getting a head start on a New Year's resolution to do more botany. If you're in Wellington over the break, Ben and I are planning to map the ramarama in Khandallah Park and see how they are doing. I've also never seen a Gastrodia orchid and they should be visible at this time, so we'll hunt for that too.
This will probably be 2-3 hours, mostly off-track and probably with a bit of scrambling about.
Meet at the park entrance in Woodmancote Rd. If you are coming by public transport, let me know and if needed we can tweak the start time so you can get there.

events.name: Matiu-Somes Island Trip
events.venue: Matiu / Somes Island,Lower Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Matiu-Somes Island Trip
Join our club trip across to Matiu-Somes Island. Enjoy a pot luck lunch with time to explore the island before conducting an underwater clean up dive by the wharf (conditions permitting).

After a BBQ dinner it is time for a walk before dessert to observe the Little Blue Penguins returning to their nests at sunset and to hunt for Giant Weta and Tuatara.

Sunday morning is a great time to relax, continue exploring the island before the boats arrive and to conduct a beach clean up before catching a ferry home.

This is a great experience for the whole family.

$100pp + Ferry

events.id: Porirua Parkrun-Bothamley Park, Champion Street, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: Porirua Parkrun
events.venue: Bothamley Park, Champion Street, Porirua - Mana
events.long_description:
What is Porirua parkrun? It is a free 5km walk or run event - It’s not about coming first or winning. You can go at your own pace and just enjoy being with other people. It is inclusive and the perfect way to start your weekend in the outdoors chatting to people.

The start occurs just upstream of the Bothamley Park carpark. This car park is off Champion street, opposite the intersection with Windley Street. Head to end of carpark where the concrete ends and there is a gate. For location see https://goo.gl/maps/wEohfp9bRu82.

The course is following the old coach road (circa 1870's) established for the early farms in the area. Today this historic track is located within a park, away from cars and now used by walkers, runners and cyclists.

The track is generally 3 metres wide with a gentle gradient and a compacted gravel surface beside the Kenepuru Stream through a picturesque wooded wild valley. (Note there is a pinch point for a short section after the 2km marker where participants need to go single file each direction for approx 30 metres)

The valley runs east-west with mature trees which means this has to be one of the most sheltered places, out of the wind to exercise in Wellington.

What does it cost to join in? Nothing - it's free! but please register before your first run or walk, so you can get your timing results. You only need to register with parkrun once, to participate at any of the parkrun events around the world. Don't forget to bring a copy of your barcode. If you forget it, you won't get a time.

How fast do I have to be? Walking is fine as long as you can finish the 5km. Please come along and join in whatever your pace!

One dog per adult is welcome, as long as it is on a short hand held lead.

Children welcome but those 10 years and under need to be kept within arms reach of a supervising adult.

Note there is no toilets in the park, so go before you go.

We're friendly! Every week we grab a post park run/walk coffee/tea at Get Fixed within Kai Tahi at 20 Parumoana Street, to mix exercise with socialising.

There are volunteering opportunities even week. So those doing Duke of Edinburgh or similar challenges can get volunteer credits. Ensure you contact us well in advance at "porirua@parkrun.co.nz"

events.id: Caravan & Boat Demolition Derby + Manawatu Super Saloon & Minisprint Champs-85 Cuba Street, New Zealand 4410,85 Cuba St, Palmerston North 4410, New Zealand, Palmerston North-All Events In
events.name: Caravan & Boat Demolition Derby + Manawatu Super Saloon & Minisprint Champs
events.venue: 85 Cuba Street, New Zealand 4410,85 Cuba St, Palmerston North 4410, New Zealand, Palmerston North
events.long_description:
Caravan & Boat Demolition Derby + Manawatu Super Saloon & Minisprint Champs
Saturday 27th December sees another night full of variety at the Robertson Prestige International Speedway from 6:30pm. Headlining the meeting will be the spectacular DMR Metal Recyclers Caravan & Boat Derby plus the Manawatu Super Saloon Champs and the Manawatu Minisprint Champs with support from SuperStocks, and the future of Speedway Youth Ministocks.

The Manawatu Super Saloon Championship will have you on the edge of your seat with their wide tyres, V8 engines and distinctive low sportscar bodies, these drivers are impressive racing wheel-to-wheel every lap! The racing is exhilarating from these drivers, with local Super Saloon drivers including Peter Bengston, Brendan Sharland and Martin Halcrow all looking to make sure that the title honours stay in town!

The Manawatu Minisprint Championship will be hotly contested with local drivers looking to make their mark including Glen McCutcheon, Nathan Jefferies, Daniel Nickel and if the competition wasn’t hot enough, there’s the Stratford & Wanganui competitors who will no doubt have a shot at the title. With a strong contingent of travelling drivers, this championship title is really going to come down to the wire!

Superstocks will be also hitting the dirt with many drivers doing their final tuning for the upcoming New Zealand Superstock Championship at Wellington Speedway. The fast and spectacular racing from speedway's glamour class should not be missed!

Rounding out a massive night of racing is the DMR Metal Recyclers Caravan & Boat Demolition Derby. There is nothing quite like watching Caravans and Boats bashing and crashing around the speedway oval! This crazy event is always great family entertainment and will leave you in fits of laughter. It makes it a memorable evening at the Robertson Prestige International Speedway.

Please note: No Stockcars due to North Island Stockcar Championship at Rotorua Speedway.

Classes in action are SuperStocks, Super Saloons, Minisprints, Youth Ministocks – PN Registered Cars Only.

Drivers, please follow the below link to register your intention to race on the 27th of December 2025:

https://www.pnspeedway.co.nz/forms/27-12-2025

Admission prices are $30 for an Adult (16 years and over), $10 for Children aged 8-15, and $70 for a Family pass of 2 adults and up to four children. Kids aged 7 and under are FREE.

Tickets are available to pre-purchase online from https://www.eventfinda.co.nz, (tickets purchased incur an additional service fee) or on race day from Gate 1 (Waldegrave Street), Gate 2 (Cuba Street - Bridge) and Gate 3 (Cook Street) from 5pm.

Racing starts 6.30pm.

Click here to view a full list of the Arena terms and conditions of entry https://venuespn.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Terms-and-Conditions-of-Entry-2023.pdf

events.venue: Hindu Murugan Temple, 3 Batchelor St, Newlands, Wellington 6037, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Note: Those who are keen to take Paal Kudam, please bring one bottle of milk and meet us at the temple by 5:45 PM.
Irumudi Significance:
The Irumudi is a sacred bundle carried by devotees to Lord Ayyappa Swamy, symbolizing purity, devotion, and surrender. Carrying the Irumudi while observing the 41-day vratham (austerities, prayers, and self-discipline) is considered highly auspicious, bringing spiritual growth, inner strength, and divine blessings.

events.venue: Ranui Essentials, 284c Dry River Road, Martinborough
events.long_description:
Enchanting Lavender Picking & Stargazing with 'Under the Stars'

Discover the Magic of Martinborough Nights!

Join us for an extraordinary evening of lavender picking and stargazing. Bring your telescope, torch, blankets, and an evening picnic to immerse yourself in the breathtaking night sky.
Our expert Astronomy Guides from 'Under the Stars' will lead you through the constellations, making the night sky come alive.

Watch the sun set over the lavender fields, pick your own bunch of lavender, and explore our charming lavender shop. Indulge in delightful lavender treats that will tantalize your taste buds.

Limited tickets available – only 200 per night!

Entry: $25 per Adult (includes stargazing and a bunch of lavender). Kids enter free!

Please note: No pets and no smoking allowed.

In case of unfavorable stargazing conditions, we will contact you on the day to offer a refund or reschedule.

events.id: Kapiti Cubers Holiday Special 2025-Coastlands Aquatic Centre,10 Brett Ambler Way, Paraparaumu, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Kapiti Cubers Holiday Special 2025
events.venue: Coastlands Aquatic Centre,10 Brett Ambler Way, Paraparaumu, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Kapiti Cubers Holiday Special 2025
Kapiti Cubers Holiday Special 2025. Register today. :)

About this Event


This is an extended holiday edition of our usual meetup (found here) for all cubers who will be staying in the Wellington region during the holidays (or happen to be in Wellington).


Welcome to all passionate speed cube enthusiasts on the Kapiti Coast and greater Wellington region! This is a safe space for anyone interested in solving cubes and other similar puzzles, and to share their passion with other speedcubers in the local cubing community.
The community is a supportive and enthusiastic group, and our meetups offer a space to connect in a fun and enjoyable way.
Our meetings comprise fun social activities centred around cubing including mini-competitions, tips and tricks, and introductions to different cube puzzles.
The meetings are geared towards folks who can already solve a cube, but all skill levels are most welcome.


Event Notes:
Please bring your cube and timing device (this can even be a phone), thanks!


Keep up to date on future Kapiti Cubers updates:
Sign up to our mailing list or follow one of our online profiles listed here.

events.id: Monthly Life Drawing-Te Pūkenga Whakaata The New Zealand Portrait , Shed 11, 60 Lady Elizabeth Lane, Queens Wharf, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Monthly Life Drawing
events.venue: Te Pūkenga Whakaata The New Zealand Portrait , Shed 11, 60 Lady Elizabeth Lane, Queens Wharf, Wellington
events.long_description:
Come along and have a go at portraiture with our koha life drawing sessions, hosted monthly at the Gallery.

With a mix of timed short and long poses, you are invited to bring your own materials or use the basic supplies we provide.

The sessions run from 2 pm to 4 pm—please arrive early to set up. We'll take a short kaputī break halfway through. This is a koha event, with all contributions going directly to our models. Friends and whānau are welcome!

Interested in modeling? Contact us—we're always looking for sitters. Everyone is welcome to join!

Accessibility Information: The New Zealand Portrait Gallery is an accessible venue, all on one level. There is an accessible wharepaku at the back of the venue. The gallery has automatic sliding doors and glass doors that can be pushed or pulled to enter. We have a wheelchair available for use within the gallery, and there is low stool seating throughout. If you have any questions regarding accessibility or if there is something we could do to make your visit easier, please get in touch.

events.id: Courtenay Carnival--Wellington NZ
events.name: Courtenay Carnival
events.long_description:
Celebrate Wellington’s unique spirit at a big New Year’s Eve party in the city’s entertainment district. Courtenay Carnival is set to bring thousands together for a vibrant, free, family-friendly celebration in the heart of the city. This year, Courtenay Place, Allen Street, and Blair Street will be closed from 6 am on 31 December until 6 am on 1 January 2026, creating space for a street party with live music, colour, and community energy. 
The New Year’s Eve event will feature a dynamic entertainment lineup across multiple stages, showcasing exciting performers from Aotearoa. Headline acts include Indigenous rockers Bitterly Divine, afrobeat/jazz dance collective Star Time, party legends Loveshack, and late-night brass band Saxy Time. Local favourites Wellington Batucada and Estudio de Samba Wellington bring big rhythm and colour. Drag artists, circus performers, entertainment for kids, and MC Mamaeroa Munn (Mo) keep the energy high all night. 
Enjoy delicious food and drinks from local venues at Eat Street, soak up the vibrant atmosphere, and join thousands of Wellingtonians counting down to 2026 together.

events.long_description:
Ring in the New Year at Meow Nui with Wellington legends Fur Patrol & The Phoenix Foundation, then dance the night away with disco wünderkind You Should Be Dancing.
Auld lang syne, what does it mean? We just don’t know and maybe we never will. BUT there’s no better way to see out 2025 than by cutting sick with your homies with two of the best bloody bands this god forsaken country has ever produced.
Meow Nui is proud to present an unforgettable New Year’s Eve celebration featuring Fur Patrol (the best) and The Phoenix Foundation (also the best), together for one epic night. A double bill, to fulfil your will. WELLINGTONS NOT DEAD! It’s alive ALIVE I TELL YOU. Expect big tunes, good vibes, and a dance floor that just won’t quit, with special guest DJ You Should Be Dancing spinning through to 2026.

events.id: Wellington New Year’s Eve 2025-Whairepo Lagoon, Wellington-Wellington NZ
events.name: Wellington New Year’s Eve 2025
events.venue: Whairepo Lagoon, Wellington
events.long_description:
A Wellington New Year’s Eve on the waterfront is like no other. To kick off the evening, a court of food trucks will be open at Odlin’s Plaza from 3pm, providing delicious kai throughout the night. As the light begins to leave the sky, magical lighting illuminates the lagoon. Then the festivities begin with live music at 8pm — all the crowd-pleasers and feel-good tunes to boogie to. After that, little ones can enjoy a kids’ countdown and fireworks at 9:30pm. From 10pm, Orchestra Wellington will take the stage and play us all the way to midnight. The New Year’s countdown will be followed by a 5-minute fireworks display to welcome 2026. 
As the first country on earth to herald in the New Year, it’s our responsibility to do it right. Don’t forget your New Year’s Resolutions and your dancing shoes.

events.long_description:
New Year’s Eve in The Square
Ring in 2026 with an unforgettable night of celebration in the heart of Palmy.

Whether you’ve got little ones or you’re staying up to welcome in the new year, this free, family friendly, alcohol-free event has something for everyone.

What’s on:
- Live music from CS House Band, Tom Knowles and The Full Noise Boys, and Superset
- MCs from Rollicking Entertainment will keep attendees on their toes
- Bouncy castles, face painting, and more activities for the kids
- Food trucks and local vendors

There will be two fireworks displays:
- 9.30pm – for families with young kids
- Midnight – to welcome 2026 in style

Bring your picnic blanket or chair and settle in for a fun night with friends, whānau, and the Palmy community.

Radio Active Presents
NUI Years Eve

Ring in the New Year at Meow Nui with Wellington legends Fur Patrol & The Phoenix Foundation, then dance the night away with disco wünderkid You Should Be Dancing.

A double bill, to fulfil your will. WELLINGTONS NOT DEAD! It’s alive, ALIVE I TELL YOU. Expect big tunes, good vibes, and a dance floor that just won’t quit, with special guest DJ You Should Be Dancing spinning through to 2026.

events.id: Seaside Sloths NYE at Long Beach Tavern-40 Tutere Street, New Zealand 5036,40 Tutere St, Waikanae Beach, Waikanae 5036, New Zealand, Waikanae-All Events In
events.name: Seaside Sloths NYE at Long Beach Tavern
events.venue: 40 Tutere Street, New Zealand 5036,40 Tutere St, Waikanae Beach, Waikanae 5036, New Zealand, Waikanae
events.long_description:
Seaside Sloths NYE at Long Beach Tavern
Another year has somehow vanished quicker than a jandal in the surf… which is ironic, because if anyone has been preaching “slow down, bro” since day one, it’s Seaside Sloths. But here we are again — 365 days gone in the blink of a sluggish, slightly confused eye.

To mark the occasion, the Sloths are dragging their sandy selves out of the dunes and onto Long Beach — a venue so appropriately named it almost feels like destiny. Some say this is the natural habitat of a Seaside Sloth. Others claim the Sloths only appear when the tides, moon cycles and bar tabs align. All we know is they’re preparing a sonic experience large enough to usher in the new year, and weird enough to make you question if time really is real.

Expect bass that rolls in like a slow swell, guitar licks warmer than a Kāpiti sunset, and grooves that may cause involuntary swaying — possibly from dancing, possibly from the humidity, possibly from an existential moment about how fast 2025 disappeared.

So bring your mates, your jandals, your best “I’m not ready for another year but here we go” attitude — and join us on the Long Beach shoreline as we ring in a new year the only way we know how!

events.long_description:
Wellingtons biggest New Years Eve party is back at Brewtown.
Celebrate Brew Years Eve with the ultimate party night of legendary Kiwi anthems, wall to wall bangers and classic 80s hits on a night where the dancefloor never stops.

A New Years Eve celebration like no other, back by popular demand Dragon and The Jordan Luck Band, joined by The Automatic 80s & The Blueprint smashing out all the big party tunes you know & love.

The Soundtrack to Your Night
Our epic lineup will take you back in time with all your classic favourites:
Dragon — get ready for timeless anthems like April Sun in Cuba and Rain.
The Jordan Luck Band — Kiwi sing-alongs like Why Does Love Do This to Me and Victoria.
The Automatic 80s — taking you back with the biggest 80s dancefloor hits.
The Blueprint — Wellington's best rock covers band taking you through to midnight.

Say goodbye to 2025 with a bang — party with us as we transform Brewtown's covered Greenspace into a full-blown New Year’s Eve Party, packed with live music, massive party vibes, and all the magic to make your countdown unforgettable.

This isn’t just another night out — it’s Wellington’s biggest party of the year!

So round up your crew, grab your tickets, and get ready for confetti blasts, big sing-alongs, and festival-scale fun as we count down to midnight together.

events.id: Courtenay Carnival - The Biggest Dress Up Party in the Universe-Courtenay Place, Tennyson Street, Wellington, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Courtenay Carnival - The Biggest Dress Up Party in the Universe
events.venue: Courtenay Place, Tennyson Street, Wellington, Wellington
events.long_description:
Wellington’s most electric street celebration is back! The Courtenay Carnival transforms Courtenay Place into a dazzling hub of music, food, dance, and community spirit. From day to night, experience an unforgettable fusion of live performances, street eats, parades, and cultural showcases—all in the heart of the capital’s entertainment district.
What to Expect
Live Stages & Street Performers – From DJs to drumlines, salsa to soul, and everything in between, Courtenay Place bursts with energy. Expect a vibrant mix of circus performers, roaming comedy acts, drag artistry, and pop-up surprises throughout the precinct.
Entertainment Lineup
• Kids Disco – A fun, high-energy dance zone for tamariki.
• Circus & Comedy Acts – Jugglers, acrobats, and comedians bringing laughter and spectacle.
• Drag Performances – Bold, colourful, and high-impact performances lighting up the street.
• Wellington Batucada – The iconic Brazilian drum ensemble leading parades and igniting the crowd.
• Startime Band – Feel-good party classics to get everyone dancing.
• Love Shack – A crowd favourite delivering big vibes and nostalgic bangers.
• Saxy Time – Bringing funky grooves and late-night energy to keep the party pumping.
Food, Flavour & Street Eats – Local venues spill out onto the street with special menus, pop-up tastings, and signature Wellington flavours. From quick bites to sit-down favourites, there’s something for everyone.
Parades & Cultural Showcases – Experience vibrant cultural performances, community groups, dancers, and musicians celebrating the diversity of Pōneke.
Family-Friendly Zones – With entertainment for all ages, Courtenay Carnival is designed to keep families engaged from day to night.

events.name: New Year's Eve Set Menu at Hippo
events.venue: Hippopotamus Restaurant and Bar, Level 3, 90 Cable Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Hippo’s turning the New Year’s Eve celebration up a notch. We’re ready to toast the year that was (and is) the only way we know how — with a little harbour sparkle, a lot of flavour, and a healthy dose of Hippo charm.

Join us for a three-course set menu by Chef Antoine featuring your choice of one of three dishes per course. Each plate blends classic French technique with the best of New Zealand’s produce.

Kick things off with Champagne on arrival, dance to the beat of live music, and the kind of flavour that keeps the night flowing.

It’s time to celebrate new beginnings, old friends, new friends and the magic of being back together — the Hippo way.

Tickets are $119 per adult for a 1.5-hour session from 5:30pm – 9:30pm (last sitting), open until late.

Seats are limited. Book your spot and bring in the New Year with a little extra flair.

events.id: Grand New Year's Dinner Dance-Tirohana Estate Vineyard, 42 Puruatanga Rd, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Grand New Year's Dinner Dance
events.venue: Tirohana Estate Vineyard, 42 Puruatanga Rd, Martinborough
events.long_description:
This traditional Tirohana event is back by popular demand.

Held in the elegant Grand Marquee with its French doors, clear window walls, sparkling lit ceiling and Italian fountain courtyard, guests will enjoy a seven course meal (dietary requirements catered for) accompanied by live music from the Neemia family, featuring New Zealand favourite, Drew Ne'emia.

The procession of the haggis is a highlight of the night, as is counting down to midnight and Auld Land Syne with party poppers and noise makers. Dance between courses or make new friends if you would like to share a table with others, or enjoy your own company with your favourite person or friends/family group.

Suitable for couples as well as small or large groups, this event sells out well in advance so please secure your table now and bring in 2026 with the Tirohana team.

Transfers via the courtesy shuttle available from accommodation in Martinborough.

events.id: WELLINGTON NEW YEAR’S EVE 2026 BAR CRAWL | Wellington NYE 2026 Event-TBA-All Events In
events.name: WELLINGTON NEW YEAR’S EVE 2026 BAR CRAWL | Wellington NYE 2026 Event
events.venue: TBA
events.long_description:
WELLINGTON NEW YEAR’S EVE 2026 BAR CRAWL | Wellington NYE 2026 Event
Don't Miss Wellington's Biggest Club Crawl of The Year, New Year's Eve 2026 on Wednesday, December 31st @ 4 Premium Clubs

About this Event


🎉✨ WELLINGTON NEW YEAR'S EVE 2026 CLUB CRAWL ✨🎉
Ring in the New Year at Wellington’s Biggest and Hottest NYE Club Crawl! Celebrate New Year’s Eve 2026 with exclusive access to 4 top venues on Wednesday, December 31st, 2025!
This upscale, high-energy club crawl takes you through Wellington’s premier nightlife destinations — all just steps apart. Experience the city’s vibrant party scene, hop between top venues, and celebrate the countdown in style at the final stop as you welcome 2026 in unforgettable fashion!
🎶 Enjoy Top-40, Hip-Hop, R&B, and Live Music
📍 Crawl Stops: TBA — Full lineup of venues to be announced soon!
🕙 Doors Open at 7:00 PM at the first check-in location (TBA)
🎟 Tickets start at $30 Early Bird – grab yours now before early bird prices are gone!





What’s Included in Your Ticket:
🎊 Join Hundreds of NYE Revelers
🚫 No Cover for All Participating Clubs
🎆 Exclusive NYE 2026 Wristband for Club Crawl Access
📱 NYE Crawl Map for Easy Navigation 🗺️
🎵 Live DJs Spinning Wellington’s Hottest Tracks
🥂 Celebration and Countdown to 2026 at the Final Venue


🚨 Get Tickets NOW Before Prices Increase! 🚨
⭐ Voted Wellington’s #1 New Year’s Eve Club Crawl 3 Years Running! This isn’t just a night out — it’s the ultimate NYE experience where you and your crew kick off 2026 with unforgettable memories.
Meet new people, party across Wellington’s hottest clubs, and feel the electric energy that only a true downtown countdown can deliver.
🔥 Nonstop music, packed dance floors, and champagne at midnight — this is how Wellington celebrates! Don’t miss the city’s most anticipated NYE event. Grab your tickets, dress to impress, and let the countdown to 2026 begin!

🚫🍸🔑 Celebrate Responsibly!
We DO NOT condone drinking and driving. Use Uber, Lyft, get a Taxi, or a designated driver to ensure a safe ride home. Celebrate responsibly and make it a New Year to remember!
🎉 Let the WELLINGTON NYE 2026 CLUB CRAWL begin!


100% CANCELLATION REFUND GUARANTEE
👌 If the event is canceled for any reason, all tickets will be refunded in full! No vouchers, no credits, just your money back in your bank! Guaranteed!


WRISTBAND PICKUP INSTRUCTIONS & POLICY
Where and When to Pick Up Wristbands
📍 Check-In Venue: TBA
🕒 7:00 PM – 10:00 PM
Details: Please arrive at our first stop to scan your ticket and collect your wristband. You have from 7:00 PM to 10:00 PM to check in and pick up your wristband for the night. You can stay at this venue until 10:00 PM or explore other participating stops once announced.
OPTIONAL STOPS:
📍 TBA
🕒 8:00 PM – 10:00 PM
📍 TBA
🕒 8:00 PM – 10:00 PM
Details: These are optional stops — you can visit any of them at your leisure between 8:00 PM and 10:00 PM once they’re announced.
FINAL VENUES:
📍 TBA
🕒 10:00 PM – 2:00 AM
Details: This is the final stop! Everyone should meet here by 10:00 PM and stay for the massive NYE countdown party featuring live DJs, dancing, and a midnight champagne toast.
Please note: A Taxi/Uber/Lyft may be required for some stops. The crawl does not provide transportation or shuttle services between venues.
Wristband Policy
This is an open-format crawl. You must start at the first venue to collect your wristband. Once you have your wristband, you can visit any participating venues labeled as “Optional Venue” at your convenience between 8:00 PM and 10:00 PM or stay at the wristband venue. After 10:00 PM, all participants will meet at the final venue to celebrate and ring in the New Year together (marked as ‘The Final Stop’ below).
Please remember that you need to collect your wristband at the first stop, as it is required for entry into all venues except the first one. Also, wristbands are no longer available after 10:00pm at the first venue.


2025 CRAWL MAP AVAILABLE NOW:
TBA





TIPS FOR OUR CRAWL
Pick Up Wristbands On Time: Collect your wristband(s) during the designated time at the scheduled venues before 10:00PM. Latecomers won’t be accommodated – no wristband, no entry.
Assign a Proxy if Needed: Can't make the check-in? Have a friend pick up your wristband to ensure you don’t miss out.
Note Club Schedule: Each venues’s scheduled times are listed in the "DIGITAL BAR LIST." Wristbands (for entry) and any applicable drink specials apply only during these times.
Day-Of Check: Review the "DIGITAL CRAWL MAP" on the event morning for any last-minute details or venue changes.
_______________________________________


IMPORTANT DISCLAIMERS
Age Requirement: You must be 18 years or older with a valid government-issued ID to participate in this event. No exceptions.
Wristbands: Your wristband is your key to entry. You must present your ticket or QR code at check-in to receive your wristband. Wristbands must be worn at all times to access participating bars and venues. No wristband, no entry.
Ticket Policy: All sales are final—no refunds, exchanges, or transfers. In case of event cancellation without a rescheduled date, a refund (excluding fees) will be automatically issued. Event lineup, venues, and specials are subject to change without notice.
Responsible Drinking: Please drink responsibly. We promote a safe, fun environment, but remember, no one should drink and drive. Use designated drivers or rideshare services. Participating venues reserve the right to refuse service or entry to any attendee based on intoxication or inappropriate behaviour. No refunds will be given if you are denied entry for any of these reasons.
Capacity and Late Entry: Some venues may hit capacity during the event. If a venue reaches capacity or you arrive late, you may have to wait in line to gain entry. There is no guarantee of immediate access or entry to any specific venue once capacity is reached, and no refunds will be provided due to waiting times or access issues.
Respect & Conduct: Treat others and the event venues with respect. Disorderly conduct, inappropriate behaviour, or damage to the venues will result in removal from the event without a refund. The participating bars reserve the right to refuse entry or remove attendees for inappropriate behaviour at any time.
Liability Waiver: By purchasing a ticket and participating in the crawl, you acknowledge that you are attending at your own risk. Events Per Se, its affiliates, venues, staff, and organizers are not liable for any injuries, accidents, death, loss, or damage that may occur during the event.
Event Changes: Bars and venues may change, but the event will continue rain or shine. Be sure to check your email for any last-minute updates.
*By purchasing a ticket, you agree to these terms and conditions and accept the inherent risks involved in attending.

events.id: Time for Shenanigans on New Years Eve: CANCELLED-The Empire, 175 Jackson St, Petone, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Time for Shenanigans on New Years Eve: CANCELLED
events.venue: The Empire, 175 Jackson St, Petone, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Ring in the New Year at The Empire in Petone With The Shenanigans.

Watch Petone Light up with the Fun and laughter with the talented Band Shenanigans for an Unforgettable night of music, laughter, and dancing as Lower Hutt's biggest New Year's celebrations take over this Iconic Venue.
Be Sure to get in quick with Tickets only $25 it's sure to sell out fast.

From Live Music and A Dazzling Little Light show, this event will "to be sure" send you into next year with a smile.


So come and spend it with us.
Justin, Maurice, Paul And Tom.

And the Wonderful Crew at The Empire We plan to bring back a few of the Memories we all had of the Great Irish Bars we used to play in. Molly's, Kitty's, Murphy's law.

See ya soon Justin
"Tis our Luck to Know ya "

8.30 till 12.15 play time

Shenanigans are one of New Zealand's most accomplished and sought-after bands in Irish Traditional Music today. This young and exciting group creates a sound that is full of energy & innovation, whilst all the time remaining true to their traditional roots.

“Shenanigans was THE breakout band at the Gardens Magic in Wellington NZ".Their energy was infectious and the crowd response was incredible. They were able to connect to all ages, from Mohawked teenagers, to their grandparents. I had heard good things about them, but the musicianship, and stage presence playing live exceeded every expectation I had.” – Alan Thompson Director of Irish music Appreciation society 2013.

Shenanigans garnered much critical acclaim in recent years, even being compared to super groups such as by respected New Zealand Musician Magazine. Their meteoric rise in the music world was given a massive boost in 2011 when they were released their album Live 2005!. Shenanigans subsequently went on to receive the “Best live act on the Good Morning show” from well-respected Tv Presenter and were also named “Best Jokers” at The New Zealand Jokers Awards in 2012.

Following the tremendous success of their debut album “ballyscullymuckery”, the group’s profile was further raised with the release of their follow up title, “Live in your Lounge” in 2018.Nz Musician Magazine described it as having “so many good tracks, so much energy, a band in full control and having such fun yet well able to bring things down to a tearful pause”. Most recently Shenanigans was awarded “Top Band of few” by the a guy down the pub.


Shenanigans is one of New Zealand's hottest bands. Specializing in elegant live preformances, Shenanigans is the perfect choice for your event. Although based in Wellington, we perform regularly throughout the country; including Auckland, Christchurch, and Masterton. Shenanigans is a band seriously worth considering for the best possible wedding music that inspires non-stop dancing. In addition to weddings, we often play at charity events, corporate functions, catered affairs, and private parties. Shenanigans plays the best dance music ever written from the 1930's - present, which includes Irish Classics, Country, Rock-n-Roll, Ethnic, Group Participation, and much more. In addition, we keep our repertoire as cool as we can by constantly learning everyone's favourite songs. This hardworking Wellington wedding band spends a tremendous amount of time learning, reviewing, and ultimately perfecting the music required for each engagement. We play everything live without the artificial computerized support that most of our competitors rely on these days. You will notice that Shenanigans performs every song with a celtic fun twist. There is no better choice for wedding music.

events.id: Trentham Memorial parkrun New Years Day parkrun-Trentham Memorial Park, Holdsworth Avenue, Trentham, New Zealand 5018,43 Holdsworth Ave, Trentham, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand, Upper Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Trentham Memorial parkrun New Years Day parkrun
events.venue: Trentham Memorial Park, Holdsworth Avenue, Trentham, New Zealand 5018,43 Holdsworth Ave, Trentham, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand, Upper Hutt
events.long_description:
Trentham Memorial parkrun New Years Day parkrun
Is there a better way to start a New Year by clearing foggy heads from the night before than a 5km parkrun at the very start of the day?

We think not.

So come join us. Bring all the family. Bring all the friends. Bring all the visitors. Bring everyone. And start your day with a huge dose of endorphins and fresh air to help carry you through the next few hours before you fall back asleep.

And if you're not home for New Years, check out where else you could be doing a New Years Day parkrun in New Zealand
https://www.parkrun.co.nz/special-events/


Its almost certain there will be no Fig Tree Cafe post event breakfast as we're sure they'll be taking a well earned holiday to rest and recover before we start keeping them busy again in 2026. But please stayed tuned because we may be able to find somewhere else to feed us that is also nearby.

events.venue: Waitangi parkrun,68 Oriental Pde, Oriental Bay, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Waitangi parkrun New Year's Day 2026
Don't have any plans for January 1st, 2026? At Waitangi parkrun, we got you covered! Join us to celebrate the arrival the new year! If New Year resolutions is your things or you just want catch up with your friends for a lovely jog/walk on the waterfront, then this event is definitely for you.

Bag your favourite volunteering role if running after celebrating too much the night before is NOT your thing. It's a short gap between January 1st and January 3rd (our next regular event), so we'll definitely need more help to pull this off. Please reach out to or ping us in DMs if you are available.

See you all there!

events.id: Robin Hood - The Pantomime-Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Robin Hood - The Pantomime
events.venue: Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Adventures of the original working-class hero and man in tights!

Robin Hood steals from the rich and gives to the poor in an oldie timey place where people are struggling and homeless and the landed gentry hoard the money all for themselves – Wellington 2025.

Robin must stop the Evil Sheriff from running roughshod over the citizens! But this quest is far from easy… there is archery, swordfights, and a lot of dance numbers to get through. Our hero is grateful for help from spies on the inside: Maid Marion, and her bolshie Nanny (Pantomime Dame Jthan Morgan).

Come one and come all to see the slings and arrows of outrageous panto!


Written by Simon Leary & Gavin Rutherford
Directed by Gavin Rutherford
Musical Direction and Arrangements by Michael Nicholas Williams

events.id: Upper Hutt Forage fun!-Harcourt Park J1,Norbert Street, Upper Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Upper Hutt Forage fun!
events.venue: Harcourt Park J1,Norbert Street, Upper Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Upper Hutt Forage fun!
Wild FORAGING. 1.5 hours, in-person, foraging with PREPPER KIWI.

About this Event

WILD FORAGE UPPER HUTT!
Join us for an exciting 1.5 hour in-person WILD FORAGE ADVENTURE!
Learn how to bring WILD THINGS into everyday life.
PREPPER KIWI will guide you through the process of finding and identifying plants from her 100 WILD THINGS list. This survival list is specific to New Zealand and includes introduced and native plants.
The forage covers:
Identification of key medicinal and food herbs from 100 WILD THINGS LIST
Printed 100 WILD THINGS LIST
This in-person event is a great opportunity to connect with fellow herb enthusiast and expand your knowledge of natural remedies and plant identification. Don't miss out!




ABOUT THE VENUE:
Harcourt park - Meeting point is at the front of the toilets
Walk is beginner level but will still require a good level of fitness
WHAT TO BRING:
Comfortable clothes and sensible shoes




TRADITIONAL MEDICINAL HERBS IN THIS AREA:
Angiangi -- Artist conc-- Beggar's tick--Bittercress--Bush lawyer-- Castor oil plant-- Chickweed --Cleavers--Comfrey-- Dandelion-- English violet-- European centaury--Fat hen--Figwort--Flax--Gallant soldier--Hawthorn--Hedge woundwort-- Herb Robert--Houhere (lacebark)-- Japanese Honeysuckle--Kawakawa--Kanuka Karamu--Koromiko--Loquat--Makomako--Mamaku--Manuka--Mullein--Mugwort--Nipplewort--Onion W**d-- Opium lettuce-- Puha --Plantain--Red clover--Selfheal--Shepards purse--St Johns wort--Turkey tail--Willow--Wild carrot--Wild fennel

events.id: Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary Open Day 25/26-Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary, Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary, Ōtaki-Event Finder
events.name: Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary Open Day 25/26
events.venue: Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary, Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary, Ōtaki
events.long_description:
Join us for a Tour of the Sanctuary

Open days include a tour of the sanctuary to meet the animals, learn about them, their stories and how we look after them, followed by a vegan afternoon tea. Money raised from ticket sales help us with the ongoing care of our animals. We will also happily accept donations of fruit, veggies, or hay for the animals.

Please note open days are weather dependent and in the event of rain we will normally rearrange to the following saturday.

Please arrive between 12:30 and 1pm- bring strong closed-toe footwear, sunblock, and clothing for all weather. No animal food products are allowed on the sanctuary grounds as we are a human vegan space. Sadly, dogs are not welcome as we have a lot of vulnerable animals on site. Depending on the weather, your clothing and footwear might get muddy, so please wear clothing that isn’t too precious.

If you have questions about accessibility please these questions email us before you arrive. Unfortunately, the sanctuary is not wheelchair accessible.

Make a day of it!- we are 5 mins away from some lovely river spots on the Ōtaki river and 20 mins from Ōtaki town and beach.
events.description:
Join us for a Tour of the Sanctuary Open days include a tour of the sanctuary to meet the animals, learn about them, their stories and how we look after them, followed by a vegan afternoon tea.
Money raised from ticket sales help us with the ongoing care of our animals.
We will also happily accept donations of fruit, veggies, or hay for the animals.
Please arrive between 12:30 and 1pm- bring strong closed-toe footwear, sunblock, and clothing for all weather.
No animal food products are allowed on the sanctuary grounds as we are a human vegan space.

Get ready for one of New Zealand's premier sprint races on the Champagne Turf.

About this Event

TAB Telegraph Day kicks off the NZCIS Wellington Cup Carnival in style. The day features the $550,000 Group 1 TAB Telegraph, one of the fastest sprints in the southern hemisphere, run down the iconic TAB Chute.
Enjoy a great day of racing on the Champagne Turf with free general admission, or upgrade your experience with one of our hospitality options. Fast-paced racing, thrilling finishes, and an exciting atmosphere make it a day not to miss.

Space Place welcomes anyone who requires a low-sensory environment, including neurodivergent, Takiwātanga Autistic people, and sensory sensitive people.

General admission fees apply. This event has limited capacity, we encourage booking to secure your place.

events.id: Small Dog Social - First Sunday of the month - LATER TIME - 3:30pm-4:30pm (during spring and summer)-Mcewan Park,24 Marine Pde, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Small Dog Social - First Sunday of the month - LATER TIME - 3:30pm-4:30pm (during spring and summer)
events.venue: Mcewan Park,24 Marine Pde, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Small Dog Social - First Sunday of the month - LATER TIME - 3:30pm-4:30pm (during spring and summer)
The Small Dog Social Walk is on the first Sunday of the month, meeting at 3:30pm during spring/summer.

The meetup will gather for free play from 3.30pm in the back half McEwan Park at Hikoikoi Reserve, Petone Beach, with the walk along the beach and back starting around 4:00pm. After the walk, feel free to hang around and let the dogs play some more.

Water bowl and poo bag bin provided!

Closest street address for GPS is 38 Marine Parade, Petone - we meet in the field across the road! There is plenty of parking along this street.

October - March - Summer time of 3:30 - 4:30
April - September - Winter time of 2:30 - 3:30

Time changes with Daylight Saving Time.

PLEASE DO NOT GATHER ON THE FRONT FIELD
On arrival, please come straight to the back field. We have had a few dogs running over to the car park in excitement to see their friends, with cars driving around we need to be very careful to keep the pooches safe at all times. If your pooch is not good off lead, please keep it on until everyone has arrived and (if you feel comfortable) then let them off.

This is open to the public, and we welcome anyone who has not been before who would like to join our amazing group of pooches and owners!
We also encourage puppies; this is the perfect place for them to socialise safely.

This group is purely a social group with no formal club functions or responsibilities. The park is also used for Disc Golf, so please watch out for people playing thru.

Anti-social small dogs are welcome. If a muzzle is needed, please ensure that they wear it.

PLEASE NOTE- Your dogs are your responsibility at all times, this includes supervising their behaviour and picking up their poop!

Feel free to post in the event or message the page if you need more info!

events.id: Friends of Karori Cemetery - Tragedies Tour (Jan 2026)-76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Friends of Karori Cemetery - Tragedies Tour (Jan 2026)
events.venue: 76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Come and hear stories of those who met sad, shocking and untimely ends. This tour traverses some of the older parts of the story where historic headstones mark the stories of lives lost too soon: accidents, murder, misadventure and those who fell by their own hand.
This tour contains a number of adult themes and some graphic descriptions so is not suitable for everyone.
Each tour is $10 per person (plus non-refundable booking fee). Children under 12 are free.
Our tour has a maximum capacity of about 15 persons. If there are insufficient tickets remaining for your party, please email us at info@friendsofkaroricemetery.co.nz to check if we can accommodate you.
Please note:
If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you on the day 1 hour before the tour starts by email and on our Facebook page. The booking fee is non-refundable.
This tour is approximately 2 hours long.
Please dress appropriately for the conditions. While we do our best to guide you on a safe walking route, during the winter months the ground can become slippery in places.
Some of our walks require a moderate degree of fitness and are not suited for those with limited mobility.
There is only one toilet which is located by the cemetery office at the main entrance.
If you have purchased tickets for other people can you please pass our tour information on to them as well.
Please meet us at the shelter (shown as the Historic Chapel on the map at the main entrance)
We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.

events.venue: 58 Weggery Drive, Waikanae Beach 5036, New Zealand
events.description:
At Equip Conference, our aim is to train people to understand and teach the word of God.
We get together with Christians from all over NZ, to sing God’s praises and listen to God’s Word.
With support and feedback from pastors and Bible teachers from around the country, we gather in small groups and give you tools to help you understand any part of the Bible and to teach it to others.
We believe Equip Conference will help you read the Bible better yourself and teach it to others.
Our vision is to see people all over Aotearoa, NZ proclaiming the powerful Word of God.

events.id: Yoga in the Park-Waikanae Park, Park Ave, Waikanae-Event Finder
events.name: Yoga in the Park
events.venue: Waikanae Park, Park Ave, Waikanae
events.long_description:
Join us for the 7th year of Yoga in the Park at Waikanae Park on Park Ave!

Our classes focus on balance and stability, incorporating breathing exercises, longer holds, and plenty of options to modify poses based on your fitness level. We’ve had kids join us in past years, and if you consider yourself "older," you’re more than welcome, too. This is your practice, so if you’d rather spend the hour in Child’s Pose, soaking in the sounds of the birds, that’s perfectly fine!

What to bring: A mat or towel, a hat, and some water. I’ll take care of the rest.

Payment Options:
Cash
Bank transfer (online)

Pricing:
$15 for a single class
$150 for an Outdoor Pass (covers the whole season: Nov to March, 21 classes + additional beach yoga sessions starting in 2026)

I can’t wait to see familiar faces and welcome new ones this season! Feel free to get in touch if you have any questions.

events.id: Gardens Magic-Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā, Soundshell-Wellington NZ
events.name: Gardens Magic
events.venue: Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā, Soundshell
events.long_description:
The Wellington summer nights just got warmer with the return of Gardens Magic. The capital’s talented musicians are on full display across January. The annual event, brought by Wellington City Council, presents a series of free concerts in the Botanic Garden Soundshell. 
Each year, a huge range of music genres is represented across three weeks. Choose from rock, folk, country and western, soul, jazz, pop, reggae and many more. Come early to grab a good picnic spot and sit back and enjoy the show with the whanau or a group of friends. Prolong your stay in the gardens by exploring the evening light display afterwards. The pathways near the Soundshell will be colourfully illuminated between 9 and 10:30pm every evening. During the day, the Botanic Gardens host a Kids Garden Trail and Kids Explorer Days. 
See the full 2026 programme online and keep an eye out for rain day announcements. This is your chance to join in on a beloved local tradition.
events.description:
The Wellington summer nights just got warmer with the return of Gardens Magic.
The capital’s talented musicians are on full display across January.
The annual event, brought by Wellington City Council, presents a series of free concerts in the Botanic Garden Soundshell.
Each year, a huge range of music genres is represented across three weeks.
Choose from rock, folk, country and western, soul, jazz, pop, reggae and many more.
