💡 When the sun sets, the Welling Botanic Garden ki Paekākā transforms into a wonderland of light! Wander through the Botanic Garden and experience the enchanting creations by MJF Lighting.

🗓 Dates: Tue 6– Sun 25 January 2025
⏰Time: 9pm-10.30pm daily
📍 Where: Botanic Garden ki Paekākā
💵 Cost: Free

The Light Display is part of Gardens Magic, brought by Wellington City Council. Set amongst the beauty of the Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā, this iconic event paints the gardens with lighting, brings activities for the kids, and presents the vibrant sounds of our capital’s musicians.

To find out more and see the full concert series programme, head to 👉 https://wellington.govt.nz/news-and-events/events-and-festivals/gardens-magic

As part of Gardens Magic 2026, bring your tamariki to explore the world of butterflies with hands-on activities at the Botanic Garden ki Paekākā!

Perfect for curious minds and young adventurers, these days are packed with fun activities to learn about the plants and animals of the gardens 🦋

📅 When: 10am–2pm, Wednesday 7, 14, and 21 January 2025
📍 Where: Discovery Garden & Quad Lawn, Botanic Garden ki Paekākā
💵 Cost: Free

Running alongside the Kids Garden Trail, the Kids Explorer Days are a special chance to immerse yourself in nature and enjoy free summer activities with the kids.

Join us at the Discovery Garden or the Quad Lawn near the Soundshell for fun outdoor exploration. Don’t miss it! 🌟

This event is a part of Gardens Magic, brought by Wellington City Council, set amongst the natural beauty of the Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā. Gardens Magic includes a free Concert Series, Light Display, Kids Garden Trail and Kids Explorer Days, and more.

events.id: Maoli — Island Vibe Tour-Waitangi Park, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Maoli — Island Vibe Tour
events.venue: Waitangi Park, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Music with Hawaiian roots will ring out across Waitangi Park in early January. Maoli is heralded as one of Hawaii and Polynesia’s number one commercial recording artists. Led by singer-songwriter Glenn Awong, the group is known for crafting unforgettable music that transcends borders. As one of Hawaii’s most beloved bands, Maoli blends island reggae, country, soul, and contemporary rhythms. The resulting soundscape is sure to transform Wellington’s waterfront park into a summer party zone. 
Formed in 2007, Maoli has since risen to fame with heartfelt songs that connect deeply with listeners. Their journey from small Hawaiian venues to international stages highlights the group’s dedication to music and culture. Maoli’s new album, ‘Last Sip of Summer’, was released in 2025. Expect to hear Glenn’s smooth vocals applied to new songs as well as gems from the back catalogue.
Tickets available to the general public on Thursday, 6 November at 7pm.

Live Nation is thrilled to announce that rising alternative-pop and electronic artist Charlotte Plank will return to New Zealand in January 2026 for two special headline shows.

Fresh off confirmed festival appearances at Rhythm & Vines and Rolling Meadows, Plank will bring her signature fusion of drum & bass, alt-pop and “melantronic” storytelling to intimate venues in Auckland and Wellington.

The run begins Wednesday 7 January at Neck of the Woods, Auckland, before heading to San Fran, Wellington on Thursday 8 January.

General public tickets go on sale Friday 21 November at 12pm NZDT.

For complete tour and ticket information, visit livenation.co.nz.

Join us for an extraordinary evening of lavender picking and stargazing. Immerse yourself in the breathtaking night sky.
Our expert Astronomy Guides from 'Under the Stars' will lead you through the constellations, making the night sky come alive.

🎉 EARLY BIRD TICKETS ON SALE NOW – SAVE 10%! 🎶

Start the new year right with Wairarapa Music in the Country – Jan 9–11, 2026 at beautiful Tauherenikau! 🌿🎵

🎤 Saturday headliner: Dan Cosgrove

events.name: Kirtan Experience Summer Tour with Mantra Band - Wellington
events.venue: 131-135 Lambton Quay, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
This summer, Mantra Band is packing up the instruments and journeying across Aotearoa New Zealand! Travelling town to town to share something very close to our hearts. We’ve been given the beautiful gift of kirtan, and we can’t wait to pass it on, gathering communities around the country to experience it together through the Kirtan Experience.
Kirtan Experience is a guided meditative journey - a heart-opening evening of mantra, music, meditation and movement.
Let the soothing mantras help you unwind, then feel the energy rise as rhythm and melody invite joyful movement and dance. From deep relaxation to dance-floor energy, this is an unforgettable night designed to leave you feeling uplifted, revived, and inspired. We’re excited to connect with new friends around the country and share this guided meditative journey,
Join us in Wellington on January 9 at the Public Trust Hall - 131-135 Lambton Quay, Te Aro, Wellington
6:30pm Doors Open · 7:00pm Program Start. Please arrive by 6:45 pm, we will start promptly at 7:00 pm
Experience the joy of meditation and music in one unforgettable evening!
Please be sure to secure your free tickets! Limited spots available.

events.id: Family Shiny - Akatarawa Forest-Akatarawa Forest,Porirua Pa, New Zealand, Porirua-All Events In
events.name: Family Shiny - Akatarawa Forest
events.venue: Akatarawa Forest,Porirua Pa, New Zealand, Porirua
events.long_description:
Family Shiny - Akatarawa Forest
Registrations open 10th December 2025

What to expect

This is a “Family Shiny” trip into the Akatarawa Forest.

Non members are welcome to join us but must register to obtain details of start time and location.

Vehicles must have a low ratio gearbox and must not be a 4wd car, station wagon or van, and if a soft top must have a roll cage.

Visitor Registration- $20.00 per driver
There is no trip fee for this trip however non-members pay a “Day Membership Fee” of $20. This is payable in Cash to the Trip Leader on the day.

The trip should be relatively easy as it needs to cater for people just starting out and all types of 4wd vehicles – but a good way to see if you want to get into 4wding and a chance to meet some of our club members (if you are unsure if your vehicle is suitable just ask).

No Dogs Allowed sorry

Once you have completed 3 Family Shinys you can join the club but can only participate in Family Shiny or Touring Class trips. Once you have also done a Training Day and had your vehicle inspected by one of our approved inspectors you can come along on our other more adventurous trips. To find out more on how to join our club go to https://ccvcwellington.wildapricot.org/page-1725861.

Like our Facebook page to find out about more trips and club nights.

events.venue: Alexandre Patisserie & Chocolaterie,9 Coleman Pl, Palmerston North 4410, New Zealand, Palmerston North
events.long_description:
Galette des Rois 2026 - Three Kings Cake
At the start of each new year, the King’s Cake brings family and friends together in joy.

Beneath its golden, flaky crust hides a secret: the charm, which everyone hopes to find in their slice. The lucky one who discovers it becomes king or queen for the day, crowned and celebrated by all.

More than just a dessert, it’s a tradition that reminds us of the simple pleasure of sharing, laughing, and beginning the year side by side.

Join in to taste the real French "Galette des Rois" at Alexandre Pâtisserie on Saturday 10 January @ 10 am! To get the year off to a good start, come meet our other members and practice your French during the Holidays!

$5 per person (cash sales only), includes one slice of Three Kings Cake!

events.id: Glass Bead-Making Taster - Ōtaki Beach-6 Hewson Cres, Otaki Beach, Otaki 5512-All Events In
events.name: Glass Bead-Making Taster - Ōtaki Beach
events.venue: 6 Hewson Cres, Otaki Beach, Otaki 5512
events.long_description:
Glass Bead-Making Taster - Ōtaki Beach
Join us for this fabulous introduction to working with colourful molten glass!

This class is a great way for absolute beginners to get a taste of working with glass to produce beautiful beads that can be used in a myriad of ways, including making a unique gift for your loved one (or yourself!).

As one of the earliest forms of human adornment, beads have long functioned as a way to express individuality, and what better way to do that than to learn to make your own unique beads?

Students are shown the correct lampworking techniques to produce several decorative beads in just 3 hours! How many beads you make is up to you, some students make up to 10 while others make fewer using trickier techniques.

Kids over 12 (or so) are welcome to take the class but anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver. This class uses gas torches and molten glass.

Pre-made sterling silver findings are available to complete at least one pair of your beads into wearable earrings or a simple pendant on a cord.

Workshop fee $128 early bird $115 till 14 December.

events.id: UHC class of 2000 - 25 year reunion-Upper Hutt College,Moonshine Road, Trentham, Upper Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: UHC class of 2000 - 25 year reunion
events.venue: Upper Hutt College,Moonshine Road, Trentham, Upper Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
UHC class of 2000 - 25 year reunion
Luke Vilain here - I’m putting together a school reunion for our year. Key details:

Where - UHC fields (probably somewhere behind the astroturf, maybe near the pine trees if shade is needed) - Mrs Van Maren (who is now the deputy principal) has said we can use them 😊
When - Saturday, January 10th, from midday until the food
Food - please BYO picnic and drinks. I'll be organising some toilets and some spare water, as the school won't be open at that stage, therefore no staff to open up the facilities
Activity - it’ll be a relaxed day - with some “back to school” races (egg & spoon, sack race, that sort of thing)
Families / dogs / hangers on - if you’ve got kids, it would be great if you could bring them along – the more chaos, the better 😄

Please forward this event to people that you know that went to UHC! They don't need to strictly have been in the 2000 year, or even have stayed in school until 2000 - the point is to have people come together who haven't seen each other in a long time, but have a shared connection in our teenage years

I'll likely be reaching out to people asking for contact details (like your name, facebook profile, cell phone, vague location), so those that are happy to share with others can do so - I've had a couple people already mention that they'd like to follow up with people and reconnect after all this time. This will obviously be optional (the privacy act and all that 😄)

Really looking forward to seeing you all! Any questions please shout and I'll update the event 😊

events.name: New Year Laughs at Monterey Cinemas
events.venue: Monterey Cinemas Upper Hutt,68-70 Queen Street, Upper Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
New Year Laughs at Monterey Cinemas
Kajun Brooking and Pat Goldsack lead a stellar line-up of stand-up comedy at Monterey Cinemas!

Fresh from the UK, Pat Goldsack - NZ's hippest, swingers-club-owning nana - hits the stage for a headline act filled to the brim with innuendo, sex advice, mentorship, and a healthy dose of the crass. Listen up and listen good: you sass the Pat, she'll eat your sass for breakfast.

MC Kajun Brooking - raised on the gang-infested streets of Hastings, Kajun moved to Whanganui in search of a better life. Now he’s slinging sharp punchlines and slick observations drawn from real-life grit and wit. Described as slippery, quick-witted, and punchy, Kajun’s mission is simple: make at least one person laugh. If he does, he can go home satisfied - and keep proving to his kids that Dad is actually funny.

Also featuring a fantastic line-up of support acts TBA!

events.id: Newtown Rocksteady - Wellington-The Rogue & Vagabond-All Events In
events.name: Newtown Rocksteady - Wellington
events.venue: The Rogue & Vagabond
events.long_description:
Newtown Rocksteady - Wellington
The mighty Newtown Rocksteady Return with their massive house of sound.

The bonfire will be lit with bass, dowsed in drums, and then fed with vocals, guitars, keys, horns, dancing, banter, laughter and special guests.

Watch them burn! After years of smash hit, full houses all accross Aotearoa, the boys are hitting the Rogue and Vagabone to shake things up, BIG time!

Did we mention the special guests' Not just guests, special guests! Who will they be' Come find out.

Hear some bangin new tunes alongside some choice rocksteady classics.

It could be the best night of your life! Fullas, you might find a pretty lady in the crowd' Ladies, you might get yourself a cashed-up musician (get in quick -they're flying out the door!)

Whatever happens, it will be hearty good times.

The band has its roots firmly embedded in the traditions of Jamaican rocksteady, ska and reggae music and is further nourished by its connection with its community. They will be spreading this love on their South Island tour in January 2026.

Be sure to bring your dancing shoes for one of Wellington’s biggest, best-loved, longest-running and grooviest vintage reggae bands: Newtown Rocksteady!

Possibly one of the greatest dance bands to have played the Mussel Inn in the past eighteen years. These guys are rock steady in every sense of those two words.
- Andrew, Mussel Inn - Takaka

I love it when I go to a concert expecting to see my favourite band and discover that the openers are almost better than the headline act. Numbering twelve on the stage, Newtown Rocksteady damn near threatened to demolish the stage by sheer force of numbers!

These guys are hard-hitting aficionados of ‘70s dub classics as per Lee Scratch Perry and Augustus Pablo, and their particular delivery quickly fuel up the lukewarm Sunday audience. Story goes that the Black Seeds caught their act at the recent Newtown Festival and were so taken they asked them to open for their Wellington homecoming gigs.

I can see why. Big horns, smatterings of conscious roots, deep, soulful grooves – tunes are well crafted, a little righteous but, ultimately, perfect to wiggle to. Special mention goes to ‘So Long’, with brilliant lines “oil on the water – pain in my soul” – a reference to BP, oil slicks, Nigeria and the evils of the oil industry.

events.long_description:
Artisan Craft Market (11/01/25 Wellington)
The Artisan Craft Market is a premium handmade event that takes place across various locations in the broader Wellington region. This high-quality market is designed to foster a welcoming and friendly atmosphere.

Our vision at Artisan Craft Market is to make the market accessible to those who appreciate shopping locally. We aim to provide a platform that supports local artisans, allowing them to showcase their meticulously crafted, high-quality products. By bringing the market directly to the people, we hope to celebrate and promote the unique talents of our community’s skilled artisans.

COME SUPPORT LOCAL CREATORS IN WELLINGTON CITY

events.id: Otaki Market - January-State Highway 1, opposite New World, New Zealand 5512,155 Old SH 1, Otaki 5512, New Zealand, Otaki-All Events In
events.name: Otaki Market - January
events.venue: State Highway 1, opposite New World, New Zealand 5512,155 Old SH 1, Otaki 5512, New Zealand, Otaki
events.long_description:
Otaki Market - January
Nau Mai Haere Mai, meet you at the Market. 🌞
Discover a vibrant outdoor market nestled on State Highway One in Ōtaki, just across from New World. Join us to greet our regular stallholders and special guests from the community.
---

PARKING
There is plenty of free parking available at the Otaki train station.
Main Highway is a perfect spot for customers to the market
60 Minute Parking zone behind Riverstone Cafe.

CASH / ATM
Some vendors have eftpos, and all take cash. There is an ATM located on the main highway.

FOOD VENDORS
And when hunger strikes, our lineup of food trucks and stalls is ready to tantalize your taste buds. From waffles to hangi, seafood chowder to fry bread, sausage sizzles, and a delectable assortment of rice, noodles, and home baking – a feast awaits.

BUSKER
We often have an awesome busker, who'll be playing chilled out middle of the road tunes.

🎨 Art & Craft
🌳 Native trees, flowers and plants
🍶 Candles, soaps and wax melts
🕰️ Antiques and collectables
🍯 Produce, including yummy honey!
👚 Pre-love clothing, shoes and accessories
⚒️ Tools for the home and garden
🧸 Toys and books for tamariki

Come for the finds, stay for the flavor.
---

STALL HOLDERS
Would you like to be a stall holder?
Join our market family, fill out the enquiry form: www.otakiwomensclub.org/stall-holder

events.id: Bailamos Bachata! January Dance Party (no lesson)-Southern Cross Garden Bar Restaurant,39 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In

events.venue: Southern Cross Garden Bar Restaurant,39 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Bailamos Bachata! January Dance Party (no lesson)
🔥 Please note: the event is free but it can only continue if we support the Southern Cross by buying food or drinks 🔥


🌟 Wellington’s favourite monthly Bachata Latin dance party 🌟


We’re giving the Wellington teachers a much needed break, so the January Bailamos is going to be 100% social dancing.

Join us for an awesome night of bachata, along with a touch of salsa and a smattering of kizomba and zouk. We welcome everyone, from the absolute beginner to the most experienced dancer. We’re all about the joy of social dancing together.

Bailamos Bachata is hosted free of charge by the Southern Cross. They love the atmosphere we bring but we also need to support them in return. We’re asking everyone attending to purchase soft drinks, food or alcohol from the bar. It’s vital we show our gratitude.

See you there!

events.long_description:
Please Note: All of our in-person public courses are hosted at wheelchair-accessible venues. If you require any specific assistance, please contact learn@3grow.net to discuss this prior to booking and we will do our utmost to help.
Course Code: SPOEU
Duration: 2 Days
Audience: End Users
Overview
Attendees will leave at the end of this course with an understanding of the role SharePoint plays within an organisation, as well as all of the knowledge required to successfully navigate around and contribute to their SharePoint Online sites, and collaborate within their team and the rest of their organisation.
Module List
Module 1: Introduction to SharePoint & Microsoft 365
Module 2: Finding Content
Module 3: Working with Lists
Module 4: Working with Libraries
Module 5: Working with Publishing Features
Module 6: Leveraging Social Content in the Business
Click here for the full 'SharePoint Online for End Users' course outline

events.long_description:

Course Code: SPOSO
Duration: 2 Days
Audience: End Users
Overview
This course is designed to build on the attendees’ existing contributor level knowledge in order to provide the skills to create and manage all aspects of their SharePoint Online sites.
Prerequisites
Delegates attending this course will have completed our ‘SharePoint Online for End Users’ 2-day introductory course, or will have otherwise gained the equivalent level of knowledge.
Module List
Module 1: Site Owner Responsibilities
Module 2: Creating and Managing Sites
Module 3: Site Customisation
Module 4: Permissions and Security
Module 5: Creating & Managing Lists & Libraries
Module 6: Advanced Document Management
Module 7: Power Platform Integration
Module 8: Creating & Managing Content Types
Click here for the full 'SharePoint for Site Owners' course outline

events.name: Rubber Duck decorating competition
events.venue: Queen Elizabeth Park,Masterton, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Rubber Duck decorating competition
🦆🎉 Quack-tastic news — it’s Rubber Ducky Day!
Dive into the fun and decorate your very own Rubber Duckie. Get creative with colours, glitter, googly eyes, costumes — whatever makes your duck stand out from the flock! Decorate on the day or take your duckie home, give it the full makeover treatment, and bring it back to the Library to enter our community vote.

🏆🗳️ Will your duck reign supreme?

Decorated duckies will be displayed for the public to admire and vote on.

Voting closes Friday 23 January — so waddle on in and join the fun!

Look out for updates on our Facebook page in the event of bad weather. Tamariki aged under 14 are required to have a parent or guardian remain with them during all Library programmes.

events.id: Men's World Floorball Championships 2026 AOFC Qualification-72 Kemp Street, Kilbirnie, Wellington 6022, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Men's World Floorball Championships 2026 AOFC Qualification
events.venue: 72 Kemp Street, Kilbirnie, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The stage is set for the World Floorball Championships 2026 Asia-Oceania Qualification, where 10 teams from across the region (New Zealand, Australia, Singapore, China, Hong Kong (China), Japan, Korea, Thailand, the Philippines, and Solomon Islands) will gather to compete for just 4 golden tickets to the biggest stage in floorball.
Over seven days of fast-paced action, lightning-quick plays, and relentless determination, these teams will leave everything on the court in pursuit of making it to the World Championships. Each match promises intensity, emotion, and energy as the teams fight for pride, passion, and a place among the world's best.
Click the link below to view the draw and obtain further information. https://www.floorball.org.nz/mens-wfcq-2026

events.id: TIAHO Summer School 2026-Te Whaea—National Dance & Drama Centre,Te Whaea, 11 Hutchison Rd, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: TIAHO Summer School 2026
events.venue: Te Whaea—National Dance & Drama Centre,Te Whaea, 11 Hutchison Rd, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
TIAHO Summer School 2026
WIDance are excited to partner with the Royal Academy of Dance for the second TIAHO summer school!

Join us from 14-16 January 2026 for three inspiring days of dance!

Tiaho offers fun, accessible dance classes for students with disabilities, encouraging confidence, self-expression and well-being.

Daily two-hour workshops exploring movement and creativity culminating in a studio presentation in celebration of the students' achievements.

Details are as follows:
Date: 14-16th January 2026
Times: 10 am to 12.15pm, plus sharing on Friday 12.45 -2.30 pm.
Venue: Te Whaea, National Dance and Drama Centre, 11 Hutchison Rd, Newtown.
Cost: $25 per day or $60 for all three days.
All levels welcome.

Please visit the Royal Academy of Dance website to book!

https://www.royalacademyofdance.org/en-nz/event/summer-school-2026-tiaho/

OR email:

Tiaho Summer School is proudly supported by Lottery Community grants.

Image description:
A dark-toned photograph featuring a male dancer wearing glasses, his arms lifted high in a V-shape. He is dressed in a white T-shirt that reads “Dancing is my superpower.” The text “Tiaho Summer School 2026, @ Te Whaea, 14–16 Jan” appears in orange lettering. The photograph is framed by a bright orange border containing the logos of the Royal Academy of Dance, WIDance, and the Lottery Grants Board.

events.venue: TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Jimmy Carr: Laughs Funny will bring the comedian’s signature dark brand of humour to TSB Arena.
The presenter, actor, and writer is known for his one-liners, rapid-fire delivery, and signature laugh.
His content is often described as “edgy”, so be prepared for a raised eyebrow or two.
Just like a magnet, it attracts some people and repels others.
For those who are attracted to risqué jokes with a bit of spice, this is a show not to miss.

events.name: January Sapphic Chill Hangout
events.venue: 128 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Do you want to meet fellow sapphics but you don't feel super comfortable in environments that are loud and pressure you to drink alcohol and flirt? Sapphic Chill Hangouts are monthly events that prioritise low-pressure talks and being your beautiful unmasked self. Feel free to bring your supplies to knit, crochet, fidget or whatever that will make you feel at ease! We will be playing a chill sapphic playlist at low volume 😊
Vegan snacks and non-alcoholic beverages will be available for purchase at Reception, but outside kai and drinks are also welcome. However, TERFs and any form of harassment are NOT WELCOME.
We also suggest a koha of $5 of more to keep this awesome community space and future events going 💜

events.id: SHAI HULUD-Valhalla, Wellington-Valhalla
events.name: SHAI HULUD
events.venue: Valhalla, Wellington
events.long_description:
SHAI HULUD
AOTEAROA TOUR 2026
TICKETS UTR.CO.NZ
Following their triumphant reunion show with former vocalist Geert van der Velde at Furnace Fest 2024, legendary American progressive metalcore band Shai Hulud is thrilled to announce their return to the road in 2025. The upcoming world tour will mark Shai Hulud’s first extended run of shows in over a decade, featuring van der Velde on vocals.
The Furnace Fest performance was a monumental moment in the band’s history, bringing together, for the first time since 2004, the full lineup that recorded the landmark 2003 album That Within Blood Ill-Tempered. For many fans, it was the first chance to see van der Velde back on the mic, and he did not disappoint. If anything, his vocals have grown stronger and even more ferocious with time, while the chemistry on stage was undeniable, a testament to the band’s enduring spirit and technical mastery. Fans and newcomers alike were left buzzing about the energy, emotion, and sheer force of the performance.
While the upcoming world tour will feature Shai Huluds current lineup, van der Velde will helm vocal duties for all shows, delivering performances that span the band’s celebrated catalog, including a spotlight on tracks from That Within Blood Ill-Tempered.
Shai Hulud is back. Stronger. Louder. And more pissed off than ever before and happy to return to Aotearoa after twenty years
events.description:

If anything, his vocals have grown stronger and even more ferocious with time, while the chemistry on stage was undeniable, a testament to the band’s enduring spirit and technical mastery.
Fans and newcomers alike were left buzzing about the energy, emotion, and sheer force of the performance.
While the upcoming world tour will feature Shai Huluds current lineup, van der Velde will helm vocal duties for all shows, delivering performances that span the band’s celebrated catalog, including a spotlight on tracks from That Within Blood Ill-Tempered.
Shai Hulud is back.

The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a
table for pre-show kai email Alice at

Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible

space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to
others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our
neighbours.

events.id: Wellington Speed Dating for ages 25- 39 by Cheeky Events Australia-The Arborist Rooftop Bar,166 Willis Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Wellington Speed Dating for ages 25- 39 by Cheeky Events Australia
events.venue: The Arborist Rooftop Bar,166 Willis Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wellington Speed Dating for ages 25- 39 by Cheeky Events Australia
Get ready for a night of fun and connection at Wellington's hottest speed dating event!

About this Event

Let’s ditch the apps together and embrace real connections. Say goodbye to the dating apps and hello to your very own Cheeky Love Story! 💖
🍸 What’s included: Your first drink is on us—let’s toast to great company!
👇How It Works:
Before the event:Make sure to download the Cheeky Events App (free on Google Play & the App Store) to set up your profile and upload a photo.
P.S. Don’t worry—it’s not a dating app! We’ve skipped the chat feature because we’re all about real, in-person connections.
During the event:
Check in to grab your name tag and free drink token. 🍻
Arrive on time to enjoy 15 minutes of casual pre-mingling.
Ladies stay seated while men rotate every 5 minutes—don’t forget to rate your matches in the app! 👍👎
Take a quick 15-minute break before the next round.
After the rotations, feel free to stick around for some extra socializing!
After the event: Stay for extra mingling and check the app for your cheeky matches 12 hours later! 📱💖
For more details, check out our blog: What to expect
Who knows? You might just find your next spark! ✨ Our IRL singles events (single mixers and speed dating events) are happening across Australia, New Zealand, London, and NYC! 🌏

About Cheeky Events
We host fun, inclusive singles events across Australia, New Zealand, London, and NYC! Whether you’re in your 20s, over 40, looking for love, or just looking to meet new people, our events are designed to bring people together. Whether you’re seeking romance, new friendships, or even networking, we’ve got something for everyone!
👉 Follow us on Instagram:@cheekyeventsaustralia @cheekyeventsukandireland @cheekyeventsnewzealand @cheekyeventsukandireland @cheekeventsus
Visit our website: www.cheekyevents.net or download the Cheeky Events app to get started.
We can’t wait to see you at one of our events soon! 🕺💃

events.id: Altum Academy Open Days-66 Albemarle Road, Wilton, Northland 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Altum Academy Open Days
events.venue: 66 Albemarle Road, Wilton, Northland 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Altum Classical Academy’s upcoming open days are an invitation to discover what a quality education could mean for your child. There will be two information sessions. One on a weekday evening and one on a weekend afternoon. Families interested in understanding more about classical education, and Altum, are invited to join.
You’ll find it’s 90 minutes well spent.
30 minutes will be spent sharing information about the school, curriculum and ethos.
The following 30 minutes will consist of a question/answer time; where the principal, school board and teachers field questions from parents and interested parties.
The last 30 minutes will be spent touring the grounds and viewing Altum’s school facilities.
Altum Classical Academy is starting next year in Wellington. It’s a charter high school that believes that every student should be given a chance to excel, whatever their circumstances. Take the chance. Make a change.
Dates:
Thursday 15th January, 7:00-8:30pm
Sunday 25th January, 2:00-3:30pm
Free to attend, but please register so we know you're coming.

events.id: Summer Camp Launch Party | Half Angel and King Hit -San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Summer Camp Launch Party | Half Angel and King Hit
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
San Fran Summer Camp is back for 2026!
Join us and some of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s finest artists over five nights across January and February with tickets from $10 or a season pass for $40, featuring drink specials and cocktails thanks to our sponsor Jameson.

Start your new year off right with two of this city's premier alternative acts! 

Half/Angel toe the line of alt-rock, post punk & ambient psychedelia. They unpredictably juxtapose intimate, soft, vocals and delicate instrumental passages with raucous, high-energy outbursts. They’re exciting to listen to, and their singles ‘Debt Collector’ & ‘Boat Ramp + Jitterbug’ will have you struggling to put them in a box and itching to hear what’s next.
New noise in the scene, King Hit, is a Te Whanganui A Tara based four piece that blends together the jarring-ness of shoe-gaze, the punch of hardcore, with the sombreness of midwest emo. After a successful release of their debut single ‘asterisk’, King Hit are poised to release their follow up single ‘Sap’, an grungy-yet-ethereal longing love song.

San Fran holds a Supervised License, meaning minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue. Minors are of course not allowed to purchase alcohol under any circumstance

events.id: Men's WFCQ 2026 AOFC | Korea vs Japan-Ākau Tangi Sports Centre,72 Kemp Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Men's WFCQ 2026 AOFC | Korea vs Japan
events.venue: Ākau Tangi Sports Centre,72 Kemp Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Men's WFCQ 2026 AOFC | Korea vs Japan
The AOFC Qualification is the Asia–Oceania region’s pathway to the Men’s World Floorball Championships. Ten teams are split into two groups and battle through pool play. The top teams advance to the playoffs and only four teams will qualify for the Men’s World Floorball Championships in Finland in December.

Join us in welcoming teams from:
> New Zealand
> Australia
> Singapore
> Thailand
> Philippines
> Japan
> Korea
> Hong Kong, China
> China
> Solomon Islands

Be there when history happens.

Whether you’re a floorball fan or brand new to the sport, this is your chance to watch world-class international competition on home soil.

Tickets are now available. You have the option of purchasing adult only, child only or family passes in the following options:
> Tournament passes
> Full-day passes
> Evening passes for 7PM games
> Finals passes for 19 January

Secure your seat early.

events.id: Mindful Kids Summer Holiday Programme-Bhakti Lounge Wellington,175 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Mindful Kids Summer Holiday Programme
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington,175 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Mindful Kids Summer Holiday Programme
Get your kids ready for a fun, screen-free holiday programme full of mindful, holistic activities. Vegan kai will be provided daily too!

About this Event

At Mindful Kids we will explore nature, get creative cooking and crafting, play music and dance, do mindfulness exercises and more in a peaceful, safe environment. The programme has been crafted with care to give your kids the best experience and will be facilitated by a NZ qualified primary school teacher.
The programme will run for three Fridays over the course of three weeks as per details below.
Times: Drop off time: 8.30am - 9am; Pick up time: 3pm - 3.30pm
Dates: Friday 16th January, Friday 23rd January, Friday 30th January
Location: Bhakti Lounge - 1/175 Vivian Street, Te Aro Wellington
What to bring: A drink bottle, sun protection, weather-appropriate clothing, regular Medic*tion, and walking shoes.
Age range: 7 - 10 year olds
General daily schedule: Each day will run according to the following structure incorporating the daily theme as per below.
8.30 - 9am - Drop off time
9am - Mindful Moment: Roll, 5 mins of breathwork, 5 mins of yoga, story, circle time
9.30am - Activity
10.30am - Morning tea time
11am - Activity
12.30pm - Lunch time
1.30pm - Mindful Moment: Roll, 5 mins of breathwork, 5 mins of yoga, story
1.45pm - Activity
2.30pm - Afternoon tea and pack up time
3 - 3.30pm - Pick up time

Activities for each day: Check out the cool activities we will do each day!

Cooking and Crafts Day -16th January
Vegan cooking class - Learn to make sushi, sweets and more..
Masterchef Jr contest
Table decorating and restaurant designing
Arts and crafts afternoon
Nature Day - 23rd January
Nature treasure hunt at Central Park
Decorating pots and gardening
Nature hike
Fun at the playground and flying fox
Picnic at the park
Music and Dance Day - 30th January
Make your own instruments
Disco dancing with disco ball and lights
Dress up costume play
Music and dance games
Talent quest
Programme Facilitator: Our facilitator has a wealth of experience creating rich, engaging activities for tamariki in Aotearoa. As well as being a qualified primary school teacher for six years, she also has a degree majoring in Psycholgy and Spanish, experience running a yoga and wellbeing student club at Victoria University and experience being a school Sports Coordinator. Additionally, she has taught in schools in Spain, been the Positive Behaviour for Learning Team Leader and has initiated mindfulness sessions for teachers at various schools. She was the second in charge coordinator for a holiday programme in Nelson and is now excited to combine all of her skills and experience to give your kids the best experience possible at Mindful Kids.
We hope to see you and your kids soon! :)

Masterchef Jr contest Table decorating and restaurant designing Arts and crafts afternoon Nature Day - 23rd January Nature treasure hunt at Central Park Decorating pots and gardening Nature hike Fun at the playground and flying fox Picnic at the park Music and Dance Day - 30th January Make your own instruments Disco dancing with disco ball and lights Dress up costume play Music and dance games Talent quest Programme Facilitator: Our facilitator has a wealth of experience creating rich, engaging activities for tamariki in Aotearoa.
She was the second in charge coordinator for a holiday programme in Nelson and is now excited to combine all of her skills and experience to give your kids the best experience possible at Mindful Kids.

events.id: Insecure Delusion Presents A Tribute To Tool-San Fran,Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Insecure Delusion Presents A Tribute To Tool
events.venue: San Fran,Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Insecure Delusion Presents A Tribute To Tool
Missed the real deal? Live vicariously with Insecure Delusion: A Tribute To Tool!

After a SOLD OUT Wellington show in early 2025 Insecure Delusion are back in the capital at the famous San Fran to give Tool fans a fix with their tribute to the greats - whether you missed out on the real deal or just want to get out amongst Tool fans again for a night of the best rock songs around - Insecure Delusion are ready to deliver this January 2026!

Rocking out from 9:00pm on Friday the 16th of January, enjoy the tunes that gave Tool a cult-like status amongst devoted fans. Playing fan favourites like The Pot, Stinkfist, Forty Six & 2 and others, it’s the perfect way to get your Tool fix whether you saw them in Auckland or didn't get the chance! It might seem crazy to run a tribute to the greats a couple of months after the legends themselves are here but these lads are a bit mad and they bring that energy to every show!

Insecure Delusion: A Tribute To Tool take the stage with energy and passion for the genres and the musicianship that Tool is known for. An event not to be missed if you're a Tool fiend.

And just to make the night extra special, our friends from Down With The System will be opening with a killer set from the legends that are SOAD!

Earlybirds are available now but only for a limited ticket run! At only $25 per ticket (+ bf), your bank account will be thanking you. 🤘

"I’ve had the chance to see this band twice in Napier. They’re absolutely in keeping with Tool, powerful vocals, a fantastic drummer, and an all-round tight, talented group of guys. Great energy, great music, and genuinely good people." Rion R

"I was completely blown away by the tightness and musicality of these guys. All showcased amazing versatility on their chosen instruments. Would highly recommend to anyone who appreciates quality music. Thanks for an entertaining evening. Smashed it out of the park! " Micheal D


Please note: San Fran has a Supervised Licence meaning under 18s are welcome as long as they are supervised by a responsible adult (usually mum or dad).

events.id: Chillax 2026-Stansborough Farm,Kaiwhata Road, Te Wharau, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Chillax 2026
events.venue: Stansborough Farm,Kaiwhata Road, Te Wharau, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Chillax 2026
January 16–19th. Unplug. Unwind. Unleash.

About this Event




Get ready to CHILLAX - JAN 16-19th 2026!
Unplug. Unwind. Unleash.
This January, escape the chaos and step into a world where nature, music, and good vibes rule. CHILLAX is your long weekend paradise — a four-day off-the-grid camping festival set in stunning natural surrounds.
What to Expect:
Live Music from sunrise sessions to late-night jams
Cool off with a river swim
Farm Walks to reconnect with the land
Star Gazing under skies unspoiled by city lights
And the ultimate highlight: The Tropical Lotus Bell Tent Party - a vibrant explosion of colour, rhythm, and wild tropical energy!

No WiFi. No deadlines. Just freedom, fresh air, and a whole lot of fun.
Leave your phone. Bring your soul.
CHILLAX – The name says it all.

Our Chillax Festival gets better each year with the support of our wider Chilled whānau, it grows, matures, blossoms and develops into something new and exciting. We can't wait to see where this journey takes us next.
Without all your support, we wouldn't be able to add little extras each year - so THANK YOU ❤

Our Mission:
At the Chillax Festival, we provide a platform for new up and coming artists to present themselves and grow confidence in front of a friendly non-judgmental group of Chilled Kiwis! To bring happiness and enjoyment, surrounded by the beautiful nature our country has to offer, while focusing on sustainable, safe, chilled events.
Stansborough is a beautiful hidden farm, encompassing 2300 acres of hills, valleys, swimming holes and bush. At the Chillax Festival you can forget the rest of the world exists and leave all your worries behind.
Come for the day or stay the entire weekend it is up to you.
____________________________________________________________________________________________________



Enjoy live music over the long weekend from our 2026 Muso line up!
Our 2026 line up and onsite food options, will be confirmed 3 months prior to the event.
All ticket holders will be notified and kept up to date with all new information.
Here is a snaek peak of what we can confirm!...
Our 2026 Newest Guest Artist is "Raia"
Based in Palmerston North, Raia is a young, confident artist with an amazingly pure voice. By far our youngest performer yet, she has a voice and stage presence that far exceeds her age. Raia performs covers and original songs - both contemporary and old school - layering smooth vocals and charming arrangements across everything she does. Raia is excited to bring her artistry and love of music to this years Chillax Festival.
Our guest band for 2025 'The Archer Project' loved it as much as we loved them - so they are definately coming back!
Of course we will also have some of our other favourites returing! ____________________________________________________________________________________________________


ITINERARY


FRIDAY -

If you are extra keen to make the most of the whole weekend, why not join us on Friday. Arrive from midday and once you are set up you can enjoy the scenery, explore the lake and bush valleys, swim in the river, walk the hills and tracks or climb to the top and see the sea. Wind up the evening with some good company chilling in the barn.



SATURDAY - Event day #1


If you're not already enjoying our company, arrive anytime, pitch your tent, or simply park your car, familiarise yourself with the surroundings.

Live music throughout the day from a range of artists and mixed bands - some regular favourites and some new amazing talent! Maybe even some surprises for the kids.


We have another food truck attending this year, so bring cash if you want a break from the BBQ! Our wonderful friends from Sajitarian IceCreams will be selling their amazing Ice Creams, so bring cash and don't miss out!


This year the main tent will be open for everyone to enjoy throughout the weekend. I great place to relax, sit quietly and get out of the sun.

Saturday evening you can enjoy our CHILLAX tent party - 2026 is 'TROPICAL THEME' so don't forget your Hawaiian shirts and Tropical skirts!


After dark make sure you get in some amazing star gazing in our beautiful dark sky zone!



SUNDAY - Event day #2

Another chillaxed day with plenty of live music from bands.


Appreciate the beautiful rural setting, take a gentle stroll or a hike to the top of the hill to see the sea or simply chill out by the river in the sun with friends. Play a game and listen to music - the choice is yours. How about an evening Comedy Fest in the tent?!


MONDAY - Wellington Anniversary

Appreciate the beautiful rural setting, take a gentle stroll or a hike to the top of the hill to see the sea or simply chill out by the river in the sun with friends. Pack up when you are ready and then we look forward to seeing you all next year!

____________________________________________________________________________________________________

Parking will be provided by the camp site. Once you are set up you can enjoy the scenery, explore the lake and bush valleys, swim in the river, walk the hills and tracks or climb to the top to see the sea.
Fridges in the cottage will be available, so you can put your (clearly named) food in them to store. You may want to bring a chilli bin and ice for beverages.
For lunch and dinner on Saturday, the BBQs will be back for everyone to use. We are also trying to lock in a food truck to add a bit of variety for everyone, so bring your cash so you dont miss out!


WHAT YOUR TICKET INCLUDES
A line up of Live Entertainment over the long weekend by a variety of live singers, musicians and music under the stars.
Use of toilets (Tidy Eco toilet units with solar lights)
Use of BBQs and shared fridges and cash food truck options!
An amazing chilled weekend or day out and the additional option of off-the-grid camping on a beautiful private secret site in the Wairarapa!
Live music, great company, laughter and good memories!
____________________________________________________________________________________________________
Tickets to each consecutive event, will be offered first to those who attended the event previous, so be one of the first so you don’t miss out.
'Ms Magnifique Events' are invitation only and limited numbers are limited so don't miss out. This enables us to keep these events special, exclusive, desirable and personal.
If due to weather the festival must be cancelled, there will be a postponement date or the choice for a refund (minus a small admin fee). All funds are held by Eventbrite until the event date incase of cancellation and refunds.


WHAT TO BRING
Enough food for your group for the duration of your stay or money for onsite food options. There are NO shops close (only a very handy and exceptional cafe 10 mins drive away - but you will need to check opening hours!) You need to make sure you do not run out of food, drinks and WATER. We will have some spring water available which is ok for drinking, but most people prefer to bring bottled water.

BYO drinks and water
Eating and cooking utensils (plates, bowls, cups, cutlery etc)
Cash - for onsite food options
Tent, sleeping bag, pillow and bedroll (if you want one) - If you have a camper van or pop up you are also welcome to bring them.
Togs and towel for river swimming - 3 great swimming holes to choose from
Insect repellant, sun block and antihistamine
Happiness, laughter and awesome dance moves
Please bring bottled water if possible (we don’t suggest drinking the river water)
Torches (there is no power at the camp site so once it’s dark it is super dark! Unpolluted night skies with loads of stars and satellites)
Oh and don't forget, again......BYO water!


IMPORTANT INFO
Notes:
NO POWER at camp site.
NO CELL COVERAGE OR INTERNET (unless you climb to the top of the hill/mountain or visit the local cafe)
NO PETS (as there will be farm stock around)
ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING (we don’t want to start a bush fire, and you would unfortunately be liable)
POP UPS OR CAMPER VANS are ok, but please note there is no power or waste dumping available.

Closest 'Homewood Storeroom Cafe' 10 minutes drive down gravel road (we suggest you check opening hours) - a great cafe!
Closest basic shop - Riversdale (30 minutes on gravel road )
Closest supermarket - Carterton
Last petrol station: Carterton (we suggest you fill up there)
2 hours drive from Wellington (last 20mins on gravel road)
Exact address on google search ’Stansborough farm cottage’ Kaiwhata valley road, last 20 minutes is gravel. We will put ribbons up along the way for you to watch out for, so you know you're heading the right way.
There is an emergency phone at the farm house.
Make sure to grab a map of the property (will be provided on arrival) which highlights points of interest on the property.


Responsibilities:
Parents are solely responsible for their children at all times. Adults are responsible for themselves at all times, especially if drinking alcohol! Be aware the property and site of the event, is a working farm and there are hazards all around (rivers, lakes, cliffs, valleys and animals) so be careful and responsible.
The nearest medical facility is 50 minutes drive away.
When guests leave, we ask that you please take all your own rubbish with you and leave behind only flattened grass and the site as you found it.
If you are purchasing a Festival Day Pass only you will need a designated driver if any alcohol is consumed. The road to the venue is tricky and gravel in part. We DO NOT recommend anyone drives that has consumed any alcohol or is tired.

Click here to see videos and images from Chillax 2025:
https://photos.app.goo.gl/M25bpTPRvS3mfP45A

- A relaxed outdoor garden setting
- Our Emporium may be open for a spot of gift shopping

Good to know:
- No BYO alcohol
- No pre-booking or takeaway orders in advance
- Card facilities available

Tickets: Free entry — just pay for food & drinks.

events.id: A Century Celebration!-18 Main Road, Titahi Bay, Titahi Bay,18 Main Rd, Titahi Bay, Porirua 5022, New Zealand, Porirua-All Events In
events.name: A Century Celebration!
events.venue: 18 Main Road, Titahi Bay, Titahi Bay,18 Main Rd, Titahi Bay, Porirua 5022, New Zealand, Porirua
events.long_description:
A Century Celebration!
In 1926, at a meeting at the Accounts Chambers in Johnston Street, Wellington, Mrs JW Bell (and her husband) offered to lease three sections of her land for the purposes of establishing a tennis and bowling club in Titahi Bay.

Well Mrs Bell, thanks to your kind offer, we are still here 100 years later and don’t we have some stories and memories to share of those years gone by!

Over the course of Wellington Anniversary weekend (16-18 January 2026), we invite current and former members of the Titahi Bay Tennis Club to come and join us in celebrating this incredible milestone!

In coming months, we will update this post with more information about events planned for the weekend. In the meantime, please put this in your diary, share with friends, family, or perhaps use it as an opportunity to reach out to a former interclub team mate you haven’t seen or heard from in a while and tell them you’ll see them there!

We hope you can join us for what should be a great occasion!



(article : https://paperspast.natlib.govt.nz/newspapers/EP19270114.2.141)

Also check out other Sports events in Porirua, Workshops in Porirua, Meetups in Porirua.

events.id: Tony As Robbie Williams Tribute-11 Logan Street, Ebdentown, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Tony As Robbie Williams Tribute
events.venue: 11 Logan Street, Ebdentown, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand
events.long_description:
For over two decades, Tony Lewis has been turning heads and wowing audiences worldwide with his incredible portrayal of Britain’s greatest entertainer — Robbie Williams. Since debuting in Legends in 2002, Tony has performed across the globe, leaving crowds asking, “Is that really…?”
Based in Manchester, England, Tony first met Robbie in 2005, earning his idol’s approval when Robbie said, “I think it’s great, I’m really flattered! It’s bloody hard work being me!”
Three years later, Tony reached the finals of BBC One’s The One and Only, performing to over 7 million viewers each week. His uncanny resemblance and spot-on performance have led to countless TV appearances, promotional campaigns, and even official work for Robbie’s album Rudebox.
Tony has also appeared alongside stars like Simon Cowell, Olly Murs, Stephen Fry, and Ant & Dec — even helping prank Robbie himself on Saturday Night Takeaway!
His show captures all the greatest hits, from the early classics and swing favourites to modern anthems and a touch of Take That. With the looks, the moves, the voice, and the attitude — Tony Lewis truly is Robbie Williams!

events.id: Summer singing retreat-Our Lady's Home of Compassion,Home of Compassion, 2 Rhine St, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Summer singing retreat
events.venue: Our Lady's Home of Compassion,Home of Compassion, 2 Rhine St, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Summer singing retreat
Start the new year with intention in a fun and inclusive environment. The beginning of the year is a perfect time to get together and feel the power of community and connection through singing.

Sing for renewal and hope. Sing for harmony, joy, and inspiration. Sing for healing. Sing to regain your strength and empower others.

Spend the 2 days encircled by a community of like-minded people and focusing on your well-being through singing. Rest, connect, and restore. The weekend is carefully planned so there is plenty of time to sing and to rest in between.

We will breathe together, listen, create beautiful sounds, let go of our worries, and lift each other to a sense of fulfilment and joy. And to make the event even more special, Lala will be cooking an authentic Malagasy dinner on Saturday night (an experience not to be missed).

Jonathan Berkahn and Lala Simpson have led workshops and performed together for many years. They are both highly skilled song leaders who lead from the heart and joyfully share their gifts. You will be in safe hands. ALL SINGERS OF ALL LEVELS OF ABILITY ARE WELCOME!!!

Jonathan will teach a mix of pop, folk and original songs, and Lala will teach a mix of songs from South Africa, Georgia, Madagascar and community songs.

If you are coming from out of town, the Home of Compassion offers some accommodation with reasonable rates which includes breakfast. Please contact them directly to enquire at

REGISTRATION: Get tickets on Humanitix, or if you want to avoid the extra fees, register here

SCHEDULE

Saturday, 17th of January: This first part of the retreat will be held at the Island Bay Presbyterian Church. We will spend the day singing in the beautiful auditorium and share a Malagasy meal cooked by Lala at the end of the day. Morning tea, afternoon tea, and dinner provided. Please BYO lunch. The beach is close by, so bring your swimming gear for a dip at lunchtime.

Sunday, 18th of January: We will be singing in the Lyon Room (large meeting room filled with natural light) at the Home of Compassion in Island Bay. We will finish the day singing the songs we learnt at a FREE community concert in the Chapel. Morning tea, afternoon tea, and lunch provided.

The Island Bay Presbyterian Church and the Home of Compassion are within walking distance of each other.

Sunday, 18th of January: We will be singing in the Lyon Room (large meeting room filled with natural light) at the Home of Compassion in Island Bay.
We will finish the day singing the songs we learnt at a FREE community concert in the Chapel.

events.id: Braai and get together at Battle Hill - 17 January 2026-Battle Hill Farm Forest Park,Porirua, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Braai and get together at Battle Hill - 17 January 2026
events.venue: Battle Hill Farm Forest Park,Porirua, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Braai and get together at Battle Hill - 17 January 2026
How about just a casual get together and braai? The last one we had at Battle Hill was so nice and we met so many new people. Noting that this is weather dependent.

Where:
We have secured "The Dell" area for semi-exclusive use at Battle Hill. (It will be Wellington Anniversary weekend so may be a bit busy.) This means a large section of grass with trees, toilets and the river close by for the kids to play in and see the eels and we can braai in webers, etc. The bigger kids that want to go and swim in the hole can take a walk there. Unfortunately, there are no concrete slabs that we can make fires on so you will need to bring a braai with.

What to bring?
Well, this is not a catered place so you will need to bring the following:
Gazebo
Chairs and/or blankets
Braai and charcoal/wood i.e. weber, etc 😉
There are gas braais as well but you will need to share it with the rest of the people / campers.)
Meat, drinks, salad and water/ drinks (to drink and to K*ll your fire with)
Balls, bats, etc for the kids to play (If someone is keen on arranging games for the day, we would appreciate it!)

There is no cost to us getting semi exclusive use of the area. However, if you want to extend the night and camp, you will need to pay for that.

Please note that this is a working farm area and unfortunately no dogs are allowed AT ALL.

Also note that the gates are locked at 8pm so if you are not camping, please keep this in mind so you can get out in time.

This is an open invitation so no need to RSVP to me but it would be nice to have an indication on how many people will attend by confirming on the event "Going" or "Interested".

I hope to see LOTS of you there!

events.name: WFCQ 2026 AOFC | Thailand vs Korea
events.venue: Ākau Tangi Sports Centre,72 Kemp Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
WFCQ 2026 AOFC | Thailand vs Korea
The AOFC Qualification is the Asia–Oceania region’s pathway to the Men’s World Floorball Championships. Ten teams are split into two groups and battle through pool play. The top teams advance to the playoffs and only four teams will qualify for the Men’s World Floorball Championships in Finland in December.

Join us in welcoming teams from:
> New Zealand
> Australia
> Singapore
> Thailand
> Philippines
> Japan
> Korea
> Hong Kong, China
> China
> Solomon Islands

Be there when history happens.

Whether you’re a floorball fan or brand new to the sport, this is your chance to watch world-class international competition on home soil.

Tickets are now available. You have the option of purchasing adult only, child only or family passes in the following options:
> Tournament passes
> Full-day passes
> Evening passes for 7PM games
> Finals passes for 19 January

Secure your seat early.

events.id: International Lessons from Canada | A PopRox Improv Workshop-Toi Poneke Arts Centre,61 - 69 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: International Lessons from Canada | A PopRox Improv Workshop
events.venue: Toi Poneke Arts Centre,61 - 69 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
International Lessons from Canada | A PopRox Improv Workshop
This workshop is a speed-run of everything I learnt at The Heat improv festival in Vancouver, Canada this year. From Estonian mime to Zimbabwe low-fi, Philippines Telenovela to Canadian quickdraw, and our own iconic laconic Kiwi style of improv, I’ll share gems for you to take away and add to your craft.

This workshop is a fundraiser for Second Breakfast to return to Canada in 2026! Help us support our mate Ryan and PopRox founding member Jonny Paul in their international improv adventures, all while getting some awesome new improv intel from one of the nation's finest.

ABOUT THE TEACHER

Ryan (he/him) is an improviser from Te Papaioea, Aotearoa. He’s spent the last decade teaching improv across Aotearoa, including 4 years at NZIF. He’s a two-time New Zealand National Theatresports Champion 2016 & 2017, and is one-third of the trio Second Breakfast who represented Aotearoa in The Heat, an international improv showcase in Vancouver Canada in 2025 (and 2026!)

At the end of the day, he just wants to make people laugh and feel good.

STAND BY LIST

As this workshop is a fundraiser, we will not be operating a Stand-by List. However, tickets are pay what you can from just $30 which we reckon is an absolute bargain!
events.description:
From Estonian mime to Zimbabwe low-fi, Philippines Telenovela to Canadian quickdraw, and our own iconic laconic Kiwi style of improv, I’ll share gems for you to take away and add to your craft.
This workshop is a fundraiser for Second Breakfast to return to Canada in 2026!
Ryan (he/him) is an improviser from Te Papaioea, Aotearoa.
He’s a two-time New Zealand National Theatresports Champion 2016 & 2017, and is one-third of the trio Second Breakfast who represented Aotearoa in The Heat, an international improv showcase in Vancouver Canada in 2025 (and 2026!)
However, tickets are pay what you can from just $30 which we reckon is an absolute bargain!

events.id: Ready to Roll: Th' Dudes, Mockers & Stellar* | Brewtown, Upper Hutt-Brewtown Upper Hutt,25 Blenheim Street, Upper Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Ready to Roll: Th' Dudes, Mockers & Stellar* | Brewtown, Upper Hutt
events.venue: Brewtown Upper Hutt,25 Blenheim Street, Upper Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Ready to Roll: Th' Dudes, Mockers & Stellar* | Brewtown, Upper Hutt
This summer, three of Aotearoa’s most beloved bands hit the road for Ready To Roll, a brand-new touring show celebrating New Zealand music and sun-soaked good times. Featuring the legendary Th’ Dudes, iconic Mockers, and multi-platinum favourites Stellar*, the tour will bring timeless hits and unforgettable live energy to some of the country’s most picturesque summer locations.

Ready To Roll pays homage to the iconic TV music chart show that ran from the 1970s through to the 1990s. As New Zealand’s homegrown version of the Top 40 countdown, Ready To Roll became appointment viewing for generations of music fans, a showcase for both international chart-toppers and breakthrough Kiwi acts. It helped launch and cement countless careers while becoming a cultural touchstone in Aotearoa. Reviving the name for this tour nods to its legacy of celebrating great music and good times, a perfect fit for a summer series featuring three of the country’s most enduring and much-loved groups.

events.id: Butter Wouldn't Melt & Ari Leason at Vogelmorn-Vogelmorn Bowling Club,93 Mornington Rd, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Butter Wouldn't Melt & Ari Leason at Vogelmorn
events.venue: Vogelmorn Bowling Club,93 Mornington Rd, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Butter Wouldn't Melt & Ari Leason at Vogelmorn
Join us for an evening of heartfelt folk music, starting with Ōtaki-born singer-songwriter Ari Leason, whose soulful blend of indie folk and intimate storytelling shines through her debut album Hello Darling. Honest, vulnerable, and deeply authentic, Ari brings songs shaped by activism, travel, and a coming-of-age journey that resonates long after the last note.
Headlining the night, Butter Wouldn't Melt recently released their album Where the roots grow deep, which hit Number 3 on the Aotearoa Music Charts. This 5-piece folk band is made up of Andrea Reid (guitar and vocals) Nick Burfield (guitar and vocals), Marz Connelly (bass and vocals), Mikey Muggeridge (mandolin and vocals), and Cara Brasted (fiddle and vocals). Through powerful harmonies and upbeat instrumentals, they tie together folk, Americana, country, bluegrass styles to bring their own twist to New Zealand storytelling. As timeless as it is deeply personal, you won't want to miss this performance!

Doors: 6:30pm
Music: 7pm

All Ages
Entry Cover charge*
Unwaged $15
Waged $20
Support the Artists $30
*Guide only - booking fees may apply
https://www.undertheradar.co.nz/gig/99924/Butter-Wouldnt-Melt-With-Ari-Leason.utr

"Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community
space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our neighbours. The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a table for pre-show kai email Alice at ”

events.id: Summer Singing Retreat-2 Rhine Street, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Summer Singing Retreat
events.venue: 2 Rhine Street, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Start the new year with intention in a fun and inclusive environment. The beginning of the year is a perfect time to get together and feel the power of community and connection through singing.
Sing for renewal and hope. Sing for harmony, joy, and inspiration. Sing for healing. Sing to regain your strength and empower others.
Spend the 2 days encircled by a community of like-minded people and focusing on your well-being through singing. Rest, connect, and restore. The weekend is carefully planned so there is plenty of time to sing and to rest in between.
We will breathe together, listen, create beautiful sounds, let go of our worries, and lift each other to a sense of fulfillment and joy. And to make the event even more special, Lala will be cooking an authentic Malagasy dinner on Saturday night (an experience not to be missed).
Jonathan Berkahn and Lala Simpson have been working together, leading workshops and performing for many years. They are both highly skilled song leaders who lead from the heart and joyfully share their gifts. You will be in safe hands. ALL SINGERS OF ALL LEVELS OF ABILITY ARE WELCOME!!!
Jonathan will teach a mix of pop, folk and original songs, and Lala will teach a mix of songs from South Africa, Georgia, Madagascar and community songs.
If you are coming from out of town, the Home of Compassion offers some accommodation with reasonable rates which includes breakfast. Please contact them directly to enquire islandbay@compassion.org.nz
SCHEDULE
Saturday, 17th of January: This first part of the retreat will be at the Island Bay Presbyterian Church. We will spend the day singing in the beautiful auditorium and share a Malagasy meal cooked by Lala at the end of the day. Morning tea, afternoon tea, and dinner provided. Please BYO lunch.
Sunday 18th of January: We will be singing in the Lyon Room at the Home of Compassion in Island Bay. We will finish the day singing the songs we learn through the weekend at a FREE community concert in the Chapel. Morning tea, afternoon tea, and lunch provided.
The Iskand Bay Presbyterian Church and the Home of Compassion are within walking distance of each other.
Bring a water bottle, swimming togs if you want to swim in Island Bay during lunch time, and a picnic mat for eating outside.

Sing for healing.

We will finish the day singing the songs we learn through the weekend at a FREE community concert in the Chapel.

events.id: Marlin's Dreaming - Wellington-San Fran,171 Cuba Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Marlin's Dreaming - Wellington
events.venue: San Fran,171 Cuba Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Marlin's Dreaming - Wellington
A year and some change since touring HIRL, Marlin’s Dreaming will again bless Aotearoa’s main city centres for a short summer stint this January 2026.

Marlin’s Dreaming has long been associated with New Zealand’s balmier months, but this marks the band’s first summer tour since 2020, and a chance to play through the back catalogue of hits.

Drawing songs from 2024’s sweet, nostalgia inflected album HIRL, the starry debut Lizard Tears, and the scores of sublime tracks between, it’s a chance for fans to get the complete Marlin’s Dreaming summer experience.

Renowned for their tightly choreographed live shows, the summer tour will add the talents of Tiare Kelly (Benee) on the keys & vocals.

“We’re joining to play a couple of great festivals in Slackbarn and Festival of Lights so wanted to take a moment to get out to Christchurch, Auckland, and Wellington. As well as playing through our back catalogue, we also have new music to tease, that I’m really excited to try out live,” said Semisi Ma’ia’i frontman of Marlin’s Dreaming.

“It wasn’t until after booking these shows that I realised we hadn’t played a summer tour since 2020, which history has shown was one of the most significant things to happen that year.”

As well as its headline shows, Marlin’s Dreaming performs in the Hawke’s Bay at Slackbarn on January 10, and Festival of Lights in New Plymouth on January 11.

The Coveted Team x

events.id: Marlin’s Dreaming - Wellington-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Marlin’s Dreaming - Wellington
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
A year and some change since touring HIRL, Marlin’s Dreaming will again bless Aotearoa’s main city centres for a short summer stint this January 2026.
Marlin’s Dreaming has long been associated with New Zealand’s balmier months, but this marks the band’s first summer tour since 2020, and a chance to play through the back catalogue of hits. 
Drawing songs from 2024’s sweet, nostalgia inflected album HIRL, the starry debut Lizard Tears, and the scores of sublime tracks between, it’s a chance for fans to get the complete Marlin’s Dreaming summer experience.
Renowned for their tightly choreographed live shows, the summer tour will add the talents of Tiare Kelly (Benee) on the keys & vocals.  
“We’re joining to play a couple of great festivals in Slackbarn and Festival of Lights so wanted to take a moment to get out to Christchurch, Auckland, and Wellington. As well as playing through our back catalogue, we also have new music to tease, that I’m really excited to try out live,” said Semisi Ma’ia’i frontman of Marlin’s Dreaming.
“It wasn’t until after booking these shows that I realised we hadn’t played a summer tour since 2020, which history has shown was one of the most significant things to happen that year.”
As well as its headline shows, Marlin’s Dreaming performs in the Hawke’s Bay at Slackbarn on January 10, and Festival of Lights in New Plymouth on January 11.



San Fran holds a Supervised License. Minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue.

events.id: Vietnamese Art Exhibition: Những Miền Đất Nhớ | Lands We Remember-Wellington, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Vietnamese Art Exhibition: Những Miền Đất Nhớ | Lands We Remember
events.venue: Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Những Miền Đất Nhớ (Lands We Remember) is a Vietnamese contemporary art exhibition by respected artist Đặng Mậu Tựu, proudly presented as part of Viet Hub NZ’s Lunar New Year (Tết) Festival 2026.
This exhibition shares the journey of an artist from another country and culture who immersed himself in life in Aotearoa New Zealand. Through approximately 30 original artworks, he reflects on how two worlds - Vietnam and Aotearoa - meet, overlap, and quietly converse. The works explore cultural memory, identity, belonging, and the emotional experience of living between homelands.
Created during the artist’s stay in New Zealand, these paintings offer an intimate, lived perspective - capturing moments of connection, unfamiliarity, and shared humanity through a deeply Vietnamese artistic lens. This exhibition is both a cultural bridge and a personal story told through art.
This is Viet Hub NZ’s first Vietnamese community art exhibition, created with care, whānau values, and a strong commitment to accessibility and cross-cultural understanding. Whether you love art, culture, storytelling, or simply discovering new perspectives, Những Miền Đất Nhớ invites you to pause, reflect, and connect.

This exhibition shares the journey of an artist from another country and culture who immersed himself in life in Aotearoa New Zealand.

Start your Sunday with creativity, connection, and the taste of possibility. Join us for Wineful Dreams at Forrest Wines, a mindful vision board workshop designed to help you visualise the year ahead.

We begin with reflection and a grounding meditation, then design a personal vision board while enjoying Forrest’s wines and shared platters in a relaxed, inspiring setting.

As the session concludes, stay on for Forrest’s famous Sunday live music and let your vision flow into an afternoon of good wine, laughter, and summer vibes.

Ovus - Cascade Release Show - ft Kokoa Nashi & LadyReign
Ovus present their latest EP CASCADE, live on 18th Jan 2026 at Valhalla Tavern (Wellington Anniversary Weekend).

With support from the mega talented KOKOA NASHI and local powerhouse LADYREIGN.


------------------------------------------------------------
Doors 7:30 // First Band 8pm

OVUS
KOKOA NASHI
LADYREIGN

Tickets $25 +b.f. via Cosmic Ticketing (Live soon). Limited door sales.
--------------------------------------------------------------


Ovus are Wellington's premier instrumental progressive metal act. A massive sound that crashes soaring guitar melodies into mind boggling rhythms with a finesse that keeps a catchy through-line in every song. Their live show is high energy, immersive and packed full of riffs.

New Zealand's 2025 Battle of the Bands National Championship winners Kokoa Nashi bring a vibe like no other. Blending hip hop with progressive rock and metal sensibilities, you've never heard anything like it, and you'll have a blast experiencing it!

LadyReign is a six-piece alternative-metal band fronted by two powerful female vocalists. Fresh off the release of their newest single Crowd, LadyReign fuzes soulful melodies with the crushing heaviness of modern metal to create a sound that is both haunting and refreshing.

events.name: Unglued
events.venue: Meow,17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Unglued
One of the most in-demand names in UK drum’n’bass is touching down in Aotearoa.

From early breakout cuts like Ay! and Bootstrap Bill to his viral rework of If We Ever, Unglued has carved a reputation for high-impact production and fast-moving, peak-time DJ sets built for the rave — no filler, just pressure. Now signed exclusively to Hospital Records, he’s showing no signs of slowing down.

Coming in hot off the Soundsplash stage, this is a rare chance to catch one of the scene’s most reliable floor-destroyers up close.

events.id: LONG LUNCH in the Waitarere Beach Forest-19 Hydrabad Drive, Waitārere Beach 5510, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: LONG LUNCH in the Waitarere Beach Forest
events.venue: 19 Hydrabad Drive, Waitārere Beach 5510, New Zealand
events.long_description:
HELLO BEACH LOVERS
The Waitārere Forest Long Lunch
- Sunday 18 January 2026
- book your tickets online
Get ready for one of the highlights of our Waitārere summer calendar - the Waitārere Forest Long Lunch is returning on Sunday, 18 January 2026, and it’s looking to be our biggest and best yet!
 Held beneath the towering pines of the Waitārere Forest, this annual event is all about community,   connection, and celebration. The Long Lunch has become a much-loved tradition for residents and visitors alike - a day to relax, share good food, and enjoy the easy-going Waitārere lifestyle that makes our beach so special.
We’re proud to announce that "Gareth Heard and the team from Unique Realty" are now our major sponsors for Long Lunch. Their generous support is helping us make this year’s event extra special, including an exciting $500 cash giveaway to one lucky ticket holder! You must be present on the day to claim the prize, so make sure you don’t miss out on what promises to be an unforgettable afternoon.
Early Bird Tickets: $15* per person (01 Dec - 11 Jan)
Standard Tickets: $20* per person (12 Jan - 17 Jan)
Gate Sales Tickets: $25* per person (18 Jan)
*Fee (per Ticket/Order) 3% + 30c
All tables and chairs are provided - bring your own plates, cutlery, glasses, drinks, and a plate of food to share. From homemade favourites to gourmet treats, the shared tables are always overflowing with creativity, flavour, and generosity.
And don’t forget - the Long Lunch is also a major fundraiser for our community. There will be raffles, auctions, and prizes throughout the day, so bring plenty of cash and help us raise funds for local projects that make Waitārere Beach an even better place to live.
This year’s fundraising focus:
The Upgrade of the Community House Preschoolers' playground on Rua Ave.
It’s more than just a meal - it’s a celebration of our people and our place. Whether you’re a full-time local or here on holiday, you’ll be part of something special: great food, great company, and great memories under the forest canopy.
So gather your friends, pack your picnic gear, and join us for the Waitārere Forest Long Lunch. Let’s make this a summer to remember - full of laughter, flavour, and community spirit.
See you under the pines
on Sunday, 18 January 2026!

You must be present on the day to claim the prize, so make sure you don’t miss out on what promises to be an unforgettable afternoon.
