events.long_description:
New Moon, New Year, New Energy: Kundalini Yoga and Gong Bath Workshop
A Kundalini Yoga and Gong Bath workshop to set seeds of intention for 2026

About this Event

Step into the first New Moon of 2026 with clarity, grounding, and an open channel for possibility.
✨ A nourishing way to begin the year in alignment.
Join Mel for a restorative and empowering Kundalini Yoga class, utilising the Opportunity & Green Energy Kriya—a sequence that awakens fresh potential, clears stagnant energy, and aligns you with abundance and opportunity.
After yoga, sink into deep rest with a 1 hour healing Gong Bath — where you lie down and let the soothing vibrations and sounds of the gong support inner renewal, nervous system reset, and integration of your intentions.
During the break between yoga and the gong bath, there will be time for guided journalling and a herbal tea break - creating space to plant the seeds of your intentions for 2026 or for the month ahead. This reflective moment helps you anchor your vision and consciously direct your energy for the new cycle.
🧘‍♀️ Kundalini Yoga: 1.30pm – 3.00pm
☕ Break: Herbal tea, healthy snack, guided journalling & oracle cards
🎶 Gong Bath: 3.30pm – 4.30pm
✨ Come for one session or enjoy the full workshop experience.

💫Open to all levels – no experience with yoga or sound healing needed.
💫 Bring your intentions, an open heart, a yoga mat, blanket, water bottle and anything you need to feel cozy + supported.
Investment:
$35 Yoga | $30 Gong Bath | $55 Both | January special: $100: 2 people for Both sessions (must be booked together)


Agenda


🕑: 01:30 PM - 03:00 PM
Kundalini Yoga | $35
Info: Move, breathe, and reset your energy with a nourishing Kundalini Yoga practice to clear the mind, reset your energy, and reconnect with your body. No prior experience necessary - open to all levels.


🕑: 03:30 PM - 04:30 PM
Gong Bath | $30
Info: Soothe your nervous system and bathe in the healing frequencies of the gong. This is a deeply restful, restorative session — no movement required, just lie back and receive.

events.id: Stewart Copeland — Have I said Too Much?-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Stewart Copeland — Have I said Too Much?
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
He’s had an incredible life as a performer, musician, entertainer, and writer. Stewart Copeland is one of the great rock drummers. He comes to Wellington for the first time in January with his show, ‘Have I Said Too Much?’ It features Stewart in conversation with acclaimed media host Sarah Tout (RTR FM). Fans also have the opportunity to ask questions by submitting them before the show. 
Stewart’s remarkable talent helped drive The Police to world fame between 1977 and 1986, and then again in 2007 and 2008 when the band was reunited. He is a multiple Grammy Award winner and, in 2003, was inducted into the Rock and Rock Hall of Fame. He has written best-selling books, directed documentaries, formed supergroups, made films, and composed music for ballet, opera, and classical concerts. This is a rare opportunity to get an insight into a performer’s fascinating life.

events.id: Stewart Copeland Australia + New Zealand Tour - Jan 2026 | Opera House, Wellington-Opera House,111–113 Manners Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Stewart Copeland Australia + New Zealand Tour - Jan 2026 | Opera House, Wellington
events.venue: Opera House,111–113 Manners Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Stewart Copeland Australia + New Zealand Tour - Jan 2026 | Opera House, Wellington
We are thrilled to announce the legendary Stewart Copeland will be returning to Australia and New Zealand in January 2026.

A driving force in music for more than four decades, Stewart’s innovative drumming propelled him to fame with The Police alongside Sting and Andy Summers, creating some of the most iconic records in music history.

A seven-time Grammy winner and Rock & Roll Hall of Fame inductee, his career spans rock, symphony, opera, documentaries and even video games, including the acclaimed Spyro the Dragon. All the while, Stewart continues to push boundaries with humor, creativity, and a sense of adventure.

Join us for an unforgettable night of conversation as he shares maybe a little too much about The Police, Hollywood and other adventures.

All shows will be hosted by acclaimed radio presenter Sarah Tout and include an opportunity for fan submitted questions to be answered each night.

𝐓𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐃𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐬:
📍Perth: Sun 11 Jan - Regal Theatre, Perth
📍Melbourne: Wed 14 Jan - Forum II, Melbourne
📍Sydney: Fri 16 Jan - State Theatre, Sydney
📍Brisbane: Sat 17 Jan - The Tivoli, Brisbane
📍Wellington: Tue 20 Jan - Opera House, Wellington
📍Auckland: Wed 21 Jan - Bruce Mason Centre, Auckland

Tickets (including meet & greet packages) are on sale now via birdsrobe.com.

Presented by: Frontier Touring & MG Live by arrangement with One Fiinix Live Frontier Touring and MG Live are thrilled to announce the hotly anticipated return of global superstar Ed Sheeran, who is heading back to New Zealand next January with his all-new Loop Tour.
Having already sold over 2.5 million tickets across Australia and New Zealand to date, Ed Sheeran’s Loop Tour sees the beloved singer returning to our shores with a brand-new live show that’ll follow the release of his new album, Play – out Friday 12 September.
Performing at Sky Stadium in Wellington Ed’s new live show promises to be filled with surprises, new music, as well as his biggest hits.
With a brand-new album, a renewed creative spirit and a catalogue of global hits, Ed Sheeran’s 2026 stadium tour is set to be one of the most anticipated live events of the year.
Don’t miss the return of one of the world’s most loved live performers!

events.id: Beoga-171 Cuba Street, New Zealand 6011,Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Beoga
events.venue: 171 Cuba Street, New Zealand 6011,Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Beoga
Acclaimed Irish band Beoga will make their long-awaited return to New Zealand in January 2026, performing two intimate headline shows in Auckland and Wellington.

Known for their adventurous spirit and willingness to chart new musical territory, Beoga have redefined the possibilities of Irish traditional music. Their global reach was cemented through collaborations with Ed Sheeran on the record-breaking ÷ (Divide) album, including the smash hits “Galway Girl” and “Nancy Mulligan.” The former has now surpassed 1.4 billion streams on Spotify alone.

After a four-year hiatus from touring and releasing music, Beoga made a powerful comeback earlier this year with their new album Phases, released in June. The band went on to perform at Glastonbury and Coachella, where they shared the stage with Shaboozey, Alex Warren, and Ed Sheeran at his now-famous Old Phone Pub pop-up experience.

With a GRAMMY nomination, international tours, and collaborations with some of the biggest names in music, Beoga have established themselves as one of Ireland’s most exciting and genre-blurring acts. Their sound fuses accordion, fiddle, keyboards, guitars, and vocals into a vibrant, modern take on Irish roots music that feels both timeless and new.

events.id: Telescope Mastery-Star Safari Observatory, 1169 Ponatahi Road, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Telescope Mastery
events.venue: Star Safari Observatory, 1169 Ponatahi Road, Carterton
events.long_description:
Our Telescope Course is back!

You already own a telescope, but...

If you already have a telescope and would like to learn more about how to use it, how to collimate it and any other maintenance they need, what type of eyepieces are the best to buy and any other equipment.

BRING YOUR TELESCOPE ALONG!
OR

You don't have a telescope, but...

would like to learn how to use one, don't fret! We have 14, and you can learn all about them.

Your instructor:
Sam, our resident astrophysicist.

Sam is skilled in explaining the intricacies of telescope operation and makes learning both accessible and engaging. Our course offers hands-on experience with our diverse collection of 14 telescopes, ranging from classic reflectors to sophisticated refractors and versatile catadioptrics.

Where: Star Safari Observatory - 10 minutes from Martinborough


There's no "but" after our course. You'll know exactly:

- Where to start?

- What to do?

- How to get the best out of your telescope?

- What must you consider if you wish to plunge into deep-sky astrophotography?

You get:
A collimation cap - no more guesswork on how to collimate your telescope. With this tool, you can keep your telescope sharp.

Tea and coffee - refreshments.

Bring your lunch and a picnic blanket! We have a spectacular setting at Star Safari Observatory, and we will stop for a lunch break to enjoy our Moon garden and the surroundings.

Take the giant leap; reach for the stars!

At the end of the course, you'll learn all about the types of telescopes available and mounts, attachments, and eyepieces. We cover the whole lot. We have been using telescopes for a long time and now have an excellent range for our public sessions and at our home observatory.

We're not affiliated with retailers, so our advice is unbiased and based on our years of experience with lugging telescopes around the world, maintaining them and using them.

events.id: Reiki Circle to Align Your Pathways-Bhakti Lounge Wellington,175 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Reiki Circle to Align Your Pathways
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington,175 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Reiki Circle to Align Your Pathways
Relax and restore in a gentle Reiki Circle designed to balance your energy, calm the mind, and nurture inner peace

About this Event

Reiki Circle to Align Your Pathways
A soothing Reiki Circle designed to provide gentle biofield support. This session invites relaxation, balance, and heart coherence using a hands-off, consent-based approach. You’ll feel the nurturing energy flowing as you connect with yourself and others in a warm, welcoming space.
Plus - your ticket includes an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert!
This workshop is perfect for anyone experiencing:
•⁠ ⁠Stress and overwhelm
•⁠ ⁠Wired-and-tired fatigue
•⁠ ⁠Overthinking and mental clutter
•⁠ ⁠Sleep disruption
•⁠ ⁠Heaviness in the chest
•⁠ ⁠Creative blocks
Whether you're a beginner or familiar with Reiki, you are warmly welcomed.
What to expect:
•⁠ ⁠Arrival Ritual and Consent: Settle into the space and establish your intention.
•⁠ ⁠Guided Breath Arrival: Begin with a gentle breathing exercise to ground yourself.
•⁠ ⁠Group Reiki Session: Experience a soothing hands-off Reiki session accompanied by a soft soundscape.
•⁠ ⁠Quiet Reflection: Take time to integrate your experience in a peaceful environment.
•⁠ ⁠Grounding Tea: Enjoy a cup of tea to nourish and ground you after the session.
What to bring:
•⁠ ⁠Warm layers and socks
•⁠ ⁠Water bottle
•⁠ ⁠Small towel
•⁠ ⁠Optional eye mask or light scarf
•⁠ ⁠Journal and pen
•⁠ ⁠If you tend to feel cold, consider bringing a blanket
Pre-class prep:
•⁠ ⁠Eat a light meal 2 hours before the class.
•⁠ ⁠Hydrate well throughout the day.
•⁠ ⁠Avoid alcohol and recreational substances for 24 hours prior, ideally 3 days before
•⁠ ⁠Limit caffeine intake 4 hours before class.
•⁠ ⁠Arrive 10 minutes early for intake.
•⁠ ⁠If you have health conditions, check with your provider before attending.
•⁠ ⁠Feel free to email Lynn at hi@lynofuro.co.nz with any questions or concerns.
Contraindications and safety
Reiki is gentle and typically safe, but it's essential to note that it does not replace medical or mental health care. If you have acute psychiatric distress, unmanaged seizures, or are recovering from surgery, please consult your provider first. Inform Lynn if you are wearing a pacemaker or under medications.
Aftercare
After the session, we encourage you to drink plenty of water, nourish yourself with healthy lighter food, engage in simple movement or a short walk, and journal your insights. Emotional waves may continue for 24 to 48 hours, so please reach out if you need support.




Event followed by a plant-based dinner and dessert, all included in your ticket!


Meet Lynn, your facilitator:
Lynn is an integrative somatic coach and Reiki practitioner dedicated to supporting individuals in navigating corporate burnout, chronic pain, and stress. Her approach is gentle and accessible, making spiritual practices approachable and friendly to the nervous system.
Questions before you join? Email hi@lynofuro.co.nz, and Lynn will support you.



Agenda


🕑: 06:00 PM - 06:15 PM
Arrive to Bhakti Lounge

🕑: 06:15 PM - 07:15 PM
Reiki Circle to Align Your Pathways
Host: Lynn

🕑: 07:15 PM - 08:15 PM
Plant-based dinner and dessert!

events.name: Sound Healing Experience
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington,175 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Sound Healing Experience
Experience Claudio Escutia’s restorative sound journey—ancient instruments guiding you into deep relaxation and inner calm

About this Event

Sound Healing Experience
Step into an evening of restorative soundscapes, where multi-instrumentalist Claudio Escutia will guide you through a deeply calming and rejuvenating experience. Your ticket also includes a delicious plant-based dinner and dessert to complete the evening.
Ancient instruments—from Gongs to Crystal and Tibetan singing bowls and Native American flutes—come together in a rich tapestry of sound, inviting you to slow down, breathe, and reconnect with yourself.
With Claudio’s masterful soundscapes, you’ll not only hear the music but feel it vibrating through your body, encouraging profound relaxation and a reconnection to your heart. No prior meditation or yoga experience is needed—simply arrive as you are and let the music carry you into a space of calm and presence.
What to Bring
Yoga mats, blankets, and cushions are provided, but you are welcome to bring your own mat or extra comforts for a truly personal experience.






Event followed by a plant-based dinner and dessert, all included in your ticket!



Meet Claudio, your host
Born into a musical family in Mexico City, Claudio’s lifelong passion for sound has taken him across the globe—from studying jazz in Montreal to mastering Tibetan singing bowls in Kathmandu. His music weaves together classical training, world instruments (Sitar, Esraj, Harmonium, and more), and a deep reverence for sound as medicine.
Ready to unwind and recharge through the magic of vibration?
Learn more or listen to Claudio’s music here:
SoundCloud: Claudio Escutia
Instagram: Claudio Escutia Yoga and Sound Healing (@claudio_yoga_sound_healing)
Facebook: Claudio Escutia Yoga - Sound Healing- Music




Agenda


🕑: 06:00 PM - 06:15 PM
Arrive to Bhakti Lounge

🕑: 06:15 PM - 07:15 PM
Sound Healing Experience
Host: Claudio Escutia

🕑: 07:15 PM - 08:15 PM
Plant-based dinner and dessert!

events.id: Beoga New Zealand 2026 | Wellington-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Beoga New Zealand 2026 | Wellington
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
Acclaimed Irish band Beoga will make their long-awaited return to New Zealand in January 2026, performing two intimate headline shows in Auckland and Wellington.
Known for their adventurous spirit and willingness to chart new musical territory, Beoga have redefined the possibilities of Irish traditional music. Their global reach was cemented through collaborations with Ed Sheeran on the record-breaking ÷ (Divide) album, including the smash hits “Galway Girl” and “Nancy Mulligan.” The former has now surpassed 1.4 billion streams on Spotify alone.
After a four-year hiatus from touring and releasing music, Beoga made a powerful comeback earlier this year with their new album Phases, released in June. The band went on to perform at Glastonbury and Coachella, where they shared the stage with Shaboozey, Alex Warren, and Ed Sheeran at his now-famous Old Phone Pub pop-up experience.
With a GRAMMY nomination, international tours, and collaborations with some of the biggest names in music, Beoga have established themselves as one of Ireland’s most exciting and genre-blurring acts. Their sound fuses accordion, fiddle, keyboards, guitars, and vocals into a vibrant, modern take on Irish roots music that feels both timeless and new.

San Fran holds a Supervised License. Minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue.

events.venue: The Opera House Wellington, Wellington, NZ
events.long_description:
General Admission OnlyAll Tickets are Mobile Ticket Only. 
Mobile Tickets are like Print-at-Home tickets but instead of having to print off the tickets yourself, you can just show the barcode on your mobile phone. It is the easiest way to access tickets to your events. For more information visit Ticketmaster.co.nz/mobileticket

Join us for a behind-the-scenes tour of Wellington's iconic St James Theatre and The Opera House. Discover hidden stories, architectural splendour, and rich theatrical history as you step behind the velvet curtain and explore two of the city's most beloved performance spaces. Led by expert guides, this tour takes you on a journey through over a century of theatre magic. Tread the boards in the footsteps of legendary performers. Uncover the secrets of stagecraft and marvel at the breathtaking details of these heritage-listed buildings. From opulent foyers and ornate auditoriums to backstage corridors brimming with history, you'll see the theatres as you've never seen them before.

events.id: Cooking Classes-Sheila's Indian Kitchen, Ashton Fitchett Dr, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Cooking Classes
events.venue: Sheila's Indian Kitchen, Ashton Fitchett Dr, Wellington
events.long_description:
Authentic Indian cooking classes in Wellington with panaromic views over Wellington Harbour.

In each class, you will learn 4-5 recipes like: potato stuff roti, roasted eggplant curry, wholemeal, roti, naan; shahi paneer; dhal, samosa; palak paneer; gourmet chickpeas; vegetable korma; gulab jamun; kheer; mango lassi; masala chai, and many more...

The classes start at 6 pm or 10:30 am on weekends and weekdays with a 2-hour session followed by a dinner or lunch afterwards. The ingredients, copies of recipes, organic karma drink will be provided with a full course meal in a banquet setting. Custom made classes available for gluten free, dairy free and any other food intolerance and dietary requirements.The ingredients, recipes, complimentary organic karma drinks will be provided with a full course meal.

There are 2 to 8 people in each class in purpose built cooking studio. Also a private cooking classes available.

The menu for the class can be:

1) Spicy potato stuffed paratha and roti, rajasthani tomato relish, aalu matter or spicy peas- potato curry, roasted cumin yogurt raita and fresh mint- coriander chutney.

2) Shahi Paneer (cottage cheese cubes with spices and rich tomato-cashew gravy), garlic coriander naan, cumin jeera basmati rice and sweet fragrant rice pudding with cardamom. Also I will teach how to make fresh paneer.

3) Roasted eggplant curry, plain whole wheat chapatti or roti, jeera aaloo or potato curry, Tuar dahl (split yellow lentil) and Basmati rice with homemade pickle.

4) Palak paneer (creamy spinach curry with cubes of paneer), jeera rice (basmati rice with fragrant spices, panjabi chhole or spicy chickpeas curry and mango lassi. Also fresh paneer making.

5) Khadi (chickpeas fritters in yogurt and chickpeas flour soupy gravy), Aloo-Gobhi (cauliflower and potato curry),  savoury wraps with herbs and spices, fresh pickle and basmati rice.

The total cost is $130 per person, this includes ingredient cost. (As an alternative we also sell cooking class gift vouchers.The food options are unlimited and the class provides fresh and best ingredients)
For booking a class please contact indiancooking@xtra.co.nz

Just bring your taste buds! and Enjoy!!

events.id: Rider Biochemics with Fran from Firmly Fit-2351 state highway 3, Sanson, New Zealand 4479,2351 SH 3, Sanson 4479, New Zealand, Palmerston North-All Events In
events.name: Rider Biochemics with Fran from Firmly Fit
events.venue: 2351 state highway 3, Sanson, New Zealand 4479,2351 SH 3, Sanson 4479, New Zealand, Palmerston North
events.long_description:
Rider Biochemics with Fran from Firmly Fit
Pilates is unique in its total body approach to movement. It gives you balance, strength and flexibility, emphasizing the deep postural muscles of the abdomen and back.
All these skills and principles lay a foundation for good riding – Posture, Postural Support, and Body Awareness and Body Control are tools a rider needs in the saddle.
Through carefully designed movements, the correct abdominal and back muscles engage to align the spine maintaining good posture while the horse is moving.
This allows the rider to stay in self-carriage, balanced over the middle of the horse. Suppleness of shoulders, and minimal gripping with legs is then possible.
Many Pilates exercises also develop balance in the muscles of the hip joints to promote maximal range of motion. Many riders have had falls and injuries that contribute towards imbalance which can be fixed with Pilates.
With the rider being balanced and pain free the horse can perform better making the riding relationship harmonious.
Booking is essential
$85.00 per session
$15.00 Arena fee
Payments are due16th January 2026 5pm
Once booked & paid you own it, if you have to cancel please do so before the 16th so we can find someone else, if you have already paid you will receive a refund on filling your spot.
Any cancellations from 16th Jan to time of session there will be no refund given.

events.long_description:
Personal Spiritual Healing
Spiritual Healing is a healing modality where the practitioner acts as a clear channel for the healing energy to come through. Spiritual Healing is an effective method to bring about a deep, relaxing, enjoyable state which promotes self-healing. In some cases it will deal with the emotional release that is required at the time.
Spiritual Healing enables you to feel an inner peace. The loving touch of comfort and reassurance to regain the power within you, is always present.
The healing can be a moving and a heart felt experience.
Energy is transmitted to you during the healing, all you have to do is open your heart to receive the healing energy.
It strengthens your whole wellbeing.
No appointment is necessary on Saturday, just come on in.
A Spiritual Healing session usually takes 20-30 minutes.
Where: King Lion Hall
12 King Street, Upper Hutt

events.name: Silent Retreat - A Day of Calm, Creativity & Inner Connection
events.venue: Lotus Yoga Centre,91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Silent Retreat - A Day of Calm, Creativity & Inner Connection
🌸 Silent Retreat – A Day of Calm, Creativity & Inner Connection

Hosted by Lisa Conroy from Living the Sweet Life & Tracey Crandall from CharlieRae/TraceyLidene Art

📍 Lotus Yoga & Retreat Centre, 91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu (a short stroll from the train station)
🗓️ Saturday, 24th January 2026
🕐10.00am - 3.00pm
💰 $125 — all materials provided
🥗 Light refreshments available throughout the day (BYO lunch)
✨ Event Link: https://facebook.com/events/s/silent-retreat-a-day-of-calm-c/1831388837742351/?

Shhh… can you hear it? That gentle whisper calling you back to yourself? 💫
Join us for a day designed to quiet the noise and awaken your inner calm through creativity, meditation, and mindful stillness.

You’ll be gently guided through soulful experiences — from sound bowls and meditation to creative journaling, intuitive art, and sacred self-care. This retreat is your space to exhale, reflect, and simply be. Surrounded by nature, a pond and birdsong.

✨ What’s Included:
🌿 Begin your day with a guided meditation and soothing sound healing
🌿 Infuse your crystal of intention — your quiet companion for the day (and it goes home with you)
🌿 Wander between creative stations at your own pace:

* Write a letter to yourself 💌
* Connect with nature through leaf rubbings & botanical sketches 🌸
* Create an intention or dream page from magazines 🌈
* Try teabag art, intuitive breath drawings, and mandala inserts 🎨
* Pull a symbol stone and reflect on what it means to you 🪶

Your beautiful journal (included) will grow with colour, words, and meaning as the day unfolds.

🌸 Pampering & Peace
Because we all need a little nurturing...
🩷 Foot soak stations (ahh, yes please!)
🩷 Self-pampering including warm stones to hold and melt away tension

Prompts to guide your day:
💫 Inspirational gentle prompts
💫 A space to leave little love notes of encouragement to be shared at the end

A gentle, soul-soothing day to rest, create, and reconnect — surrounded by stillness, soft energy, and kind hearts.
✨ Spaces are limited for this intimate experience.

Contact for further information or to book your place.

🪷Tracey Crandall -
🌸Lisa Conroy -


With Creativity, Sparkle & Soul,
Tracey & Lisa
CharlieRae & Living the Sweet Life

👯‍♀️ Meet your co-creators:
Tracey Crandall and Lisa Conroy are two creative souls who live for colour, connection, and sparking joy. Together, they blend art, play, and nurturing rituals into experiences that lift you up, light you up, and leave you glowing inside and out.

events.name: Gindulgence
events.venue: Waitangi Park, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
New Zealand’s most celebrated boutique gin festival. Waitangi Park hosts Gindulgence in January. A group of 18 distillers will showcase a fabulous selection of more than 90 gins and other spirits from New Zealand and around the world. The ticket price includes samples from distillers, so you’ll be able to explore an exceptional range. Delight the senses with botanical flavour combinations. 
This year, it’s not just gin that features in the outdoor fair. You’ll find rum, whisky, vodka, liqueurs and other specialist spirits. Shop for a summer tipple or listen to presentations from some passionate distillers. Alternatively, just sit back on the grass and soak up the atmosphere, accompanied by live acoustic music and great local food.

events.long_description:
Galette Des Rois Workshop
Learn to authentically create Galette Des Rois. Taught by a Le Cordon Bleu Master Chef.

About this Event

During this workshop, our Le Cordon Bleu Master Pâtisserie Chef will demonstrate and guide you through the preparation and baking of authentic Galette Des Rois (Kings Cake) a traditional French dessert enjoyed in Januray.
What is a Le Cordon Bleu Workshop? A Le Cordon Bleu workshop involves hands on kitchen activity. Be personally guided by world class chefs within our industrial kitchen classrooms. Learn techniques to elevate your cooking during an intensive day course, light lunch included.
Date: 24th January 2026
Time: 9am – 4pm (light lunch is included)
Location: Level 2, 52 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington
Allergies: Ingredients in this class contain the following allergens: Wheat, egg, treenuts, soy, and dairy. Please note, our pâtisserie kitchen stores varieties of nuts and traces will be present in the environment (but only almond will be directly used in this workshop).
You Will Create:
Inverted Puff Pastry
Almond Cream
Two Galettes des Rois to bring home
Course Details: During the workshop, you will learn the following skills:
The roles of the ingredients
Making inverted puff pastry
Lamination skills
Cutting and decorating skills
Course Includes: All ingredients and equipment supplied, a light lunch is included. Everything you make is yours to take home.
Contact Details: +64 4 472 9800 |

events.long_description:
The Velvet Glove Play the Songs of The Velvet Underground, Unplugged
The Velvet Glove Play the Songs of The Velvet Underground, Unplugged

In the early 70s Cripple was one of the first bands to fall under the influence of The Velvet Underground, a signature ingredient of the Dunedin sound. Lou Reed’s remarkable songwriting - songs like “Sweet Jane” and “I’m Waiting for the Man - found a natural home at the heart of Cripple’s set.

The Velvet Glove reunites three members of that band - John Dodd (Midge Marsden, The Chaps, Skin and Bone), Chris Nichol (The Dunstan Rangers, The Zimmermans) and Lindsay Gregory (The Dunstan Rangers, Heaven Bent). They’re joined by Martin Durrant (Sneaky Feelings, The Zimmermans) and Bill Nichol (Baby) for a one-off performance at The Undercurrent.

Be sure you’re there when The Velvet Glove breathes fresh life into two sets of classic songs from The Velvet Underground catalogue.

The Undercurrent, Saturday January 24.
Doors at 7.00pm
Band at 7.30pm
$20 at Under the Radar (link coming soon!) and the Door.

Snacks, wine, beer & soft drinks, tea & coffee, and of course...books available for purchase!

We’ll see you there ☆

events.id: Wilson Blackley Plays The Shed (The Remain Tour with Oscar LaDell)-46a Victoria Street, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Wilson Blackley Plays The Shed (The Remain Tour with Oscar LaDell)
events.venue: 46a Victoria Street, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wilson Blackley The Remain Tour with Oscar LaDell.
Wilson Blackley is an Australian multi-instrumentalist and producer currently based in Melbourne.
Born and raised in Poowong (Victoria), Wilson was surrounded by music from an early age. At just 2 years old he started playing the drums along to his mother’s music collection consisting of old soul, funk and r&b from the 60’s and 70’s. He started learning the guitar as soon as he could, and had the habit of making anything he could get his hands on into an instrument. Growing up far from the city instilled a strong sense of curiosity and work ethic in him from a young age, leading him to produce his first batch of demos in his teenage years. A stand-out among these demos was the song ‘Home’
‘Home’ found its way to Sam Teskey (The Teskey Brothers) who would go on to co-produce the song alongside Wilson when he was just 18.
Following the release of ‘Home’, he went on to sell out The Gasometer and play a string of festival slots alongside a variety of artists including The Teskey Brothers and Boy and Bear.
At this time, Wilson moved to St Kilda and in the heart of Melbourne began collaborating with Sensible J (Sampa The Great, Remi, Immy Owusu) on his debut EP ‘Material Plane P1’ which was released to critical acclaim in August 2022. After that, he co-produced Oscar LaDell’s EP ‘No Blue’ and subsequently embarked on a co-headline tour of Aotearoa and Australia with LaDell. After a three year break from releasing music, Wilson Blackley will return with his new song ‘Wired’ that bridges the sonics from his first EP with what's to come.
Also appearing Oscar LaDell hot off a US tour.
Doors open 8pm for an 8.30pm start.
events.description:
Wilson Blackley The Remain Tour with Oscar LaDell.

A stand-out among these demos was the song ‘Home’ ‘Home’ found its way to Sam Teskey (The Teskey Brothers) who would go on to co-produce the song alongside Wilson when he was just 18.
After that, he co-produced Oscar LaDell’s EP ‘No Blue’ and subsequently embarked on a co-headline tour of Aotearoa and Australia with LaDell.

Artisan Craft Market (25/01/25 Wellington)
The Artisan Craft Market is a premium handmade event that takes place across various locations in the broader Wellington region. This high-quality market is designed to foster a welcoming and friendly atmosphere.

Our vision at Artisan Craft Market is to make the market accessible to those who appreciate shopping locally. We aim to provide a platform that supports local artisans, allowing them to showcase their meticulously crafted, high-quality products. By bringing the market directly to the people, we hope to celebrate and promote the unique talents of our community’s skilled artisans.

About this Event

Why 21 days of meditation for Kundalini Awakening?
Seeking new horizons and self-discovery? Use the New Year 2026- as an opportunity to challenge ourselves to rise higher with one journey we always missed- 'Journey Inside'. Be a part of the 21-day Kundalini Awakening community on Live & Recorded from 25th January (Sunday) 2026, to 14th February (Saturday) 2026 @ 2:45 PM every day. Link shared after signup.YouTube will have daily recordings in case you are unable to join live meeting at the scheduled time. We will schedule additional workshops on Sundays to enable you to join a live meeting. We cleanse our inner subtle system using the powerful yet gentle techniques of Sahaja Yoga Meditation. This is a spiritual meditation in which we awaken the inner energy called Kundalini that gently brings positive change within us-- making us more balanced, peaceful, and joyful. As you participate in daily classes, you will notice physical, emotional and spiritual healing. With pure desire, you may also feel Kundalini energy movement and its working on your fingertips and other physical manifestations. It will enable you to raise your consciousness to a higher dimension. Sahaja Yoga Meditation is volunteer-run, always free, and practiced in more than 100 countries.
No prior meditation or Kundalini awakening experience is needed.
Are you seeking awakening from the heart?
**********************************************************************************
Who is organizing this course?
A team of Sahaja Yoga meditation volunteers has been practicing and teaching 'Sahaja Yoga' meditation for decades. Sahaja Yoga meditation was invented by 'Shri Mataji Nirmala Devi' in 1970, who, in a very Motherly fashion, helped people to take to true meditation easily. The goal of this meditation is to reconnect us to Divinity and experience the universal consciousness within us. It is practiced in more than 100 countries and is always free. The course page is listed below. You need not register on it again.
https://us.sahajayoga.org/21days2026/

All recordings will be on this playlist
21 Days Mediation Course - January 2026 - YouTube

Please save these.
**********************************************************************************
How to join?

Link displayed and emailed after signup. Check your email for the link and more communications.
Same link from 25th January to 14th February, 2026
Have you joined any kind of Online meditation before?

**********************************************************************************
What if I miss a day here and there?
Don't worry if you miss any class; we will help you make up with one-to-one sessions after class. Also, on the website, daily recordings will be available on website below.
https://us.sahajayoga.org/21days2026/,
Do join our WhatsApp group for resources such as recordings and notifications. WhatsApp group link shared during registration. You can either click on the link to join or share your WhatsApp contact number for us to add you to the WhatsApp community, which will be very handy during the 21 days of course.
Will that be enough to help you out with the missed class?
**********************************************************************************
What happens in these 21 Days?
Week 1 Theme: Awaken the Kundalini energy & Know Thyself, and feel energy movement
Week 2 Theme: Spiritual Ascent & Chakras Energy Centres Cleansing
Week 3 Theme: Nirchivarita (thoughtlessness) through meditation. Feel the silence of the universe within you.
Do you believe you can awaken Kundalini and achieve your self-discovery?
**********************************************************************************
Will I be contacted before the course starts?
You will be added to the WhatsApp group -'21 Days of Meditation' in case you have shared your WhatsApp contact during registration. You may get sporadic reminders via email with some useful meditation tips to keep your attention engaged towards the 21-day meditation challenge.
You mind getting reminder?
*********************************************************************************
Is it really free?
Sahaja Yoga meditation is always free. This course is completely free. The only charge is your dedication and sincerity of purpose for your growth. The only question is-
Do we have sincerity of purpose?
**********************************************************************************
What if I have a question?
Please feel free to email or WhatsApp the following if you have any more questions or encounter difficulties joining the Zoom session. We will try to keep you informed about more meditation events.
Sahaja Yoga is a social meditation, and we love to talk about life, its ups and downs, the purpose of life, health & alternatives, and anything you would like to discuss that could enrich your life.
WhatsApp either of the below when you like to talk or chat, and they will respond with suggested day/time.
(Dallas)
+15132038961
(Miami)
+15618666331
Stay safe, and keep meditating!

Have we shared sufficient information for you to decide to join the free course?
**********************************************************************************
Kundalini Awakening
I bow to All the Seekers of Truth. This is a special time in the History of Creation that so many seekers have been born on this Earth. They have realized that there is something beyond than the mundane life they have to seek. This is not the seeking of one life. It is the seeking of ages which is being prophesied, has to be fulfilled now. There have been prophesies and prophesies about this great time. In India about 14,000 years back, Brigu Muni has written a book called Nadi Grant in which He has described you all saying that a day that will come when all these greater seekers, great seekers will be born on this Earth and that their Kundalini which is the Power of their True Desire will be awakened spontaneously and they’ll find out what they are.

But also there has been prophesies about many fake people coming on this Earth and they will try to delude and take people away from the truth.

There have been also great prophesies all over the world but especially in England about hundred years back a great poet called William Blake was born and He has written so clearly, so clearly about Sahaja Yoga that it is surprising how He has even exactly mentioned the house where I’ll be staying. Also that he has said that the men of God, meaning the seekers, the men of God will become prophets and they will have the power to make others prophets. This is the sign we should take when we are seeking the truth.
- Shri Mataji Nirmala Devi (Founder - Sahaja Yoga Meditation)
Bring in your friends and families too to this course :)

🕑: 02:45 PM - 03:00 PM
♂️ Introduction & Recap
Info: If you missed the initial session, you are provided a one-on-one session in a breakout room to get you up to speed


🕑: 03:00 PM - 03:30 PM
♂️ Guided Meditation
Info: ❄️⛅Water, light, fire, sky, ground and other elements will be used to enhance the power of meditation and internal cleansing


🕑: 03:30 PM - 03:45 PM
♂️ One-to-one session (Optional)
Info: On-demand revision, healing, spiritual talks, technique practice, and more...

events.id: Designing exceptional volunteer engagement-level 2/50 The Terrace, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Designing exceptional volunteer engagement
events.venue: level 2/50 The Terrace, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join international volunteer engagement expert Tobi Johnson in an interactive workshop to design a complete volunteer journey. 
Tobi Johnson is an internationally sought-after expert, consultant, and expert trainer in volunteer engagement. She is known for her modern thought leadership, highly practical evidence-based strategies, and innovative, “big hat” thinking around engaging, supporting, and acknowledging the work of volunteers. 
This workshop, to be held in Wellington on Tuesday 27 January, will guide participants through the complete volunteer journey using the Best Practice Guidelines as a framework for exploration. 
Through graphic facilitation, collaborative exercises, and practical brainstorming, you will develop creative and actionable strategies to design a volunteer experience based on the spirit of community. 
If you are a nonprofit that relies on volunteers – with lots of passion but limited resources – this workshop is specifically tailored for you. As community champions, this is an opportunity to explore, visualize, and co-create practical ways to strengthen volunteer engagement, grounded in the shared values that make volunteering in Aotearoa unique. 
About your facilitator Tobi Johnson:
Tobi Johnson is an internationally sought-after expert, consultant, and expert trainer in volunteer engagement. She is known for her modern thought leadership, highly practical evidence-based strategies, and innovative, “big hat” thinking around engaging, supporting, and acknowledging the work of volunteers. 
She is the President of Tobi Johnson & Associates, a consulting firm whose mission is to help nonprofit organizations make connections with remarkable volunteers. In 2015, she founded VolunteerPro, an online training and networking community for leaders of volunteers.  She is host of the Volunteer Nation Podcast and co-host of the Time + Talent Podcast with Jennifer Bennett of VolunteerMatch. In addition, she wrote Chapter 1 of Volunteer Engagement 2.0: Ideas and Insights for Transforming Volunteer Programs in a Changing World. She is also currently at work on a book for volunteers who lead to be published in 2026. 
Tobi has over 30 years boots-on-the-ground experience in nonprofit management, program development and start up, team leadership, training design and delivery and change management across a wide range of cause impact areas from arts and culture, youth development, employment and training, senior services, healthcare advocacy, homelessness, and more. 
Where: Wellington, in person. Level 2, 50 The Terrace (the VNZ offices), Wellington.
When: Tuesday 27 January - 9am to 5pm.
Tickets and pricing:
We have priced tickets based on organisation type, and offer a 25% discount to Volunteering NZ member organisations.
Community Organisations $199 +gst
Government or Business tickets $219 +gst
Limited low cost and complimentary tickets are available for those who need additional support to access tickets. These are aimed at organisations with an annual income between $0 to $140k.
Please contact us directly if you:
Are a Volunteering NZ Member and have not received the discount code of 25%, or
Want to enquire about scholarship or low cost tickets.
Email us on office@volunteeringnz.org.nz or phone us on 04 470 6006. Volunteering NZ member list here.

events.id: Wheatus - 25 Year Anniversary Tour-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Wheatus - 25 Year Anniversary Tour
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
It’s been 25 years since the release of Teenage Dirtbag, and somehow Wheatus’ iconic debut single is bigger than ever. To mark the milestone, the band are heading back to Australia and New Zealand for 11 massive shows January 2026, performing their debut album each night. Fans can also expect requests from across their three-decade career, a cherished tradition at Wheatus headline shows for almost 20 years. It’s a joy to behold. See for yourself. 


San Fran holds a Supervised License. Minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue.

neighbours.”

events.long_description:
January's Reels for Meals movie fundraiser is The Choral.
The Choral is a 2025 British historical drama film co-produced and directed by Nicholas Hytner and written by Alan Bennett. Set in 1916, during World War I, in the fictional town of Ramsden, Yorkshire, the film follows the members of the local choral society which recruits a group of teenage boys and girls for a performance of Edward Elgar's The Dream of Gerontius, a work chosen because it was not written by a German.
Starring Ralph Fiennes, Roger Allam, Mark Addy, Alun Armstrong, Robert Emms, and Simon Russell Beale.

All profits from this movie fundraiser go to the Lower Hutt Foodbank.

events.id: Men's Circle: Authentic Relating-Bhakti Lounge Wellington,175 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Men's Circle: Authentic Relating
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington,175 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Men's Circle: Authentic Relating
A safe, supportive space for men to connect, share openly, and build authentic community through honest conversation and mutual respect

About this Event

Men’s Circle: Authentic Relating
A supportive space for men to come together, connect, and explore life’s challenges in community. This circle welcomes men at all stages — whether you’re navigating change, looking for connection, or simply want a place to be heard.
Engage in open, honest conversations and experience the kind of connection that’s rare but meaningful. There’s no expectation to speak — your presence alone is valued. The circle follows a respectful, non-judgmental format, prioritizing safety, confidentiality, and authenticity.
Optional Plant-Based Dinner
After the circle, stay for a wholesome plant-based dinner and dessert ($15). Sharing a meal is a simple way to extend the sense of community and connection. This gathering is offered on a non-profit basis.





Join us after this free event for an optional plant-based dinner and dessert for only $15 (or $5 for students).





Meet Andre and Sri Jiva, your hosts
Andre has been immersed in men’s work since the age of 13, when he first experienced a rite of passage in Golden Bay. That formative experience sparked a lifelong connection to circle work, which he later deepened by returning as a mentor. Over the years, Andre has come to value the power of sitting in circle—of men coming together in honesty, vulnerability, and presence to witness and support one another. A multi-instrumental musician, poet, and pranayama (breathwork) facilitator, Andre also brings his passion for ecstatic dance, philosophy, and authentic connection into his offerings. He is deeply inspired by the question of what it means to be human—how we can more fully experience our aliveness, our depth, and reconnecting with the beauty of life together.
Since childhood, Sri Jiva has been fascinated by meaning, purpose, and authentic life fulfilment. This, among other things, led him to join a monastery at the age of 19. After years of monastic training, he chose to marry and pursue a career. He felt called to use his monastic experience to help others understand themselves, and to find wisdom, meaning, and purpose in their own lives. Inspired by this calling, he went to university to study counselling. Now, Sri Jiva and his wife live near Wellington, where he works with a small team of counsellors, supporting clients individually and in groups.





Agenda


🕑: 06:00 PM - 06:15 PM
Arrive to Bhakti Lounge

🕑: 06:15 PM - 07:15 PM
Men's Circle: Authentic Relating
Host: Andre

🕑: 07:15 PM - 08:15 PM
Optional Plant-based dinner and dessert!

Experience deep rest and renewal through a guided Yoga Nidra practice that cultivates openness, light, and creative flow for body and mind

Yoga Nidra: Cultivating Openness and Inner Light

This months’s Yoga Nidra practice is designed to cultivate openness, joy, and creative flow. In this session, you’ll be guided into a state of profound rest while exploring the theme of light and expansion—inviting a sense of spaciousness in both body and mind.
Through gentle verbal guidance, you’ll be encouraged to embrace openness, fostering connection, inspiration, and a joyful presence. The experience is complemented by soothing sounds, comforting visuals, and a serene environment that support your journey into inner calm and renewed energy.
This practice is accessible to all levels—no previous experience required. Allow yourself to rest, recharge, and expand into a lighter, more creative state of being.
Plus - there’s an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert included in your ticket!

Meet Emma, your host

With a 100-hour trauma-informed Yin Yoga certification and a background in the corporate world, Emma brings both groundedness and empathy to her teaching. Her approach is slow, intentional, and centered on creating a space where your body feels safe to relax and release

events.id: Inner Marlborough Sounds Kayak Trip-Marlborough Sounds,15 Waterloo Quay, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Inner Marlborough Sounds Kayak Trip
events.venue: Marlborough Sounds,15 Waterloo Quay, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Inner Marlborough Sounds Kayak Trip


Hi this is a trip through the Inner Marlborough Sounds, suitable for beginners who have gone to at least one SKISL and be OK with rescues. The focus is on camping, coffee, and having a fun time with relatively short kayaking times on the water.

The schedule for Wellingtonians is: on the Thursday 29th Ferry over to Picton, in at 12:30, launch from Picton beach head over to Kumoto, tents up, Friday - paddle around the Bay of Many Coves, stop for coffee / lunch / chips / shower at Punga Cove, stay at Camp Bay. Maybe a quick trip over to Bumine Island with empty boats. Saturday night at Ratimira for camping / snoozing. Sunday - up early, on water at 8am, paddle back to Picton in by 12, lunch, on 1pm sailing. So 4 days with Blumine as an optional paddle, mostly shortish trips. We might shift the plan around depending on the weather, but that sets out the general plan.

For the ferry you need to book your own tickets and I would urge you to get your ferry tickets now as they go fast. If you are concerned about the weather get the fully refundable tickets. When you buy your ticket select the "kayak" option. Any questions ask them in the comments below.

Also check out other Trips & Adventurous Activities in Wellington.

events.id: Summer Camp | BADTAB and Bri Louise-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Summer Camp | BADTAB and Bri Louise
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
San Fran Summer Camp is back for 2026!

Join us and some of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s finest artists over five nights across January and February with tickets from $10 or a season pass for $40, featuring drink specials and cocktails thanks to our sponsor Jameson. 

Come along for our third night of festivities featuring psychedelic sensations BADTAB and the unbeatable Bri Louise.

BADTAB are carving out their own kaleidoscopic corner of the music world. Weaving together synthesisers and swirling guitar strums with rock and jazz inspired drum beats, BADTAB creates a unique and refreshing sound. The band made their mark in 2024 with a prolific run of releases. September saw the drop of The Pōneke Sessions, collaborative EP with Cellz. Then came December’s Echo Chambers Of…, their full-length debut album that introduced the world to BADTAB’s expansive soundscape. Since the release of their debut album, they have been deep in the works on their sophomore album which is anticipated for a 2026 summer release.

Bri Louise blends sultry queer with smooth love and undeniable groove. Their sound has roots in Gospel and Neo-Soul, evolving into a rich fusion of Jazz, Hip-Hop, and R&B. Bri’s music features a talented live band that supports their poetic lyrics with colourful keys, phatty bass, flashy beats, vibrant guitar and fruity woodwinds.


San Fran holds a Supervised License, meaning minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue. Minors are of course not allowed to purchase alcohol under any circumstance.

events.id: Worser Bay Boating Club Centenary Weekend Celebrations!-Worser Bay Boating Club, Karaka Bay Rd, NZ,MERIDIAN ENERGY, 250 Marine Pde, Seatoun, Wellington 6022, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Worser Bay Boating Club Centenary Weekend Celebrations!
events.venue: Worser Bay Boating Club, Karaka Bay Rd, NZ,MERIDIAN ENERGY, 250 Marine Pde, Seatoun, Wellington 6022, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Worser Bay Boating Club Centenary Weekend Celebrations!
https://www.wbbc.org.nz/events/worser-bay-centenary-weekend
Worser Bay Boating Club Centenary Weekend
Celebrating 100 years of sailing at Worser Bay.

Date & Location; 30 Jan 2026, 5:30 pm – 01 Feb 2026, 4:30 pm
WBBC, Karaka Bay Road, Seatoun, Wellington 6022, NZ

About the Event;
Toast 100 years of sailing at Worser Bay at The Worser Way book launch

Friday 30 January 5.30pm to 8.30pm

We kick off the weekend's events with the launch of "The Worser Way" history book. The proof copy has arrived in the country and it is stunning. There are 343 pages, 24 chapters, and 100s of photos tracking the history of sailing in Worser Bay from early Māori settlement through to the current day. If you haven't done so already place your order for a book then get a ticket to the launch where you will be able to pick up your copy.


Centenary club day and BBQ dinner

All day Saturday 31 January with BBQ dinner and drinks from 4.30pm onwards.

Saturday is going to be a big day at the club. The morning will kick off from 9.00am with 'Optisquad' and 'Blue Fleet sessions with our latest crop of new young sailors learning the ropes in the bay. From 11.30am we will have the usual weekend supply of pies and sandwiches available from the kitchen for lunch. Racing gets underway from 1.00pm with two races back to back for for all classes. Then from 4.30pm onwards the bar will be open and a buffet style BBQ dinner will be available for everyone from 6.30pm. Come down for part or all of the day and experience what club life is like after 100 years.


Centenary celebration lunch

Sunday 1 February from 11.30am onwards

“An opportunity to share tales from days when the wind was stronger and the bay worser”

To cap off the weekend, we are hosting a centenary celebration lunch at the club. Bring your partners, your memories, and settle in for an enjoyable buffet lunch. This will be an opportunity to reconnect, reminisce and share tales from years gone by. We’ll have a couple of speakers and we’ll mix up seating between courses so you get a chance to chat with a range of people. Everyone welcome - current members and old salts alike!

https://www.wbbc.org.nz/events/worser-bay-centenary-weekend
Register here!

events.id: Rangatiratanga for Life - Becoming the CEO of Yourself-5 Main Street, Ōtaki 5512, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Rangatiratanga for Life - Becoming the CEO of Yourself
events.venue: 5 Main Street, Ōtaki 5512, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The day is designed to stretch and grow you! In the whakatauākī of Tā Apirana Ngata (Ngāti Porou), E tipu, e rea, he exhorts us to 'grow and flourish'. Grow and flourish! More than survive, get by, do ok. Flourish! This day will explore ways to fully engage with the beautiful moemoeā this whakatauākī speaks to.
E Tipu, E Rea
E tipu e rea mō ngā rā o tō ao
Ko tō ringa ki ngā rākau a te Pākehā
Hei ora mō te tinana
Ko tō ngākau ki ngā taonga a ō tīpuna Māori
Hei tikitiki mō tō māhunga
Ko tō wairua ki tō atua, nāna nei ngā mea katoa
Grow and branch forth for the days destined to you
Your hands to the tools of the Pākehā for the welfare of your body
Your heart to the treasures of your ancestors as adornments for your brow
Your spirit to God, who made all things
— Sir Apirana Ngata

You may like to think about how the day can help you align your professional work-based objectives (often expressed as KPI’s) with your personal vision, mission and goals.
The aims of the Course are to:
1. To host a mana ake wānanga exploring your unique future;
2. To bring together a group of people interested in creating rangatiratanga in their lives;
3. To draw from mātauranga Māori to support participants to create a 12-month personal strategic plan (drawing on moemoeā, pūrakau and pūtake);
4. To facilitate learning using Māori learning and teaching styles;
5. To connect people to the power of lifelong learning; and,
6. To add to the network of dedicated, Treaty based nation builders who have the goal of 'Becoming a CEO' on their radar for themselves or someone they know, whether that be at the personal, whānau, hapῡ, iwi or organisational level.
Our programme is interactive and delivered through a range of teaching / learning techniques which also include: facilitation; small group discussion; critical analysis; reflection; and, reporting back.

events.long_description:
A Very (late) Wellington Sea Shanty Society Xmas
New date! 30 January, 2026. So this will be 'A Very (late) Wellington Sea Shanty Society Xmas'.

NAUTICAL GAMES /// BEST DRESSED PRIZES /// SINGALONG SHANTIES /// XMAS-TYPE STUFF

Your work Xmas-party is going to be lame or cancelled so slap a $2 shop Santa's hat on 2025 and have a sing with Aotearoa's Most Seaworthy Shanty crew.

Prepare to be hit by a wave of joy and merriment as the Full Wellington Sea Shanty Society Experience transform the Abandoned Taproom into a shanty wonderland.

We got shanty booklets for all ye faithful and merch for Xmas presents.

If there's one thing we can all agree on in this country, it's that Xmas needs more sea shanties!

Only Te Upoko o te Ika show for 2025. New EP out in April 2026.

🎅🎅🎅

WELLINGTON SEA SHANTY SOCIETY

Aotearoa New Zealand's Most 'Sea Worthy' Shanty Group™ have been belting out traditional and original sea songs from Aotearoa, France, Spain, the UK and more, since time immemorial (2012).

The W.S.S.S have toured Aotearoa and France multiple times and are known for their rowdy and participatory live shows. They've performed at Paimpol (one of the world's largest shanty festivals), Splore, Albany Folk Festival (Aus), Quebec Sea Shanty Festival (Canada) and a shipload of other festivals in NZ, France & Canada. Their new EP 'Sea Shanties of the 70s, 80s, & Today!' has just recently surfaced to complement their 'Now That's What I Call Sea Shanties' series. Another must-listen is 'Ahoy!' - a French/English album made with Nantes amis Croche Dedans.

events.long_description:
JOURNEY TO SERENITY Yin Yoga and Sound Healing Special Series # 3
Welcome to the Journey to Serenity Yin Yoga and Sound Healing twice monthly session!!!

These beautiful, nourishing Yin and Sound Sessions are on the second and Fourth Friday of each month (between November 28th and March 28th 2026) and are held in the Meeting / Supper Room of the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall on Tutanekai Street.

It would be lovely to share this healing, nourishing restorative practice in the special energy and support you to give your life a boost of wellbeing and good feeling!!

INTRODUCING - SPECIAL WELCOME OFFER - TWO PEOPLE FOR $90 (You don't have to be a couple) - Book through bank transfer or message me directly

Unique Yin Yoga, Sound Healing, breathwork and meditation come together to create this specially guided, deeply relaxing and healing experience, held within a unique holistic framework that encourages reflection and self-care.

Take the time and space that this session offers, for yourself, and give yourself a gift of true nourishment.

Bryony Shanti from Heartsong Healing will use a wide range of special healing sound instruments along with her voice to guide you into peace, relaxation and stillness. The healing vibration of the specially chosen sounds will wash over you bringing deep clearing, balance and alignment. There is a experience of gratitude and blessing.

Bryony's sound works to strengthen and deepen the powerful work of Yin yoga teacher Bianca who will guide you through 90-minutes of restorative and uplifting poses that are intended for you relax, heal and to open more to receive the healing vibration of sound.

Bianca's Yin Yoga focuses on easily accessible and effective poses
which work into the deeper connective tissues of the body. These poses are held for anywhere between 90 seconds to 5 minutes to allow for an opening in the body, the perfect way to receive the sound vibrations.

Yin yoga invites us into stillness and gives space for both the mind and body to relax and release tension and stress.

OPEN TO ALL: Whether you have experience in either Yin Yoga and Sound Healing or are looking to try something completely new, you are very welcome to join in the journey into a sense of serenity. Beginners and experienced practitioners alike will find something nourishing for themselves in this session.

events.venue: Sweet Georgia Cruising,5 Queens Whrf, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
🌊🚤 High Seas Boat Parties - Jan 30th - Wellington Harbour🚤🌊
🌊🚤 High Seas Boat Parties – 2026 Summer 🚤🌊

We’re kicking off the 2026 summer season in style with a sunset cruise across Wellington Harbour.

Join us for two hours of good vibes, open water, and top-tier selectors as we bring the party back to the harbour.

🎧 LINE-UP
Chris Keene
Chris Keene is an Auckland-based DJ & producer with over a decade of experience across pop, rap and electronic music. His career has taken him from local clubs to major stages including Rhythm & Vines, Snowmachine, SXSW and Coachella, with support slots for artists such as Meduza, Marshmello and Denzel Curry. Known for polished, crowd-focused sets that blend groove, energy and musical depth, Chris Keene is a perfect fit for a summer sunset cruise on Wellington Harbour.

With support from The Painter Guys & Odie

📍 LOCATION
Wellington Harbour

🕓 TIME
7:00 PM – 9:00 PM
(2-hour harbour cruise)

📅 DATE
Thursday 30 January

🔥 Expect summer energy, stacked music, iconic harbour views and a proper boat party atmosphere with nibbles provided

⚠️ IMPORTANT EVENT INFORMATION / DISCLAIMER ⚓

• This is a boat cruise event – boarding times are strict. Late arrivals may miss departure and no refunds will be issued.
• Event is weather dependent. In the case of unsafe sailing conditions, the event may be postponed or cancelled at the organiser’s discretion.
• If the event is cancelled due to weather, mechanical issues, or maritime safety requirements, tickets will be transferred to a rescheduled date or refunded (excluding booking fees where applicable).
• The event will proceed rain or shine unless conditions are deemed unsafe by the vessel operator.
• The captain and crew have final authority at all times. Anyone behaving unsafely, aggressively, or intoxicated may be removed without refund.
• Valid photo ID may be required.
• No outside alcohol permitted. Venue rules apply on board.
• By attending, you acknowledge that you are participating at your own risk.

events.id: Anna Fält and Ira Hadžić - Night 1-Pyramid Club,272 Taranaki Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Anna Fält and Ira Hadžić - Night 1
events.venue: Pyramid Club,272 Taranaki Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Anna Fält and Ira Hadžić - Night 1
Ira Hadžić

Ira Hadžić is a Berlin-based sound artist whose musical practice moves at the intersections of improvisation, composition, and introspection. She works with gongs, radiophonic pieces, field recordings, resonances, simple sonic gestures – as well as silence as an expressive form in its own right. Trained as a Deep Listening facilitator at the Center for Deep Listening (Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute), she incorporates these practices into her compositions and sound installations.

https://www.irahadzic.com/
https://ir-a.bandcamp.com/
https://www.instagram.com/irahadzic/


Anna Fält

Vocal music from Sweden and Finland, Ancient and new songs with only one instrument - human voice !

Anna Fält is a versatile voice artist, composer and singing teacher who is passionate about Nordic folk singing. She´s been touring Nordic countries and outside Europe for years with her unique concept of solo vocal concerts. Specialising in singing traditions from her two home countries Finland and Sweden, she combines the bright Scandinavian and dark East-European tones, performing in churches, museums, festivals, clubs and concert halls.

Her concerts are tributes to human voice, a one woman band, singing like you’ve never heard it before. Tradition meets vocal arts, avant-garde and story telling in an innovative and personal, intimate way. People everywhere can relate to the sincerity of the human voice, and storytelling, no matter the language.

https://annafaltenglish.wordpress.com/

Presale tickets available via UTR

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club

events.id: Journey to Serenity: Yin Yoga and Sound Healing-Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, Aorangi St, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
events.name: Journey to Serenity: Yin Yoga and Sound Healing
events.venue: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, Aorangi St, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Welcome to the Journey to Serenity Yin Yoga and Sound Healing monthly session!!!

These beautiful, nourishing Yin and Sound Sessions are monthly on the second Friday of each month and are held temporarily in the Meeting Room of the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall on Tutanekai Street.

It would be lovely to share this healing, nourishing restorative practice in the special energy and support you to give your life a boost of wellbeing and good feeling!!

These events sometimes sell out - so please book early 

Unique Yin Yoga, Sound Healing, breathwork and meditation come together to create this specially guided, deeply relaxing and healing experience, held within a unique holistic framework that encourages reflection and self-care.

Take the time and space that this session offers, for yourself, and give yourself a gift of true nourishment.

Bryony Shanti from Heartsong Healing will use a wide range of special healing sound instruments along with her voice to guide you into peace, relaxation and stillness. The healing vibration of the specially chosen sounds will wash over you bringing deep clearing, balance and alignment. There is a experience of gratitude and blessing.

Bryony's sound works to strengthen and deepen the powerful work of Yin yoga teacher Bianca who will guide you through 90-minutes of restorative and uplifting poses that are intended for you relax, heal and to open more to receive the healing vibration of sound.

Bianca's Yin Yoga focuses on easily accessible and effective poses which work into the deeper connective tissues of the body. These poses are held for anywhere between 90 seconds to 5 minutes to allow for an opening in the body, the perfect way to receive the sound vibrations.

Yin yoga invites us into stillness and gives space for both the mind and body to relax and release tension and stress.

Open to all: Whether you have experience in either Yin Yoga and Sound Healing or are looking to try something completely new, you are very welcome to join in the journey into a sense of serenity. Beginners and experienced practitioners alike will find something nourishing for themselves in this session.

Booking Details
Investment: $55

and please confirm your payment by email to bryony@heartsonghealing.life. Thank you.

Policy:
Depending on booking numbers, if you need to cancel your place you may be able to transfer ticket to the next month once. We reserve the right to refuse transfer or refund if cancelled within 48 hours

events.id: Lunar New Year In The Hutt: Tết Cooking Workshop-27 Hillary Court, Naenae, Lower Hutt 5011,27 Hillary Ct, Naenae, Lower Hutt 5011, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Lunar New Year In The Hutt: Tết Cooking Workshop
events.venue: 27 Hillary Court, Naenae, Lower Hutt 5011,27 Hillary Ct, Naenae, Lower Hutt 5011, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Lunar New Year In The Hutt: Tết Cooking Workshop
Step into the flavours of Vietnamese Lunar New Year with a special hands-on workshop that brings tradition, community, and storytelling together.Join us as part of the Lunar New Year Festival 2026 for a delicious cultural experience!� What We’ll Make Together:� Bánh Tét / Bánh Chưng – iconic sticky rice cakes wrapped in banana leaves, symbolising family reunion and prosperity� Dưa Món (Pickled Vegetables) – crunchy, colourful pickles that balance the richness of New Year dishes� Thịt Kho (Caramelized Braised Pork) – tender pork simmered in coconut water, a dish that brings comfort, warmth and the taste of TếtThis workshop is designed for all ages — beginners, families, food lovers, and anyone curious about Vietnamese culture. Learn the meaning behind each dish and how they come together on every Vietnamese New Year table.� Why Join?• Experience authentic Vietnamese Tết traditions• Learn recipes passed down through generations• Connect with community through shared stories and food• Take home what you cook• Celebrate culture in a warm, hands-on environmentSponsored & partnered with Pomare Taita Community Trust, E Tū Whānau & Hutt City Council.

events.long_description:
New Year, New Venue, January Club Comp 2026 :-)
When: Saturday 31st January 2026

Where: Weights room, Upper Hutt College, Moonshine Road, Trentham, Upper Hutt.

Entries are limited.

Weigh In: 9am.

Competition Start: 10am.

Entries are limited to 10 lifters, once priority spots are filled, all others will be waitlisted.

Priority will be given to Upper Hutt College students and 41° Lifters.

Sign up is via the Weightlifting NZ website calendar, make sure you select 2026 to find the entry link, entries open Nov 24th. https://weightlifting.nz/Calendar

Cost: $20 per lifter. This fee must be paid as you register via the WNZ site. (This change is to simplify the process now being followed by the club as required by WNZ)

Spectators are FREE.

Live Stream is also FREE so don't sign up anywhere else.

Detailed start list will be released closer to the date on the 41° WLC Facebook page

Registrations for this competition close at noon on the Wednesday prior to the comp, if not full before, so please sign up as soon as possible.

Any questions then please send them to Matt or contact Matt on 027-2322-701.

We are back running club comps this year, so get amongst it :-)

events.id: Gallop Into the New Year: Lunar Celebrations in the Hutt-Dowse Square Lower Hutt,Lower Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Gallop Into the New Year: Lunar Celebrations in the Hutt
events.venue: Dowse Square Lower Hutt,Lower Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Gallop Into the New Year: Lunar Celebrations in the Hutt
📍 Dowse Square & Lower Hutt Town Hall
📅 Saturday, 31 January 2026
🕚 11:00 AM – 4:00 PM

Join us for a colourful, family-friendly Lunar New Year Festival in the heart of Lower Hutt!

Hosted by Viet Hub NZ, this outdoor cultural festival celebrates not only Vietnamese Tết but also embraces the wider Lunar New Year traditions of diverse communities across Aotearoa.

Come and experience a day full of music, culture, food, and community connection as we gallop into the Year of the Horse!

⸻

🎭 What to Expect:
• Outdoor Cultural Market: Delicious food stalls, handmade crafts, community booths, and more
• Live Performances: Lion dance, drumming, cultural music and dance throughout the day on the Town Hall stage
• Cultural Games & Activities: Try your hand at Vietnamese folk games, calligraphy, lantern making, and storytelling
• Exhibition Space: Discover real stories of migration and belonging through our Immigrant Storytelling installation
• Traditional Costume Photography: Indoor photo area with Vietnamese and Lunar New Year-inspired costumes
• Children’s Zone: Face painting, interactive games, and family workshops
• Lucky Draw & Spot Prizes!

⸻

🎟️ Tickets:
• Free General Admission – Registration encouraged for updates & giveaways
• Optional Donation – Support our community initiatives and annual cultural programmes

Every ticket holder goes into the draw for a lucky Lunar prize!

⸻

💛 Why Attend?

This is Lower Hutt’s largest and most inclusive Lunar New Year celebration – welcoming all ages, all cultures, and all walks of life. Whether you’re reconnecting with your roots or exploring new traditions, there’s something here for everyone.

⸻

📢 Stay Connected:

Follow us on Facebook￼ or visit www.viethubnz.org￼
📧 Contact us:

⸻

This event is proudly supported by local businesses, volunteers, and the wider Hutt community. Proceeds support Viet Hub NZ’s year-round cultural, educational, and community programmes.

events.id: Set your focus for 2026-Nga Manu Reserve Rd, Waikanae 5391,Waikanae, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Set your focus for 2026
events.venue: Nga Manu Reserve Rd, Waikanae 5391,Waikanae, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Set your focus for 2026
I am really excited to offer this workshop and in such an amazing space. Let's do it. Let's create a 2026 that is amazing.

Each new year we are encouraged to think about new year’s resolutions. As we know these often don’t play out, we are unable to follow through or we lose momentum or we just make them unachievable.

The purpose of this workshop is to explore what you might want to create, change, or stabilise during 2026 through the exploration and the identification of a word that brings the energy you want for the year.

I have been working with this concept of a word for a number of years now and always when I reflect at the closing of the year, I can identify how this has played out during the year. It works! Reset was my word for 2025!!!

On the day we will have a gentle yoga practice (all levels), meditation and journalling prompted by a framework (you’ll find out on the day) that encourages us to open up to the possibilities of 2026 and to set a clear intention of what we want from the year and how one word can energise that intention.

I will provide some materials for you to create a vision board if that is your intention to do so. I will also provide material (or a framework in corporate speak) to support you in your reflections on what it is that you want in 2026.

Investment is $60. If you want to explore Nga Manu as well, I would definitely encourage that, we can provide you with a discounted access ticket of $15.

events.id: Anna Fält - Workshop: Nordic Folk Songs-Pyramid Club,272 Taranaki Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Anna Fält - Workshop: Nordic Folk Songs
events.venue: Pyramid Club,272 Taranaki Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Anna Fält - Workshop: Nordic Folk Songs
Anna Fält (Finland/Sweden) has a degree in pop/jazz singing (2006), folk music education (2011) and a master in Nordic folk music (2017). She's been studying in renowned universities such as The Royal Music Academy in Stockholm and Sibelius Academy in Helsinki.

Anna´s been teaching private lessons since 2008 both in person and online. After graduating as a folk singing teacher 2011, her educational work consists mostly of workshops and courses introducing Finnish singing traditions for non-Finnish people. All material is taught by ear and consists of simple melodies with lots of possibilities for variation - everyone can join, no matter the background! The emphasis is always in Enjoying singing & sounding together.

Anna's specialities are singing traditions from Finland and Sweden, combining the bright Scandinavian and dark East-European tones. She is passionate about the human voice and is known for her innovative ways to use voice as an versatile instrument. She's been teaching workshops at various universities and music schools around the world.

Koha Entry

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

events.id: Coven: Butch-Sweet Axe Throwing Co. (Sweet Axe Throwing Co. Wellington),60 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Coven: Butch
events.venue: Sweet Axe Throwing Co. (Sweet Axe Throwing Co. Wellington),60 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Coven: Butch
For butches and butch lovers! This night sets to make two things clear:

1. We love butches!
2. Get enough sapphics and queers in a room and anything can become a competition

Join us for axe throwing, games, kai, and as always at our events impeccable vibes. Spot prizes for the best butches, drink on arrival, and a room full of hot babes? Need we say more, so get your fits checked and grab your ticket before they go. This event has limited capacity.

Not a butch? No problem, all butch and butch appreciating Coven members of all flavours welcome.

No dress code! Come as you are, celebrate butch fashion or your queer identity and expect a fun chill night with your community.

More info about Coven:

Coming Solo? You’re Not Alone.
Don’t be nervous if you’re planning to come on your own – Coven is built for connection. Whether it’s your first queer event or your hundredth, you’ll be surrounded by a community that gets it. From the moment you arrive, there’ll be friendly faces, welcoming vibes, and plenty of chances to mingle, and connect. Coven is about belonging – and there’s a place here for you.

Coven Kaupapa
For queer women and gender minorities, spaces like this are rare, vital, and sometimes, life-changing. In a world that constantly centers cishet norms, Coven offers a space where we are the default – where you can fully show up as yourself, be seen, celebrated and surrounded by YOUR community.

For many in our Coven, this is one of the only opportunities we feel comfortable enough to experience nightlife free from the male gaze, tokenism, fear, or the need to shrink ourselves to fit in. It’s a space where sapphic, trans, nonbinary, and gender-diverse people aren’t just welcomed – we are centered. It’s for those who are often pushed to the margins, who rarely feel represented in “inclusive” spaces that still cater to the mainstream.

This night exists because we need it – and because we create it, together.

Accessibility
This event is located on the ground floor. Have specific accessibility needs? Reach out directly to the Whisky & Wood team at

If you made it this far... Good girl / Good they / Good boy / Good YOU!

Come as you are, celebrate butch fashion or your queer identity and expect a fun chill night with your community.
Whether it’s your first queer event or your hundredth, you’ll be surrounded by a community that gets it.
For many in our Coven, this is one of the only opportunities we feel comfortable enough to experience nightlife free from the male gaze, tokenism, fear, or the need to shrink ourselves to fit in.
Accessibility This event is located on the ground floor.
