events.name: Breakfast with the Mayor
events.venue: BNZ Partners Centre Wellington,1 Whitmore Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Breakfast with the Mayor
Breakfast with the Mayor Hon. Andrew Little

About this Event

Wellington is gearing up for a milestone year.

With new leadership in place and major projects like Te Ngākau Civic Square, the Wellington Town Hall, and Te Matapihi Central Library reopening soon, the Capital is entering a period of renewal and momentum, with Mayor Hon Andrew Little at the helm.

To kick off the new year, join the Wellington Chamber of Commerce and host BNZ for an exclusive Mayor’s breakfast to hear directly from the Mayor about his priorities, and the opportunities ahead for the capital.

2026 marks a pivotal reset for Wellington’s economic outlook. This breakfast provides a rare opportunity for leaders, policy makers, and Wellingtonians alike to gain insight on the factors shaping our city’s future.

Agenda:
7:15am- Standing breakfast, networking
7:45am- Address
8:10am- Q&A
8:30am- Event concludes

events.id: Cultivating a Positive Workplace Culture for High-Performance Teams-Wellington Chamber Of Commerce,NTT Tower Level 13, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Cultivating a Positive Workplace Culture for High-Performance Teams
events.venue: Wellington Chamber Of Commerce,NTT Tower Level 13, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Cultivating a Positive Workplace Culture for High-Performance Teams
Learn to build a positive, high-performing workplace culture through trust, inclusivity, and collaboration.

About this Event

This course is designed for leaders, managers, and organisational change agents who want to foster a positive workplace culture that drives high performance, collaboration, and employee wellbeing. Participants will explore the essential principles of creating an environment that nurtures trust, accountability, inclusivity, and engagement. Through practical strategies, case studies, and interactive discussions, participants will learn how to develop a culture that motivates teams to excel, encourages open communication, and supports professional growth.


Key Topics Include:
• Building a culture of trust and psychological safety
• Fostering open communication and feedback loops
• Aligning values and purpose with organisational goals
• Promoting inclusivity, diversity, and belonging
• Recognising and celebrating achievements
• Encouraging work-life balance and wellbeing
• Developing strategies for conflict resolution and collaboration

By the end of the course, participants will have the tools and insights needed to create a workplace environment that not only supports but accelerates the success of high-performing teams, driving both individual and collective achievement.


Key audience:
This course is designed for leaders, managers, and anyone responsible for shaping the culture within their teams and organisations.


Learning outcomes:
Implement strategies to cultivate trust, psychological safety, and high performance within their teams.
Lead teams that foster open communication, collaboration, and inclusivity.
Align team goals with organisational values and objectives, ensuring a shared sense of purpose.
Develop effective strategies for conflict resolution and team cohesion.
Create a workplace culture that encourages growth, well-being, and work-life balance.

If you would like to register with Business Central directly and receive an invoice for payment, please contact our training team via .


Course details:
Duration: Full day, in person.
Time: 9am – 4pm


Course includes
Workbook, arrival tea or coffee, morning tea, lunch, afternoon tea.
To view our Terms and Conditions click here.

events.name: NZ Tech Rally Feb 2026 meetup
events.venue: 7 Dixon Street, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join our community at our first 2026 event - Feb 2026 in-person meetup in Wellington CBD. Many thanks to our 2026 Platinum sponsor Creative HQ for hosting us.
Date: Thursday, 12 Feb 2026
Venue: Creative HQ, 7 Dixon Street, Wellington, NZ
Time: 4.30 pm - 7.00 pm
Programme
4:30 pm – 5:00 pm
Arrival & networking
5:00 pm – 6:00 pm
Welcome notes – Stuart Whitehead
Talk 1 – Chloe Gunn
Talk 2 – Mrinal Mukherjee
Speaker Q&A and closing notes – Stuart Whitehead
6:00 pm – 7:00 pm
Community mingling & networking
Talks & Speakers
Unlocking Your Brain’s Edge with AI - Chloe Gunn, CX Designer @ Kiwibank
Chloe Gunn explores how AI can amplify your thinking, help you learn faster and make complex ideas easier to handle. She shares practical, neuroscience-backed tools to reduce cognitive load, cut rumination and face tough conversations. A fast, energising talk for anyone using AI day to day.
Engineering management: Not quite what they told you - Mrinal Mukherjee, Engineering Leader @ Bank of New Zealand
Step beyond myths about engineering management. Mrinal's talk shares the messy realities of leading teams, balancing delivery, people, and chaos. Packed with stories, humour, and practical lessons, it helps new managers prepare, gives experienced leaders reassurance, and offers all attendees tips to navigate the tricky parts of leadership.
Event entry
This is a free event for our tech community. Everyone is welcome. Please RSVP to grab your free ticket, as we have limited numbers.
Please make sure you have your QR code in your ticket email handy as we will digitally check-in on arrival at the venue.
If you can't attend, then please email us at info@nztechrally.nz to cancel your ticket, so folks on the waitlist can attend.
For any enquiries, please email info@nztechrally.nz.

events.id: Summer Camp Closing Party! | Dillon Jo, Miles Calder & Keira Batten Coogan-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Summer Camp Closing Party! | Dillon Jo, Miles Calder & Keira Batten Coogan
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
San Fran Summer Camp is back for 2026!

Join us and some of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s finest artists over five nights across January and February with tickets from $10 or a season pass for $40, featuring drink specials and cocktails thanks to our sponsor Jameson.

Here it is… our final night! Featuring not one, not two, but THREE of Pōneke’s premier acts to close our 2026 series out.

Dillon Jo is the genre defying project of Wellington Based artists Betty Smith and Georgie Levien. Dillon Jo built paths between the elements of dream pop, shoegaze, folk, alt rock, and indie pop to create their genre defying sound. Having recently recruited Kahu Sanson-Burnett and Ruadh Munro, Dillon Jo has transformed their live sets into an unbridled big-sound shoegaze experience.
Miles Calder released his solo debut album Autopilot Life in 2021, a self-reflective delve into waking up from an unexamined life, dressed in a psychedelic folk-rock palette that evoked late-era Beatles as much as contemporaries like Kevin Morby and Father John Misty. The album won over new fans and critics alike & led to a nomination for a prestigious Aotearoa Music Award (Te Kaipuoro Taketake Toa | Best Folk Artist 2022). 

Keira Batten Coogan writes raw and messy music for alien listeners. Joined onstage by some familiar Pōneke talent, his earnest earworms pack more punch than ever. Themes of queerness, growing pains, love, and nostalgia shine through his lyricism and captivates audiences. 


San Fran holds a Supervised License, meaning minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue. Minors are of course not allowed to purchase alcohol under any circumstance.

events.name: Wellington Gypsy Fair
events.venue: Frank Kitts Park,68 Jervois Quay, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wellington Gypsy Fair
The Gypsy Fair is a nationwide travelling event, bringing family fun, live music and an unbeatable vibe to each town we visit.🌞💜

Having been on the road for over 45 years, it’s safe to say our roots run deep. Our people are incredible, and house trucks/buses are pretty cool too! So don’t forget to check out our unique way of living while you’re here 🫶🌿🌻💜

Whether you’re just having a browse, letting the kids loose on our rides, parking up with some food or coffee, or checking out some funky handmade crafts, we would love to see you! Come and hang out for the day, we’re sure to bring smiles to your faces, and create lifelong memories💜

🌞Free entry for everyone🌞 We pride ourselves on being an affordable event for every family. With free entertainment all day, plenty of chill out zones, and loads of life size games laying around, we truely love to see the community getting amongst it all! Can’t wait to see you there🌞👣🐝🌿🌊

Follow us on Facebook – ‘Gypsy Fair’ for updates on our travels and creations! We’re always open to anyone who wants to come and live the dream, so please email us if this sounds like a bit of you. –

events.id: Community Snorkel: Taputeranga Marine Reserve-Island Bay Beach, Taputeranga Marine Reserve,300 The Esplanade, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Community Snorkel: Taputeranga Marine Reserve
events.venue: Island Bay Beach, Taputeranga Marine Reserve,300 The Esplanade, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Community Snorkel: Taputeranga Marine Reserve
Dive into Taputeranga Marine Reserve and take part in a free snorkelling event this summer!

Beginners welcome! We provide all the necessary gear and experienced guides to ensure your safety and enjoyment in the water. Participants just need to be at least eight years old and confident swimmers. Those under sixteen must be accompanied by an adult.

Registrations open at 9.45am. Come down to book a snorkel time for the day, as spots may fill up quickly. Bring your togs, towel, refreshments and make a day of it exploring the activities and environment at Taputeranga Marine Reserve.

This free event is brought to you in partnership with Greater Wellington Regional Council.

Cancellations/Postponements

Events are weather dependent. Stay updated by checking the Mountains to Sea Wellington Facebook event listings for any cancellations, postponements, or location changes.

To get to Taputeranga Marine Reserve

We encourage attendees to leave cars at home and use alternative transport where possible. Locals- please come on foot or bring along your bikes/scooters! For those further afield, the number 1 bus drops you right to the event from the Wellington Train Station.

Accessibility

Island Bay Beach is accessible by beach wheelchair. The nearest accessible toilets are in Shorland Park. There are two accessible parks in front of the Island Bay Surf Club, additional vehicles can be accommodated if required, near to our MTSW trailers. Please see a staff member on arrival if the Surf Club parks are full. We have a variety of options to enable a more comfortable experience in the water, including flotation aids and 1:1 support from our trained guides. Please get in touch with us at in advance of the event to discuss your accessibility requirements, including to enquire about beach wheelchair assistance. We love helping people to experience our marine environment!

The snorkelling in this event is run under the Health and Safety of the Mountains to Sea Conservation Trust programme Experiencing Marine Reserves. Adventure Activity Certified - AA0534.

‍
Photos: Kristine Zipfel

events.id: Enchanted Park-Wainuiomata Recreation Area,10 Whitcher Grove, Lower Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Enchanted Park
events.venue: Wainuiomata Recreation Area,10 Whitcher Grove, Lower Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Enchanted Park
Free fairy fun in the forest!

Bring the whānau for an enchanting afternoon in the Gums Loop Meadow at Wainuiomata Regional Park. This special summer event invites tamariki to explore nature, get creative, and learn about the native wildlife that calls this forest home.

Help us build a fairy garden in the forest where North Island brown kiwi live. Kids can paint rocks or create their own fairy doors. There will be facepainting and outdoor games. You're encouraged to bring fairy costumes and picnic lunches to enjoy in the meadow.

Our knowledgeable park ranger will be there (with fairy wings on) to answer questions and share stories about the park’s natural heritage.

The Remutaka Conservation Trust and Forest & Bird be on hand to teach tamariki about the kiwi who live in this park and the conservation work happening in the area.

Event Details:

Aimed at: Children aged 4–10

Accessibility: Tracks suitable for prams

Dogs: Allowed on a lead

What to bring: Picnic, costumes, and creativity!


Get the whānau involved in Summer Events

Discover the magic of our regional parks. For 25 years, Greater Wellington has been hosting recreational events that help people connect with nature, get active outdoors, and enjoy time together.

Wainuiomata Regional Park is a special place for conservation. Greater Wellington’s work here protects freshwater sources, preserves ancient native forests, looks after historic sites, and helps build resilience to climate change. Our partners and volunteers, like the Remutaka Conservation Trust, play a vital role in making this park a special place for everyone.

events.id: The Very Best of Deacon Blue-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: The Very Best of Deacon Blue
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Scottish pop-rock icons Deacon Blue are heading to The Opera House in 2026. The visit coincides with the band’s 40 anniversary and the release of its eleventh studio album, ‘The Great Western Road’. New Zealand fans can expect a curated setlist blending arena-sized classic anthems and intimate surprises.
Deacon Blue is known for emotionally-charged performances and enduring hits like Dignity, Real Gone Kid, I’ll Never Fall In Love Again, and Fergus Sings the Blues. Audiences are sure to have a dynamic live experience in a concert spanning the band’s full career. Songs will range from the soulful grit of acclaimed debut album ‘Raintown’ to newer releases. ‘The Great Western Road’ reflects the band’s journey across four decades of music making with honesty, warmth, and a renewed sense of adventure.
With a reputation for crafting unforgettable live moments,
Deacon Blue’s 2026 tour will be 40 years strong, and more poignant and potent than ever.

events.id: As You Like It!-Aro Park,Aro St, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: As You Like It!
events.venue: Aro Park,Aro St, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
As You Like It!
‘’All the world’s a stage, and all the men and women merely players’’

The forest is calling! This summer, a new company of players, The Midsummer Botanicals, invite audiences to step beneath the trees and into the wild, wondrous world of As You Like It - a sun-soaked celebration of laughter and community blooming in one of Wellington’s gorgeous parks for the first week of the Wellington Fringe Festival.

In 1983, A Midsummer Night’s Dream lit up the Victoria University Quad and sparked a beloved tradition of outdoor Shakespeare in Wellington - a festival of artistry, friendship, and open-air delight that ran for over forty years. After its sudden end in 2023, a vital chapter of our city’s cultural story seemed to close. But this February, the Botanicals are bringing it gloriously back to life.

Set in a vibrant reimagining of Shakespeare’s Forest of Arden, this production draws on courtyard and marketplace traditions of performance, transforming Wellington’s Aro Valley gem into a living, breathing garden of music, colour, and character. Audiences are invited to arrive early, explore the space, and meet the motley cast of lovers and fools before the story even begins. Expect song, sun, silliness, and the scent of summer roses.

events.id: HED P.E. | San Fran, Wellington | with NONPOINT | Still 'Broke' New Zealand Tour 2026-San Fran,Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: HED P.E. | San Fran, Wellington | with NONPOINT | Still 'Broke' New Zealand Tour 2026
events.venue: San Fran,Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
HED P.E. | San Fran, Wellington | with NONPOINT | Still 'Broke' New Zealand Tour 2026
HED P.E.
Still ‘Broke’ Australian Tour 2026
with NONPOINT

📆 Live at San Fran, Wellington on Saturday 14 February

— 𝐎𝐧 𝐒𝐚𝐥𝐞 𝐍𝐨𝐰 —
➥ bit.ly/hednon26well
__________________________________________

(HED) P.E. return to shake New Zealand to its very foundations and they are bringing NONPOINT with them

Celebrating the 25th anniversary of their landmark album Broke, the band will deliver a full-throttle set packed with fan favourites like Bartender, Killing Time, and Feel Good; which featured none other than Serj Tankian (System of a Down) and Morgan Lander (Kittie) on the album.

Critics hailed Broke as a “magnum opus of rap, funk, hip hop, and metal” (UnEarthed), while Sputnikmusic praised its “excellent” RATM meets hip-hop genre fusion and raw emotional punch. Whilst RateYourMusic users described the album as “hedonistic, energetic, vulgar, rhythmic, urban, and heavy,” capturing the raw essence of its sound and attitude. With over 450,000 copies sold worldwide, Broke remains a defining moment in the nu-metal era and this tour is your chance to relive it live.

Expect pounding riffs, funk-infused grooves, and the unmistakable flow of frontman Jahred Gomes, whose stage presence turns every show into a riotous celebration of rebellion and rhythm. From their self-titled debut in 1997 to their latest release New and Improved, (HED) P.E. continues to evolve while staying true to their anti-establishment roots.

Debuting in New Zealand for the first time and with an incredible career spanning nearly three decades, Nonpoint has long been a force to be reckoned with in the nu-metal/rap-rock genre. Known for legendary live performances and explosive tracks such as Bullet with a Name, What a Day, Ruthless, and more, the band has consistently captivated audiences with infectious riffs, compelling lyrics, and an uncompromising raw energy. Their discography and stagecraft have made them staples at rock radio and fixtures on festival lineups, earning them a dedicated international following.

This is not nostalgia, it’s a full-blown sonic nu-metal assault. Don’t miss (HED) P.E. and NONPOINT as they rip through Australia with setlists that traverse decades, defy genres, and unleash pure, unfiltered chaos!

Critics hailed Broke as a “magnum opus of rap, funk, hip hop, and metal” (UnEarthed), while Sputnikmusic praised its “excellent” RATM meets hip-hop genre fusion and raw emotional punch.

events.name: Basejump Comedy & LFC | Improv Essentials: Unified Chaos!
events.venue: Toi Pōneke Arts Centre,69 Abel Smith Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Basejump Comedy & LFC | Improv Essentials: Unified Chaos!
Learn improv in a ridiculous group course

About this Event

Welcome to the most structured mess you'll ever love. In this 8-week, beginner-friendly course, we'll dive into the essential building blocks of improv—then flip them, twist them, and turn them into glorious chaos.
You'll learn how to play as a group, build ideas together, and spark wild scenes from the tiniest suggestions. It's all about teamwork, bold choices, and finding the funny in the unexpected.
Expect maximum stage time, supportive vibes, and a whole lot of laughter. Whether you're trying something new, eyeing the world of character work, sketch comedy, or something totally experimental, this course is your gateway.
Unleash your weird. Support your team. Start the riot.


Details
Start Date: 14th February
Teacher: Ralph Hilaga
Where: Toi Poneke Arts Center
Classes run for 8 sessions, Saturdays 12 - 3 pm
Inquiries:
Class Show: TBD


Policy
Registration is Non-Refundable & Non-Transferable.
Your enrollment HOLDS A SPACE in a class that we are no longer able to offer someone else. Please review dates and be sure about your schedule before registering.




DATES
February
Sat 14th
Sat 21st
Sat 28th
March
Sat 7th
Sat 14th
Sat 21st
Sat 28th
April
Sat 11th
Class Show
TBD



Ralph is an improviser, stand up, and sketch comedian based in Wellington. Formerly a dramatic actor, he transitioned into comedy in 2019 and has since trained at The iO Theater in Chicago, The Improv Conspiracy in Melbourne, and Basejump Comedy in Wellington. He was a Wellington finalist at the Raw Comedy Quest 2025 competition, and is a founding member of the comedy group Catfish Trifecta (Nominee for Best Regular Show and Best innovation at the Wellies 2025), and is one half of the chaotic comedy duo “Mo and Ralph” with Mo Munn.

events.id: HED PE | Still ‘Broke’ New Zealand Tour | with Nonpoint-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: HED PE | Still ‘Broke’ New Zealand Tour | with Nonpoint
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
Celebrating the 25th anniversary of their landmark album Broke, the band will deliver a full-throttle set packed with fan favourites like Bartender, Killing Time, and Feel Good;  which featured none other than Serj Tankian (System of a Down) and Morgan Lander (Kittie) on the album.
Critics hailed Broke as a “magnum opus of rap, funk, hip hop, and metal” (UnEarthed), while Sputnikmusic praised its “excellent”RATM meets hip-hop genre fusion and raw emotional punch. Whilst RateYourMusic users described the album as “hedonistic, energetic, vulgar, rhythmic, urban, and heavy,” capturing the raw essence of its sound and attitude. With over 450,000 copies sold worldwide, Broke remains a defining moment in the nu-metal era and this tour is your chance to relive it live.
Expect pounding riffs, funk-infused grooves, and the unmistakable flow of frontman Jahred Gomes, whose stage presence turns every show into a riotous celebration of rebellion and rhythm. From their self-titled debut in 1997 to their latest release New and Improved, (HED) P.E. continues to evolve while staying true to their anti-establishment roots.
With an incredible career spanning nearly three decades, Nonpoint has long been a force to be reckoned with in the nu-metal/rap-rock genre. Known for legendary live performances and explosive tracks such as Bullet with a Name, What a Day, Ruthless, and more, the band has consistently captivated audiences with infectious riffs, compelling lyrics, and an uncompromising raw energy. Their discography and stagecraft have made them staples at rock radio and fixtures on festival lineups, earning them a dedicated international following.
This is not nostalgia, it’s a full-blown sonic nu-metal assault. Don’t miss (HED) P.E. and NONPOINT as they rip through New Zealand with setlists that traverse decades, defy genres, and unleash pure, unfiltered chaos!

events.long_description:
Beehive to Business with Hon. Louise Upston
Beehive to Business Event: Unlocking the Potential of New Zealand’s Workforce with Hon. Minister Upston

About this Event

As New Zealand’s workforce evolves—shaped by technology, automation, and changing skills needs—it’s more important than ever to fully utilise the talent available to us.

Join us for a special Beehive to Business event with Hon. Louise Upston, Minister for the Community and Voluntary Sector, Minister for Disability Issues, Minister for Social Development and Employment, Minister for Tourism and Hospitality, Minister for Child Poverty Reduction, and Deputy Leader of the House, who will discuss how businesses can better support disabled and neurodiverse New Zealanders, and why this is critical to unlocking the full potential of the workforce.

This event is a unique opportunity for business leaders and policymakers to explore how inclusive employment can strengthen organisations and build a more capable, diverse workforce—and it’s not one to be missed.

Agenda:
7:15am- Standing breakfast, networking
7:45am- Address
8:10am- Q&A
8:30am- Event concludes

Part of the ongoing Beehive to Business series, this event is proudly made possible through our partnership with Wellington-based consulting firm Allen + Clarke.

events.id: STEAMS School BLENHEIM Term 1 2026-Mayfield, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: STEAMS School BLENHEIM Term 1 2026
events.venue: Mayfield, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand
events.long_description:
STEAMS is an integrated approach to learning topics of Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, Maths, and Society that fosters critical thinking, problem solving, communication and collaboration. Its aim is to teach real world skills through engaging methods whilst allowing individuals to be creative. This involves immersing tamariki into projects and activities that develop innovation and champion curiosity. STEAMS is not ‘play based learning’ but focused learning through an integrated hands-on approach allowing children to take risks and explore their own curiosity in a subject without time barriers.
At the Ministry of Inspiration we offer STEAMS learning each term for Year 1-8 students. Once a week students will attend a class at Waterlea Racecourse, Blenheim on TUESDAY or THURSDAY. STEAMS Jr (ages 7-9) start at 9am and finish at 2:45pm on TUESDAY. Little STEAMerS operates from 9-12 on THURSDAY. STEAMS Sr (ages 10-13) operates on THURSDAY from 9am to 245 pm. 
Inquiry, collaboration, and an emphasis on process-based learning are at the heart of the STEAM approach. Each term the classes will have a focus which drives the learning and our amazing teachers create opportunities to help each student develop their understanding, improve their skills and gain knowledge in a range of topics.
Students who participate in STEAM learning:
· think outside the box
· feel safe to express innovative and creative ideas
· feel comfortable doing hands-on learning
· take ownership over their learning
· work collaboratively with others
· understand the ways that science, maths, the arts, and technology work together
· become increasingly curious about the world around them and feel empowered to change it for the better.
When does it meet, and where?
The school is held during school terms.
STEAMS Jr (ages 7-9) TUESDAY, 9-245.
STEAMS Sr (ages 10-13) THURSDAY, 9-245
Little STEAMerS (ages 5-6) THURSDAY 12-3.
Location:  Waterlea Racecourse, enter off of Linton St.
How much does it cost?
The students come for a paid three-week trial-as a new student you pay for that through Humanitix.
If both family and teacher feel there is a good fit for the child in the class, they continue for the rest of the term. You are then invoiced for the full term less the amount paid for the Trial.
Payment is by term, with a cost of $73 incl. GST We have a limited number of scholarships available that are awarded on a term by term basis for those with financial need for 25% off. 
Little STEAMerS is $30 incl. GST.
Will my child’s school mind that they miss a day per week?
You will need to inform the child’s school that he or she will be at STEAMS School one day per week. To date we have not encountered any issues around accommodating a child’s participation in STEAMS School, and many of the region’s schools are very supportive of the programme. Once enrolled, you are encouraged to inform the teacher and office staff that your child should be marked present for the day they attend STEAMS School, as they will be attending an academic school as opposed to being absent due to illness or other reasons.
events.description:
STEAMS is not ‘play based learning’ but focused learning through an integrated hands-on approach allowing children to take risks and explore their own curiosity in a subject without time barriers.
At the Ministry of Inspiration we offer STEAMS learning each term for Year 1-8 students.
Once a week students will attend a class at Waterlea Racecourse, Blenheim on TUESDAY or THURSDAY.
If both family and teacher feel there is a good fit for the child in the class, they continue for the rest of the term.
GST We have a limited number of scholarships available that are awarded on a term by term basis for those with financial need for 25% off.

events.name: The Darkness tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Presented by: SBM
Multi-platinum UK rock royalty The Darkness are set to make their triumphant return to New Zealand in February 2026 with summer shows in Auckland and Wellington.
Following their massive 2024 Permission To Land 20th anniversary tour, the band are bringing their signature high-voltage energy and outrageous fun back to stages, serving up fan favourites like I Believe In A Thing Called Love and Love Is Only A Feeling, alongside new tracks from their latest album Dreams On Toast, including I Hate Myself and The Longest Kiss. This tour marks the first chance for fans to hear the new songs live.
Exploding onto the scene in 2003 with their now-classic debut Permission To Land, The Darkness quickly became one of the UK’s most beloved rock bands, racking up over 1.5 million album sales, a headline set at Reading & Leeds in 2004, and a string of major awards including BRITs, Kerrang!, and an Ivor Novell.
The band’s cheeky, spandex-clad anthems changed the face of British rock and continue to capture hearts and a new generation of fans around the world. Their live shows are pure spectacle: soaring falsettos, outrageous outfits, endless guitar solos, and crowds belting out every word. Don’t miss your chance to experience it all live in 2026 - it’s bold, loud, and gloriously over-the-top fun.
Joining The Darkness on their Australia & New Zealand tour is emerging Australian artist RAGEFLOWER – a magnetic force of cinematic alt-rock whose sound blurs the boundaries of emotion, experimentation and raw power. Her music balances fragility and strength in equal measure. Her live performances are powerful and deeply felt – part confessional, part spectacle – earning her a rapidly growing international audience across the U.S., Japan and Europe, and positioning her as one of Australia’s most compelling new voices.

events.id: CBT skills for physical health practitioners in Aotearoa New Zealand-48 Mein Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: CBT skills for physical health practitioners in Aotearoa New Zealand
events.venue: 48 Mein Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Cognitive Behaviour Therapy (CBT) is a psychological intervention initially developed for emotional disorders. It is now widely used in supporting people to deal with the challenges of physical ill-health. Professionals from various backgrounds can learn to use a simplified CBT skills set, and use of these skills enables them to be more effective in managing aspects of their patients’ distress.
The training is a mix of theory, skills demonstration and skills practice, giving participants a better understanding of the applicability of the skill set in their area of practice and providing some skills to take away. Training sessions are spaced to allow participants to use their new skills in their clinical practice. Each participant reflects on their learning and their work with a specific patient, and the whole group reflects on lessons learned. In this way, learning remains rooted in participants’ clinical practice. These CBT courses are consistently evaluated highly by participants.
The Course
Teaching will be commenced with 2 days of in person sessions. 19th and 20th Feb 2026 at Mary Potter Hospice, Wellington and subsequently 2 sessions on-line via Zoom. These will be either 18th or 19th March an 22nd or 23rd April 2026.
Attendance at all sessions is mandatory to complete the course.
The courses cost is $850 per person (incl GST).
The Trainers
Kathy Burn was a Clinical Nurse Specialist in Palliative Care who went on to train in CBT and to develop the CBT service at St Christopher’s Hospice, London. She now works in CBT in chronic pain, and she teaches and supervises CBT trainees at the institute of Psychiatry, London.
Kathryn Mannix was a Palliative Medicine Consultant and CBT therapist. She developed ‘CBT First Aid’ to enable palliative care clinicians to adapt skills from CBT into their clinical practice. She is an author. There are insights into her use of CBT in her books With the End in Mind and Listen.
Terms and Conditions
Attendance: In order to create a learning community for each course, it is important that each person on a course attends every session and is able to join in the discussions by keeping up with the course. By accepting a place on a particular course, you agree to attend all the sessions, to arrive on time, and to work alongside your group members during the session to support each other's learning. Each session builds on the last, and you'll be asked to put your new learning into practice in- between sessions. Building learning groups in this way means we can't add new trainees after a course has begun.
We are not able to run catch-up sessions for sessions missed. If you miss sessions, you may be asked to withdraw from the course and no refunds will be given.
Refunds/Canellations: Once you sign up and pay, we won't be able to refund your payment unless we can reallocate your place to another person before the course begins. The deadline for cancelling your place is 28 days before the day and time of the first session. If you cancel and we can fill your place with another person, we'll offer you the choice of a refund or a place on a future course, if places are available. We will do our best to fill your place, but we can't promise this. Refunds will incur an administration fee.
Dates and Times of Sessions: all dates and times are given in NZ time, and this varies over the year. It is up to you to check the correct time in your time zone: you may find this website useful to check your own time zone with Auckland NZ time on each specific date: https://www.worldtimebuddy.com/
Trainers: we have a team of trainers, all of whom are experienced CBT therapists and trainers, and all are familiar with applying CBT in physical health settings. Different sessions may be taught by different trainers, or by 'guest appearances' by some of our team. The team of trainers will ensure there is continuity of content and of learning as the course progresses.
Special circumstances: Sometimes, life events appear unexpectedly. If something unexpected prevents you from attending, please let us know as early as you can, and we will give consideration to how we might be able to support you to continue your training if that is what you wish to do.

He's here to kick ass and take kidneys. And he's all out of ass. And kidneys.

From the Tim Burton of Taranaki, The Most Haunted Comedian in New Zealand brings you a stand-up comedy show for anyone who's ever thought about donating a kidney, anyone who hasn't thought about donating a kidney, and anyone who might know a guy who knows a guy who does a sneaky cashie.

events.id: [OFFSITE] Jim White (Aus) & Marisa Anderson (US) with Motte + UMU-Meow,17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: [OFFSITE] Jim White (Aus) & Marisa Anderson (US) with Motte + UMU
events.venue: Meow,17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
[OFFSITE] Jim White (Aus) & Marisa Anderson (US) with Motte + UMU
Offsite at Meow, 9 Edward Street, Wellington

Jim White & Marisa Anderson
The collaboration between renowned drummer Jim White (Dirty Three, PJ Harvey, Bonnie Prince Billy, Cat Power) and acclaimed US guitarist Marisa Anderson is a natural union of two of the most intuitive players and listeners working in music. White and Anderson are both in high demand as collaborators, in no small part because of their mastery, versatility and highly expressive playing. The duo have amassed an impressive body of work together (including their 2020 debut The Quickening and 2024’s Swallowtail), and each remain at the vanguard of their practices due to an insatiable curiosity and delight in exploration of new avenues of expression.

---

Marisa Anderson channels the history of the guitar and stretches the boundaries of tradition. Her playing is fluid, emotional, and masterful, featuring compositions and improvisations that re-imagine the landscape of American music. Her work applies elements of minimalism, electronic music, drone and 20th century classical music to compositions based on blues, jazz, gospel and country music.

---

Drummer Jim White first come to attention in the mid-1990s with the acclaimed Australian instrumental trio Dirty Three, and is now recognised internationally as one of the most creative and expressive drummers on the planet. His unique playing style and deft way with sound and rhythm has seen him become the go-to drummer for a huge number of alt-A-list vocalists with collaboration in mind. PJ Harvey has said there is ballet in White’s light, precise touch. And the other collaborators that he’s mesmerised, including the likes of Bonnie Prince Billy, Smog, Nick Cave, White Magic, Beth Orton, Marianne Faithfull, Kurt Vile, Cat Power and the iconic Cretan lyra player Psarantonis, all know that there’s more to White’s drumming than mere accompaniment. His intuitive beats and singular approach have created sparks in his collaborations. Whoever White is playing with, he is right there, present in the most inspirational sense.

---

Motte is the solo project of violinist and composer, Anita Clark. Riding the thin line between beauty and devastation, Motte weaves together a richly textured world with a violin, delay pedal, sampled sound and voice. Creating a world solely her own, the sound is modern classical, ambient, alt/experimental pop and improvised noise. Her musical gifts and skilful reach across genres makes her an indispensable collaborator with The Phoenix Foundation, Luke Buda, Marlon Williams, Don McGlashan, the Renderers, Nadia Reid, Lawrence Arabia, Delaney Davidson and plenty of others. As Motte, she dances around the shining candescence of her culture like a night insect, always seeking a better vantage point to the light.

---

UMU is a duo of Riki Gooch and Daniel Beban. Silver Apples meets Kuduro with Riki's deep grooves played on an 80s Roland electronic drum kit which are manipulated and dubbed out by Dan on two Tama Techstar drum synths.

$35 earlybird tickets via Meow / $20 unwaged

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

The Bridie & Rebecca Variety Show @ NZ Fringe
There's no business like show business, and there's nobody who knows that better than Tāmaki Makaurau's hottest new chaotic, queer, comedic duo, Bridie and Rebecca!

Comedy Culture NZ presents "The Bridie and Rebecca Variety Show, (But It's Just Rebecca and Bridie)"! Bridie Thomson and Rebecca Mary Gwendolon are two outrageously silly, queer, multi-faceted performers who extend their funny bones from fast-paced improv to the delights of sketch comedy and beyond. As Rebecca and Bridie establish themselves as a comedy double-act, they're taking inspiration from some of the great dynamic duos of popular culture. This show will be funny, silly, and loose as they prepare to unleash joyful chaos within the NZ comedy scene in 2026.

Bring some pals, come make some new ones and laugh your way through the night with your favourite new duo.
Witness the chaos and tell everyone you were there to see it first!

events.id: Westpac Smarts: What’s next for Wellington property in 2026-Westpac Building,Level 10, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Westpac Smarts: What’s next for Wellington property in 2026
events.venue: Westpac Building,Level 10, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Westpac Smarts: What’s next for Wellington property in 2026
Westpac Smarts: What’s next for Wellington property in 2026

About this Event

Join Westpac and the Wellington Chamber of Commerce for the first Westpac Smarts session of 2026, featuring one of New Zealand’s most closely watched voices on property and economic trends.
Nick Goodall, Head of Research at Cotality, will unpack what’s ahead for Wellington’s property market as we enter a new phase - marked by stabalising interest rates, a new Reserve Bank Governor, and a market emerging from a period of prolonged value plateau.
After a sharp downturn from the 2021 peak, Wellington’s housing market is showing signs of stabilisation. With prices resetting, affordability improving, and buyer sentiment beginning to lift, Nick will explore what this means for homeowners, investors, and businesses alike.
Drawing on the latest regional and national data, Nick will share insights into:
How lower interest rates and policy changes are shaping buyer and investor behaviour
What evolving rental market dynamics mean for landlords and tenants
The impact of zoning and urban development changes on housing supply
Where potential value and opportunity may lie as the market rebalances
This session will provide a clear-eyed view of the risks, realities, and opportunities emerging in 2026, cutting through the noise with evidence-led insights and practical context.
Join this high-value briefing for business leaders, property owners, and investors looking to understand where the market is heading, and how to navigate the year ahead with confidence.

Event details:
12:00pm - Networking
12:15pm – Presentation
1:15pm – Wrap-up

Chamber members and Westpac customers: Free entry
Non-members: $5.00 donated to Life Flight Trust through the Westpac Chopper Appeal

events.id: Gone By Lunchtime: 10th Birthday Party-10 Kent Terrace, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Gone By Lunchtime: 10th Birthday Party
events.venue: 10 Kent Terrace, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Three elections, five prime ministers, several hundred emotional junior staffers and 10 years ago, the podcast Gone By Lunchtime was born screaming into the political world.
Toby Manhire, Annabelle Lee-Mather and Ben Thomas have since then been huddling together to make sense and nonsense of political matters in Aotearoa. Join them on an odyssey down memory lane, recalling their own journeys to fronting New Zealand’s Only Podcast™ taking in everything from Jacindamania to suburban pigeons, from crown-Māori relations to the Bad Boys of Brexit, from coalition building to piss-filled Zorbs.
All that, plus a surprise guest, and we'll exclusively reveal precisely how election year is going to pan out.
-
Toby Manhire is an Auckland-based writer, editor and broadcaster. He is editor-at-large at The Spinoff and host of podcasts including Juggernaut 2: The Story of the Fourth National Government and Gone By Lunchtime.
Annabelle Lee-Mather (Ngāi Tahu, Ngāti Kahungunu, Ngāti Māmoe) is a journalist and producer who’s spent the last 25 years working in media, mostly by saying yes to things before thinking them through. She created The Hui, The Casketeers, Hongi To Hāngī and a bunch of other shows her kids refuse to watch.
Annabelle now runs Aotearoa Media Collective with her work wife Mihingarangi Forbes producing the long form current affairs series Mata Reports and the NZ Wars series. She sings the high part in the Gone By Lunchtime trio, slightly off-key, but with conviction.
Ben Thomas is a political commentator and director of Capital Government Relations and Communications, a Wellington and Auckland based public affairs firm. He is a former political editor of the National Business Review and was a press secretary in the previous National government. He writes a regular column for The Post and Stuff.

events.name: Wankernomics — Just Touching Base
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
At work, do you struggle with simple tasks like using the phrase “circle back” in every email? Have you never used the word “synergies” in a LinkedIn post? You might be a failure at office life and need a pep talk. Luckily, some Australian satirists have a solution. ‘Wankernomics — Just Touching Base’ live at The Opera House reveals the secret to workplace success through the ancient art of being annoying.   
The shows are hilarious and include many ‘oh-my-god-that’s-exactly-what-happens-at-my-workplace’ moments. You’ll get a demonstration of the buzzwords, bureaucracy, banality, and baloney of modern working life. You’ll get tips on how to speak at work, how to look like a genius in meetings, and how to get promoted by simply dropping the phrase ‘360 degree all-hands ideation session’ into an email to your boss. 
So, pop some time in the diary for an outcomes-focused, value-added, best-practice, deep-dive into the realities of the working world.
events.description:
At work, do you struggle with simple tasks like using the phrase “circle back” in every email?
Have you never used the word “synergies” in a LinkedIn post?
You might be a failure at office life and need a pep talk.
Luckily, some Australian satirists have a solution.
‘Wankernomics — Just Touching Base’ live at The Opera House reveals the secret to workplace success through the ancient art of being annoying.

events.long_description:
✨ NOSTALGIA ✨
A celebration of circus artistry, equestrian brilliance, and the greatest music across the generations.
Step back in time with us as we journey through the decades, showcasing unforgettable moments in musical history through breathtaking circus and equestrian performances. From inspiring big and small horses of all disciplines to some of Kāpiti’s finest performers, Nostalgia brings together the stars of yesterday and the rising stars of today.
Prepare to be amazed by a spectacular range of skills:
• Equestrian vaulting
• Dancing horses
• A thrilling fire-jumping act
• Spinning wheel performances
• Acrobatics and ensemble acts
• Aerial silk and hoop artistry
This is a truly family-friendly show with something for all ages—and we promise an experience you’ll never forget. We can’t wait to share it with you!
Food & Refreshments
A full food and drink stand will be open throughout the event, including a licensed bar, hot food, snacks, and refreshments. The stand will also be available during intermission.
Parking & Venue
We have plenty of onsite parking with helpers to guide you on arrival. Simply follow the driveway down to the Kapiti Equestrian and Vaulting Club—your suburban oasis for an unforgettable evening.
Don’t miss out—get your tickets now and join us for a magical celebration of music, movement, and memories!

events.name: 100 Things - NZ Fringe
events.venue: Circus Bar,17b Allen Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
100 Things - NZ Fringe
3 actors. 60 minutes. 100 Things. Can this improv comedy show from Tamaki Makaurau really do it?

In an improv show, the performers typically ask for a suggestion from the audience. In 100 Things, the actors craft ONE HUNDRED audience suggestions into a narrative show. Imagine if Taskmaster and Whose Line Is It Anyway? had a baby ... it'll be kind of like that!

This cast of women and non-binary actors from Aotearoa are driven by a powerful desire to do the best damn improv show ever and prove Guinness World Records wrong.

Winner of Late Night Knife Fight Tāmaki Makaurau 2023

Nominated for “Best Ensemble” and “Best Show” at NZ Improv Festival 2024

Rejected by Guinness World Records 3 times and counting

“Guinness World Records should be devastated to have missed it” Theatreview

events.long_description:
NYPDEEZ NUTS @ NZ FRINGE 2026
Detective Constables John McMally & Hughie Rothman have eradicated crime in New York, and now they must go to the one place where corruption and crime reign terror upon every city.. New Zealand.

After being voted as the winners of their November 2024 Late Night Knife Fight in Tāmaki Makaurau, Improvisers Izzy Renton and Bridie Thomson are now ready to unleash their absurd moider (murder)-solving, donut-dunking, justice-fighting duo upon the world.

This is a highly interactive, fully improvised, murder-mystery style show where members of the audience play everyone from witness, to perpetrator, to the manager at Animates in Palmerston North.

Justice has never been so hard.

events.name: Pre-'85 Classic's Trip into Orange Hut
events.venue: Akatarawa Forest,Upper Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Pre-'85 Classic's Trip into Orange Hut
SAVE THE DATE – PRE-’85 4x4 BBQ at ORANGE HUT!

Saturday, 21 February 2026

Classic 4WDs. Good Food. Great Company.

Dust off those old rigs, fire up your engines, and join us for a laid-back BBQ and catch-up with fellow classic 4x4 enthusiasts!

This isn’t your typical off-road trip — it’s a celebration of the vehicles that built the tracks we love. Whether it’s a bit rusty, beautifully restored, or a bush-basher with stories to tell — if it’s Pre-1985 and 4WD, it’s welcome.


Eligible Vehicles Include:

Toyota's | Series Land Rovers | Patrols | Jeeps | Suzuki's | And all classic off-road legends


️ Proposed Route:

(Subject to change based on weather & group size)

Valley View Road

McGhies Road → McGhies Bridge

Karapoti Road → 3rd Crossing

Pram Track, Dopers Track

Whakatikei Road → Titi Road

Fenceline Track → Hydro Valley Road

Cross the ford to Orange Hut for BBQ lunch

Hydro Road → Pylon

Toi Toi Road → Clearys → Cooks Ridge → Cooks Gate



LUNCH @ ORANGE HUT:

We’ll be firing up the wood BBQ to serve:

Sausages

Build-your-own Burgers
Bring a chair, bring your appetite, and bring your stories!



Post-Trip Dinner (Optional):

Depending on interest, we’re planning a casual dinner catch-up at Brewtown in the evening. Let us know if you're keen!



️ BONUS TRIP – SUNDAY 22 FEBRUARY

We're also planning a Sunday run into Orongorongo Station for those sticking around. Details to follow in the next update.



Tell your mates. Save the date. More info coming soon!

This is one for the books — let’s celebrate these classic rigs the right way.

#Pre85BBQ #Classic4x4s #OrangeHutRun #OldRigsNewMemories

Day Membership fee to NZFWDA $20 for all non NZFWDA Members


To register https://ccvcwellington.wildapricot.org/event-6350069?CalendarViewType=1&SelectedDate=2/10/2026

events.id: USUI REIKI LEVEL TWO IN KAPITI with Heartsong-Paraparaumu Memorial Hall-All Events In
events.name: USUI REIKI LEVEL TWO IN KAPITI with Heartsong
events.venue: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall
events.long_description:
USUI REIKI LEVEL TWO IN KAPITI with Heartsong
Level Two Usui Reiki is a significant development on from Level One. Get in touch to enquire. You can study Level Two with me if you had your Level One attunement elsewhere.

This TWO DAY course offers 10 hours of in person training, a full manual, certificate of completion, a follow up Zoom call and ongoing support. Maximum of 6 participants to enable close support and interaction.

Level 2 involves a new powerful attunement and learning new techniques such as Distance Reiki, sacred reiki symbols, and preparing for working on people you may not know. You can start charging for your Reiki services after completing level two.

We learn about three Reiki symbols and practice drawing them. By Day 2 it is expected that you have memorized how to draw Level 2 Symbols (I teach with a gap between day 1&2 so this is very achievable).

Becoming competent at distance healing is a significant priority of Level 2 training and we will have plenty of practice doing this. Distance healing is practiced on people and animals. Basic business set up is discussed.

Advanced Practitioner Level Reiki is a great tool if you want to feel centered in your life, it helps to balance and align our energy bodies, and can cause positive changes in many areas of our lives. Reiki can be used to help heal a wide number of conditions and to initiate and support positive life changes. Further details on enquiry. Reiki Level 2 opens you to a deeper channel of healing energy and enables you to offer healing professionally.

Dates are specially chosen to be auspicious in relation to the moon and cosmic energies

Saturday FEBRUARY 21ST, 10.am-4.30pm

Saturday MARCH 14TH, 10am-4.30pm

The gap in between the two training days allows you to receive support as you experience the 21 day 'cleanse' and integration period after the Reiki attunement - and also enable time to work on developing and practicing the material learnt in the first days training.

Total of 12 hours tuition time plus some at home practice/study required.

Light simple shared lunches are provided - you will need to bring a contribution.

Herbal teas and light snacks are also provided.

Location: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, Corner of Aorangi and Tutanekai Streets, Paraparaumu

Pre-enrollment questionnaire -

Investment:

£555 for full TWO day course, training, all support materials including manual, certificate, light healthy lunch, refreshments and ongoing support. Plus extra hours online in follow up Zoom call on 21st day.

Pay in Full Here - https://buy.stripe.com/9B628q2W4ahTghqdcKew81V

A non-refundable $155 deposit secures your place - book here: https://buy.stripe.com/eVqcN4bsA89LaX6b4Cew81S

There is a payment plan available - contact me

Bryony is a Usui Reiki Master Teacher and she has 27 years healing experience. She loves teaching this precious, versatile healing skill and it gives her great pleasure to offer this training in Lancaster

Bryony says:
Reiki has had a powerful positive influence on my life, helping me to heal and change mindset, physical and emotional conditions, and to see life in a new light. Reiki helped with my recovery from Chronic Fatigue syndrome and Depression ❤ I will share this with you in this course and help you open your life to the positive transformation that Reiki can bring.

If you are interested in coming on this course, please contact me by email at to receive a questionnaire to answer which gives me a sense of your interest, previous experience of Reiki healing and conditions I should be aware of.

Cancellation Policy:

If Heartsong Healing needs to cancel the course all payments are refunded. If you withdraw from the course before 14 days before start date, your payment will be refunded minus the 55 deposit, kept as an admin fee. If you withdraw within 14 -7 days 50% of your payment will be refunded, 7-3 days 75% of your payment will be refunded, 3 days no refund. If you need to withdraw, you may be entitled to a discount on future bookings, at our discretion.

events.name: Queen Elizabeth Park Open Day
events.venue: Queen Elizabeth Park,Paraparaumu, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Queen Elizabeth Park Open Day
A summer celebration on the Kāpiti Coast!

Bring the whānau and join us for a fun-filled day at Queen Elizabeth Park next to beautiful Whareroa Beach. We’re celebrating 25 years of Greater Wellington’s summer events in your regional parks.

Explore the heart of this beloved park. Enjoy activities like:

Historic tram rides through the park

Face painting and crafts for the tamariki

Artisan Craft Market will be onsite with stalls and food trucks with delicious treats

Live performers Fairy Cat and her fairy friends will bring their magic.

This is your chance to experience one of our most iconic regional parks, known for its WWII U.S. Marines Camp history and wetland restoration projects. Pack a picnic, relax by the beach, and make a day of it!



Get the whānau involved in Summer Events

Discover the magic of your regional parks. For 25 years, Greater Wellington has been hosting recreational events that help people connect with nature, get active outdoors, and enjoy time together.

Queen Elizabeth Park is more than just a beautiful coastal space—it’s a hub for conservation. Greater Wellington’s work here protects freshwater and wetlands, restores native habitats, preserves historic sites, and helps build resilience to climate change. Our partners, mana whenua, and volunteers play a vital role in making this park a special place for everyone.

events.name: Lunar New Year: Tea Ceremony Demonstration With Wellington Xiamen Association
events.venue: 3 Jervois Quay, New Zealand 6011,3 Jervois Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Lunar New Year: Tea Ceremony Demonstration With Wellington Xiamen Association
Ring in the Lunar New Year with a joyful celebration! Members of the Wellington Xiamen Association will host a special tea ceremony demonstration, sharing the artistry, history, and cultural significance of tea from Xiamen, Wellington’s ‘sister city’ and home to some of China’s finest teas.

This is a chance to pause, connect, and experience the beauty of tea culture in a welcoming setting. Wander through, listen to stories, and soak up the atmosphere as we mark the beginning of the Year of the Horse.

The Wellington Xiamen Association works to strengthen ties between our two cities through cultural exchange, education, and collaboration.


Saturday 21 February | 1pm–2:30pm

Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum

events.name: Upper Hutt Gypsy Fair
events.venue: Riverbank Park,42 Riverbank St, Upper Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Upper Hutt Gypsy Fair
The Gypsy Fair is a nationwide travelling event, bringing family fun, live music and an unbeatable vibe to each town we visit.🌞💜

Having been on the road for over 45 years, it’s safe to say our roots run deep. Our people are incredible, and house trucks/buses are pretty cool too! So don’t forget to check out our unique way of living while you’re here 🫶🌿🌻💜

Whether you’re just having a browse, letting the kids loose on our rides, parking up with some food or coffee, or checking out some funky handmade crafts, we would love to see you! Come and hang out for the day, we’re sure to bring smiles to your faces, and create lifelong memories💜

🌞Free entry for everyone🌞 We pride ourselves on being an affordable event for every family. With free entertainment all day, plenty of chill out zones, and loads of life size games laying around, we truely love to see the community getting amongst it all! Can’t wait to see you there🌞👣🐝🌿🌊

Follow us on Facebook – ‘Gypsy Fair’ for updates on our travels and creations! We’re always open to anyone who wants to come and live the dream, so please email us if this sounds like a bit of you. –

You may also like the following events from The GypsyFair:
Next month, 26th September, 11:00 pm, Papamoa Gypsy Fair in Tauranga
This October, 3rd October, 11:00 pm, Gisborne Gypsy Fair in Gisborne
This October, 10th October, 11:00 pm, Havelock North Gypsy Fair in Havelock North
Also check out other Music events in Upper Hutt, Entertainment events in Upper Hutt.

events.id: Earth Tongue-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Earth Tongue
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
Fresh off the announcement of their forthcoming third album Dungeon Vision, Aotearoa’s heavy-psych duo Earth Tongue return home this February for a run of six exclusive shows across the country. The tour comes off the back of the band’s whirlwind international touring cycle and gives fans the earliest chance to hear brand-new material. 
The first show lands on the day of Dungeon Vision’s release, playing at the Turner Centre, Kerikeri on Friday 13 February. They’ll follow that up in Auckland’s Double Whammy on Saturday 14 February and then Last Place, Hamilton on Sunday 15 February. The duo then travel south for a run in Dunedin at Pearl Diver on Thursday 19 February, Space Academy in Christchurch on Friday 20 February before heading to Wellington on Saturday 21 February to finish the tour at the iconic San Fran. 
Guitarist Gussie Larkin and drummer Ezra Simmons have been based in Berlin, writing and recording Dungeon Vision with Los Angeles garage-rock icon Ty Segall who together have captured Earth Tongue’s most immersive and ambitious work yet. With anticipation building after unveiling their towering title track ‘Dungeon Vision’ and its handcrafted, cinematic music video - Earth Tongue edge fans toward a set of shows which bring a fully realised Dungeon Vision experience.  
Earth Tongue - Dungeon Vision (Official Music Video)
With their world-building aesthetic, relentless energy and cemented spot as one of our most electrifying psych-rock acts, Earth Tongue are sure to provide an unforgettable show - celebrating the release of their most visionary record to date. Don’t miss them playing in Aotearoa this February.

Artisan Craft Market (22/2/26 Lower Hutt)
The Artisan Craft Market is a premium handmade event that takes place across various locations in the broader Wellington region. This high-quality market is designed to foster a welcoming and friendly atmosphere.

Our vision at Artisan Craft Market is to make the market accessible to those who appreciate shopping locally. We aim to provide a platform that supports local artisans, allowing them to showcase their meticulously crafted, high-quality products. By bringing the market directly to the people, we hope to celebrate and promote the unique talents of our community’s skilled artisans.

events.id: Climate Action Week Marlborough 2026-Blenheim, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Climate Action Week Marlborough 2026
events.venue: Blenheim, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Climate Action Week 2026 - Agenda
Dates: February 2026 - 23rd - 27th February
Theme: Leading by Doing: Local Businesses, Local Solutions, Collective Action
Each day features:
Morning: Local Business Story Sessions (Curated stories for our business community to get inspired with raw, honest and authentic stories)
Midday: Action Design Workshops (Crafting Plans & Solutions)
Afternoon: Immersion Experiences and Hands-On Field Visits (Applied Learning & Practical Support)
Day 1 - Water, Risk and Resilience 
Morning: Marlborough businesses facing water risks (horticulture, viticulture, manufacturing, nature, tourism) share adaptation stories: irrigation shifts, stormwater projects, water reuse innovations.
Midday: Business-specific water risks and trials of resilience-building solutions.
Afternoon: Immersion experiences to diverse water initiatives across the region
Day 2 - Circular economy & waste
Morning: Circular leaders (including wine, food and beverages, building, construction, fisheries, nature) show how they have reduced waste, repurposed byproducts, or created new revenue streams from "waste."
Midday: Waste Challenge Mapping: Identify business-specific waste streams + select 1 trial action for next 6 months.
Afternoon: Immersion experiences to waste initiatives and innovative approaches across the region
Day 3 - Nature and Biodiversity 
Morning: Farmers, viticulturists & landscapers share regenerative planting, biodiversity corridors, and ecosystem services initiatives.
Midday: Biodiversity on Your Site Toolkit Workshop — Co-design biodiversity plans for business properties (guided by local ecologists & farming leaders)
Afternoon: Immersion experiences to nature, land and biodiversity initiatives across the region.
Day 4 - Energy & Carbon
Morning: Businesses share their real decarbonisation journeys: EV transitions, renewable installations, process efficiencies — including the unexpected savings, costs and impacts.
Midday: Carbon Reduction Sprints — Design quick-win carbon actions + long-term projects with support from energy consultants and local peers.
Afternoon: Site visits to Carbon and Energy initiatives across the region
Day 5 - Taking the courage to act
Morning: Businesses share how they initiated climate actions, including failures, lessons, and unexpected wins.
Midday: Climate Action Map Workshop — Business leaders build their tailored action roadmaps (guided by peers + facilitators).
Afternoon: Immersion to unique businesses focussed on climate resilience
Immersion Experience Hosts Confirmed
Yealands Estate Winery
Carbonscape
Wineworks
Climate Action Marlborough has had the support of Yealands Estate Wines from its inception and we are super grateful to have their support for Climate Action Week Marlborough 2026. They are committed to influencing the Marlborough business community, driving collaboration that impacts climate resilience, education, health and wellbeing of a thriving region and growing our regions expertise.

events.id: Capital City Complex Systems Symposium 2026-National Library of New Zealand, Tiakiwai Conference Centre,70 Molesworth Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Capital City Complex Systems Symposium 2026
events.venue: National Library of New Zealand, Tiakiwai Conference Centre,70 Molesworth Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Capital City Complex Systems Symposium 2026
Join us in Wellington, New Zealand this summer for a gathering of leading researchers and practitioners working on complex systems.

About this Event

Nau mai haere mai ki tēnei hui!
Ka mihi mātou ki ngā mana whenua o tēnei takiwā, ki a Taranaki whānui, me ngā hapū, iwi iwi katoa kua tau i kōnei, me ō rātou mahi whakahirahira, mahi tiaki i ngā taonga o ēnei whenua.
Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington, is the capital city of Aotearoa New Zealand. Māori have lived in Te Whanganui a Tara for 800 years. We acknowledge Taranaki whānui, and all the peoples who have lived here, and their close relationship with the lands and waters.


The Capital City Complex Systems Symposium 2026 will explore cutting-edge knowledge of complex systems and complexity, and how this knowledge is being used to better understand systems and drive system change. It will be held in Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington, Aotearoa New Zealand, during summer in the Southern Hemisphere.
The theme for the conference is ‘Understanding complex systems: Theory, practice and impact’.

Our programme, including speakers, can be viewed here

Following the success of previous symposia in 2023 and 2024, this event will continue to foster interdisciplinary, cross-sector and cross-society collaboration in complex systems thinking, research and action. In 2026, the symposium will integrate the latest insights from complex systems science with the pressing concerns facing communities, businesses, and policymakers today. A particular focus will be how complexity science has evolved and how it is informing contemporary actions and solutions for prosperous, resilient, equitable and democratic societies – amid growing global challenges.
The symposium will explore complexity through a rich interdisciplinary lens, bringing together philosophical and epistemological perspectives alongside practical insights from fields including artificial intelligence, infrastructure, health, education, climate, and the environment, and cutting-edge insights from Māori and local communities. Attendees will engage with understandings of complexity, examine innovative methods and tools for working within complex systems, and discuss the implications for public policy, governance, leadership and Indigenous system change.
This inclusive, supportive event is essential for anyone interested in understanding the trajectory and practical applications of complex systems knowledge — including researchers, leaders, policymakers, innovators, changemakers, practitioners, and students. Whether you’re deeply experienced in complex systems research or newly curious about its potential, the symposium will provide valuable insights, networking opportunities, and inspiration.


We are taking expressions of interest (EOI) for an optional pre-event workshop on Monday 23 February, also held at the National Library. Will we notify you of the agenda and ticket price closer to the date
The Capital City Complex Systems Symposium 2026 will take place on 24–25 February 2026 at the Tiakiwai Conference Centre, National Library of New Zealand, Wellington.



Optional pre-event workshop
10am-5pm Tiakiwai Conference Centre

D ay 1
9am-5pm Symposium, Tiakiwai Conference Centre
5pm-6pm Networking Cocktail Hour
6pm-9pm Dinner, Thistle Inn

D ay 2
9 am - 5pm Symposium, Tiakiwai Conference Centre

events.id: The Effective Speaker, Wellington, 24th & 25th Feb-Level 28/100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: The Effective Speaker, Wellington, 24th & 25th Feb
events.venue: Level 28/100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
1 or 2 Day Presentation Skills Workshop
Limited tickets available. Get in now so you don't miss out!
When effective presenters speak, they do more than inform - they influence, persuade, and inspire. That isn’t magic; it’s method. With the right tools, anyone can build genuine connection and move a room.
This workshop is for leaders, emerging leaders, technical specialists, and professionals who want practical tools and techniques for speaking in both formal and informal settings.
Short on time? Attend 1 Day (Foundations) for all the core skills. Ready for a bigger shift? Choose 2 Days (Advanced) for one on one coaching and deeper transformation. Pick what’s right for you.
You’ll leave with the tools to present more clearly, confidently, and with the influence your role demands. This is not just for the stage. You will use these skills everyday.
The workshop format
Small group format for maximum practice and feedback (no massive groups).
Learning is adapted and personalised for maximum value (no cookie-cutter approach).
Hands on, practical learning, with easy to apply tools and techniques (no sitting around listening to theory).
The Effective Speaker - One Day Workshop (Foundations):
Tuesday 3rd March
A hands-on day where you’ll learn our step-by-step SpeakerMap™ system to plan valuable presentations quickly and with ease.
You’ll learn the principles behind useful visuals, how to manage nerves, and three delivery techniques you can use immediately.
Foundations is best for technical experts who know their stuff but struggle to get it across, and nervous presenters who want a safe, practical reset.
What you’ll learn
Plan engaging content (fast)
Use the SpeakerMap™ to develop a clear Key Message and structure that keeps audiences attentive without overload.
Plan faster, make better decisions about what to include (and what to ditch).
 Design useful slides (not wallpaper)
A simple but revolutionary way to design slides that support — not sabotage — your message.
Practical guidance on using AI to fast-track draft slides and create supporting documents.
How to use PowerPoint to keep you on track without putting your audience to sleep.
 Keep nerves under control
A proven psychological approach to calm the mental chatter that causes waffling, speed talking, and blank moments.
Build a personal plan to shift focus from “me” to the audience and the outcome you want.
 Deliver in a natural, engaging way
Three delivery techniques that help you look credible, be engaging and feel confident.
How to vary pace and emphasis so your key points actually land.
How to cut the filler - the “ums” and “ahs” - and keep your flow.
 Plenty of practice
You’ll practise each technique in pairs or threes — supportive, safe, and highly practical.
Includes
A full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
The Effective Speaker workbook
30minute one on one follow up session
Investment: $1,200 + GST (Early Bird Pricing $995+GST)
 
The Effective Speaker - Two Day Workshop (Advanced)
Tuesday 3rd & Wednesday 4th March
Gain all the skills from Day One - and then take them further. If presenting is central to your career growth, this is the coaching workshop you need.
Over two full days, you’ll create a significant shift in your communication skills.
Day One gives you the foundations to make presenting easier and more effective.
Day Two consolidates and extends these skills. You’ll go deeper into content planning, adapt the tools to your real work presentations, and get personalised coaching to develop your own authentic style.
You’ll also learn strategies for handling even the toughest audiences. The workshop is practical, hands-on, and focused on learning by doing - presenting, receiving coaching, and observing your peers.
If you’re ready for lasting, transformative change in your communication skills, the two-day option is the best choice.
What you’ll learn
Everything from Day 1 (Foundations) PLUS
Go deeper with planning
Apply the SpeakerMap to plan an actual presentation that you can give. 
Dive deeper into crafting valuable messages that you can use in the future. 
Rehearse in a way that actually works
A practical way to prepare when time is tight — so you own your words.
Shift from competent to compelling
One-on-one coaching targeted to your specific needs.
Video feedback plus our inside-out coaching methodology to reconnect you with the techniques you use naturally in conversation.
How to use silence, pace, notes, and the remote without looking stiff or artificial.
How to speak with energy and authenticity, not speed and panic.
Eliminate “ums” and “ahs”, look confident (even when you’re not), and create a sense of commitment that audiences feel.
An understanding of your personal communication strengths and the areas you need to focus on for growth.

Handle audiences like a pro
Strategies for side chats, interruptions, distractions, disagreement, and the odd angry voice - while staying calm and in control.

Includes
Everything in Day 1, plus:
A second full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
Videos of your presenting and coaching sessions
The Effective Speaker workbook
60minute one on one follow up session
Investment: $2,500 + GST (Early Bird Pricing $2.200+GST)
What past participants say:

"The overall experience of the course far surpassed my expectations. I came in hoping to gain some valuable insights and tips for better public speaking, but what I received was so much more. I developed a newfound confidence in my ability to communicate effectively, learned how to captivate an audience, and discovered strategies for managing nerves and overcoming stage fright. I would recommend this effective speaking course to anyone looking to enhance their communication abilities. It's not just another course; it's a transformative experience that will empower you to become a more confident and persuasive speaker" Alex Goryachev, New Zealand Green Building Council

I can’t thank Jane enough.” Nadia Marsh, Head of Bids, Tonkin & Taylor

Typically, people tune out or lose interest by the end of the day. This was not the case for us. I honestly thing it’s the best course I’ve been on in my 4 years with WCC." Joshua Harding, Team Leader Consents, Wellington City Council

A very polished and well-planned course.” Huia Grey, Department of Conservation
"By far the best course i have attended in any organisation, either here in NZ or abroad. The format of the course was engaging and there was a great balance between listening, engaging and participating. I look forward to using the skills used presenting at our next Team Hui!"
Matthew Townsley, Medical Council of New Zealand


"Really great course, no pressure environment with a good mix of interactive and book work. Have walked away feeling more confident in how I am going to put my presentations together."

Jessica Stokes, Emergency Management Team, New Plymouth District Council

events.id: Amble | Wellington-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Amble | Wellington
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
Amble, the critically acclaimed three-piece folk group hailing from Ireland, today announce their return to Australia and New Zealand in February 2026, in support of their highly anticipated debut album, Reverie.
Irish trio Amble harness a rare magic threaded into the fabric of their novelistic folk.
Originally hailing from the West Region of Ireland, the group—Robbie Cunningham (lead vocals/guitar), Ross McNerney (mandolin/bouzouki), and Oisin McCaffrey (vocals/guitar)—have unassumingly gone from quitting their day jobs in rural Ireland to the doorstep of an international breakthrough, buoyed by over 100 million streams and sold-out shows around the world.
Amble’s debut album, Reverie, set for release on Friday, 23 May this year, showcases Amble's signature sound: relatability, intimate storytelling, and authenticity seamlessly blended with no-frills acoustic instrumentation, serene soundscapes, and heavenly natural harmonies.
The album, recorded live in various studios between Ireland and Los Angeles, captures the spirit of the band's early days.

events.id: The Music of Greece-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: The Music of Greece
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Marking its Aotearoa debut, the Hellenic Music Ensemble brings the unforgettable soundscape of Greece to life in a landmark global tour. The group will be under the direction of acclaimed composer and conductor Panos Liaropoulos. This 21-piece orchestra honours the genius of Greece’s most iconic composers: Mikis Theodorakis (BAFTA-winning ‘Zorba's Dance’) and Manos Hadjidakis (‘Never on a Sunday’). 
The orchestra will be joined by legendary voices Manolis Mitsias, Giannis Haroulis, and Natassa Bofiliou. Together, they’ll bring the quintessential melodies of Greece to the Michael Fowler Centre. This one-night-only show is part of the Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts. Soar through a century of song — celebrating the soul, poetry, and passion of Greece.

events.long_description:
When you think of hard rock and metal, you might not naturally connect them to the refined sounds of classical music. The Rock Orchestra by Candlelight has done just that. After entertaining 700,000 people across the UK, USA and Europe, it’s coming to Wellington. 
Prepare for a spellbinding 90-minute spectacle infusing rock and metal anthems with beautiful orchestral energy. A band of 13 classical musicians will accompany the fiery tunes. Through a wall of distortion, you’ll witness the unexpected union of classical and metal music. 
In an ethereal candlelit setting, you’ll experience the music of famous bands. Hear Metallica, AC/DC, Rage Against the Machine, My Chemical Romance, Linkin' Park, SOAD, Guns N’ Roses, Evanescence, Aerosmith, The Cranberries, and more.

events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington,175 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Yoga Nidra: Moon Bathing
Slow down, settle in, and let the soft glow of the moon guide you inward.

About this Event


Yoga Nidra: Moon Bathing

Slow down, settle in, and let the soft glow of the moon guide you inward.
This calming evening will centre around the deeply restorative practice of Yoga Nidra—a guided meditation designed to bring your body into a state of deep rest while your awareness gently drifts between waking and dreaming. Known to activate the parasympathetic nervous system and reduce stress, Yoga Nidra supports emotional balance, mental clarity, and a profound sense of ease.
This moon-themed session invites you to tune into the gentle, reflective energy of the lunar cycle—a time for slowing down, softening, and simply being.





After the practice, we’ll be sharing a nourishing plant-based dinner together. It’s included in your ticket and is a lovely way to gently transition back, connect, and enjoy wholesome food in good company.




Agenda


🕑: 06:00 PM - 06:15 PM
Arrive to Bhakti Lounge

🕑: 06:15 PM - 07:15 PM
Yoga Nidra: Moon Bathing

🕑: 07:15 PM - 08:15 PM
Plant-based dinner and dessert!
