events.id: 2026 Wellington POCUS Fundamentals Course / EGLS Course-24 Hawkestone Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: 2026 Wellington POCUS Fundamentals Course / EGLS Course
events.venue: 24 Hawkestone Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
POCUS Fundamentals + EGLS
2 Days of Comprehensive POCUS education for Acute Care Clinicians
Take part in a flexible learning experience designed for real-world acute care:
Day 1: POCUS Fundamentals
Master the essentials – focus on AAA & eFAST.
Day 2: EGLS (Echo Guided Life Support)
Confidently assess and manage the shocked patient using focused cardiac and lung ultrasound.
Attend either day independently, or combine both for a complete acute care ultrasound experience.

Day 1 – POCUS Fundamentals
Focus on essential diagnostic ultrasound skills with Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm (AAA) & eFAST (extended Focused Assessment with Sonography in Trauma) modules. This is ideal for clinicians seeking to build confidence and competence in core applications that can be immediately applied in clinical practice.
https://www.emugs.org/pocusfundamentals
Day 2 – EGLS (Echo-Guided Life Support)
Take your resuscitation skills to the next level with EGLS. Learn a structured, protocolised approach to using cardiac and lung ultrasound in the assessment and management of shock and respiratory failure. This course is designed to empower acute care clinicians with the practical skills to make rapid, life-saving decisions.
https://www.emugs.org/egls
Combo of Fundamentals + EGLS - Whether you're new to ultrasound or looking to enhance your skills, this comprehensive two-day course  is ideal for acute care clinicians aiming to integrate POCUS into daily practice.
You'll cover the core emergency medicine ultrasound modules: FELS, eFAST, AAA, and lung. The course aligns with ACEM and ASUM credentialing requirements for core ultrasound modalities.
By the end, you'll be proficient in four essential techniques: focused echo in life support (FELS), extended FAST, aortic scanning, and lung/thoracic ultrasound.
The program includes online pre-course work, brief lectures, image review, hands-on scanning, and networking opportunities—all within a supportive learning environment.
Suitable for all experience levels:
ACEM trainees beginning their ultrasound journey
Acute care doctors looking to upskill
Clinicians in critical care, rural, and urgent care settings
Beginners will build a solid foundation; experienced users can refine skills with expert feedback

events.long_description:
JOURNEY TO SERENITY Yin Yoga and Sound Healing Special Series # 5
Welcome to the Journey to Serenity Yin Yoga and Sound Healing twice monthly session!!!

These beautiful, nourishing Yin and Sound Sessions are on the second and Fourth Friday of each month (between November 28th and March 28th 2026) and are held in the Meeting / Supper Room of the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall on Tutanekai Street.

It would be lovely to share this healing, nourishing restorative practice in the special energy and support you to give your life a boost of wellbeing and good feeling!!

INTRODUCING - SPECIAL WELCOME OFFER - TWO PEOPLE FOR $90 (You don't have to be a couple) - Book through bank transfer or message me directly

Unique Yin Yoga, Sound Healing, breathwork and meditation come together to create this specially guided, deeply relaxing and healing experience, held within a unique holistic framework that encourages reflection and self-care.

Take the time and space that this session offers, for yourself, and give yourself a gift of true nourishment.

Bryony Shanti from Heartsong Healing will use a wide range of special healing sound instruments along with her voice to guide you into peace, relaxation and stillness. The healing vibration of the specially chosen sounds will wash over you bringing deep clearing, balance and alignment. There is a experience of gratitude and blessing.

Bryony's sound works to strengthen and deepen the powerful work of Yin yoga teacher Bianca who will guide you through 90-minutes of restorative and uplifting poses that are intended for you relax, heal and to open more to receive the healing vibration of sound.

Bianca's Yin Yoga focuses on easily accessible and effective poses
which work into the deeper connective tissues of the body. These poses are held for anywhere between 90 seconds to 5 minutes to allow for an opening in the body, the perfect way to receive the sound vibrations.

Yin yoga invites us into stillness and gives space for both the mind and body to relax and release tension and stress.

OPEN TO ALL: Whether you have experience in either Yin Yoga and Sound Healing or are looking to try something completely new, you are very welcome to join in the journey into a sense of serenity. Beginners and experienced practitioners alike will find something nourishing for themselves in this session.

events.id: Interpretation 101 - INNZ Workshop Wellington-200 Daniell Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Interpretation 101 - INNZ Workshop Wellington
events.venue: 200 Daniell Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Are you looking to enhance your story-sharing skills and visitor engagement?

This workshop is a foundational step towards mastering interpretation and transforming visits into unforgettable experiences. Perfect for those working in museums, galleries, parks, zoos, heritage sites and tourist attractions.
Designed and presented by Lynda Burns this workshop offers a full day of immersive learning. With decades of experience as a practitioner, trainer, and mentor across Aotearoa and abroad, Lynda brings a wealth of knowledge and expertise and is a leader in the field of interpretation.
Throughout the day, you will: 
Experiment with new ideas and skills.
Share your existing knowledge with like-minded professionals. 
Explore the role of place interpretation in visitor experience. 
Learn how to reach the hearts and minds of visitors through meaningful story-sharing. 
Take a closer look at visitor demographics and behaviours. 
Discover the steps to start your interpretation projects, including research, goal setting, media choices, budgeting, and collection analysis. 
Gain basic project management tips to get things done efficiently. 
Explore how to work alongside iwi, stakeholders and managers. 
Please bring actual project ideas or content research to trial what you have learned throughout the day. This hands-on approach ensures that you get to test your new skills and leave with actionable insights. 
"Lynda recently facilitated a workshop on guiding for our team at Cornwall Park. Her amazing, tailored response to our programme has vastly improved the visitor experience and how we interpret this place. Our guides love the new skills they have learnt and are enjoying updating the entire programme of park-led walks.”
- Charlotte Taylor Visitor Experience 2IC Cornwall Park
Join us for this incredible opportunity to enhance your professional skills and elevate your visitor experience. 
Friday 27 February
9.30am-5pm
Wellington Zoo, 200 Daniell Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021
Tickets:
Non member $250
INNZ Member $215
Student/unwaged $190

Morning tea, lunch and afternoon tea will be provided, and all dietary requirements will be accommodated. Please let us know if you have any accessibility requirements.

Discover highlights from our Auckland Interpretation 101 workshop

events.id: Transvision Vamp - Meow Nui, Wellington, NZ-92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011-All Events In
events.name: Transvision Vamp - Meow Nui, Wellington, NZ
events.venue: 92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
events.long_description:
Transvision Vamp - Meow Nui, Wellington, NZ
UK pop rockers Transvision Vamp are bringing those glorious hits to NZ in February - their first tour here since 1991!

Formed in 1986, Transvision Vamp quickly rose to fame. Their songs Baby I Don’t Care, Revolution Baby, I Want Your Love, The Only One, and If Looks Could K*ll, were all NZ chart hits.

Joining original Transvision Vamp's Wendy James and Dave Parsons onstage are guitarist Alex Ward (The Thurston Moore Group) and James Sclavunos (Nick Cave and The Bad Seeds) on drums.

Says Wendy James: "I am so very excited to be coming back to New Zealand to play the songs which started my whole musical journey! I remember vividly so many incredible moments gigging in New Zealand, moments of enormous success, enormous love and enormous fun."

events.name: Blenheim Gypsy Fair
events.venue: Pollard Park,Mayfield, Blenheim 7201, Blenheim, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Blenheim Gypsy Fair
The Gypsy Fair is a nationwide travelling event, bringing family fun, live music and an unbeatable vibe to each town we visit.🌞💜

Having been on the road for over 45 years, it’s safe to say our roots run deep. Our people are incredible, and house trucks/buses are pretty cool too! So don’t forget to check out our unique way of living while you’re here 🫶🌿🌻💜

Whether you’re just having a browse, letting the kids loose on our rides, parking up with some food or coffee, or checking out some funky handmade crafts, we would love to see you! Come and hang out for the day, we’re sure to bring smiles to your faces, and create lifelong memories💜

🌞Free entry for everyone🌞 We pride ourselves on being an affordable event for every family. With free entertainment all day, plenty of chill out zones, and loads of life size games laying around, we truely love to see the community getting amongst it all! Can’t wait to see you there🌞👣🐝🌿🌊

Follow us on Facebook – ‘Gypsy Fair’ for updates on our travels and creations! We’re always open to anyone who wants to come and live the dream, so please email us if this sounds like a bit of you. –

You may also like the following events from The GypsyFair:
Next Friday, 26th September, 11:00 pm, Papamoa Gypsy Fair in Tauranga
Next month, 3rd October, 11:00 pm, Gisborne Gypsy Fair in Gisborne
Next month, 10th October, 11:00 pm, Havelock North Gypsy Fair in Havelock North
Also check out other Music events in Blenheim, Entertainment events in Blenheim.

events.id: Matt Joe Gow at Hilltop Private House Concerts, Wellington-Hilltop Private House Concerts,104B Upland Rd, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Matt Joe Gow at Hilltop Private House Concerts, Wellington
events.venue: Hilltop Private House Concerts,104B Upland Rd, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Matt Joe Gow at Hilltop Private House Concerts, Wellington
Irresistible. Captivating. Unforgettable.

When Matt Joe Gow sings, everything else stops, such is the power of his voice and his songs. Those songs have won awards, from Music Victoria Country Album of the Year (twice) to a New Zealand Country Music Award, with nominations such as an Aotearoa Music Award and various chart positions along the way.

Matt’s voice has been heard in festivals in the United Kingdom and the United States; in venues small and large across Australia and New Zealand; on radio and playlists, and supporting artists such as Chris Isaak and Justin Townes Earle. And every time, he wins new fans, drawn to his amazing vocal tone and his way of bringing the listener closer, telling them stories they will carry with them.

Few artists have that combination of indelible songwriting and an extraordinary voice, along with the commitment to create better art each time and bring it to the audience so they have a transformative live experience. Matt Joe Gow is one of those few. Having recently stepped back from the stage to focus on writing his new album whilst producing other artists, Matt’s upcoming Summer 2026 shows mark a unique and special opportunity to reconnect and see him perform live once again in his home town where it all started.

715PM DOORS
730PM PERFORMANCE

Info tickets email:

Mobile: 027 245 7887 – Anna


TOUR DATES NZ
Sat Jan 31st Ophir Peace Memorial Hall, Ophir
Sat Feb 7th Niagara Falls Bluegrass & Roots Festival, Catlins*
Sat Feb 21st Moons, Dunedin*
Sat Feb 28th Hilltop House Concerts, Wellington
Fri Mar 13th Wanaka A&P Show, Wanaka

* W/ Trio

Further info at: https://mattjoegowmusic.com

events.id: Slow Burn — photography symposium-55 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Slow Burn — photography symposium
events.venue: 55 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
To celebrate the upcoming Te Papa exhibition Slow Burn | Ahi Tāmau, we're hosting a day of collegial conversation about contemporary photography in Aotearoa. Slow Burn highlights the contribution of women and non-binary photographers, drawing on over a decade of research and collecting.
Held on opening day, this symposium begins with a special opportunity to view the exhibition before the museum opens to the public, followed by a keynote presentation from Natalie Robertson — a leading photographer, moving-image artist, and Associate Professor at Auckland University of Technology. Her practice centres her ancestral river, Waiapu, exploring how "lens-based practice can contribute to iwi-based aspirations for environmental reinvigoration".
Across a series of discussions with Aotearoa photographers, we will explore key threads in contemporary practice — including collaboration, process, and evolving photographic culture — offering insights into the ideas and relationships that shape photography today. We'll close the day in the galleries, with a performance of photographer Ann Shelton’s work The physical garden.
Open to photographers, curators, researchers, students, and anyone with an interest in photography, this event invites participants to connect, reflect, and share.
Tickets $60 (waged) / $40 (unwaged) with lunch included.
Assisted listening
An assisted listening system is available for this event. This allows you to stream the audio from the event directly to your hearing aid or smartphone headphones using the free WaveCAST app. More information can be found on our website, including how to set this up ahead of your visit. Feel free to email us at publicprogrammes@tepapa.govt.nz if you need assistance.
Image: Tia Ranginui, The tangi of Rūaumoko, 2023. Purchased 2024. Te Papa (O.052215)

events.id: Friends of Karori Cemetery: Off the Beaten Track Tour (March 2026)-76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Friends of Karori Cemetery: Off the Beaten Track Tour (March 2026)
events.venue: 76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Off the Beaten Track Tour. 
Stretch your legs on this tour! Off the Beaten Track takes you off the main road, exploring a bit further into the older sections of Karori Cemetery. We walk up and down the hills, through the gullies and alongside the creek to discover some interesting characters and some of the history of the cemetery as well.
Each tour is $10 per person (plus non-refundable booking fee). Children under 12 are free.
Our tour has a maximum capacity of about 15 persons. If there are insufficient tickets remaining for your party, please email us at info@friendsofkaroricemetery.co.nz to check if we can accommodate you.
Please note:
If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you on the day 1 hour before the tour starts by email and on our Facebook page. The booking fee is non-refundable.
This tour is approximately 2 hours long.
Please dress appropriately for the conditions. While we do our best to guide you on a safe walking route, during the winter months the ground can become slippery in places.
Some of our walks require a moderate degree of fitness and are not suited for those with limited mobility.
There is only one toilet which is located by the cemetery office at the main entrance.
If you have purchased tickets for other people can you please pass our tour information on to them as well.
Please meet us at the shelter (shown as the Historic Chapel on the map at the main entrance)
We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.
events.description:
Off the Beaten Track takes you off the main road, exploring a bit further into the older sections of Karori Cemetery.
We walk up and down the hills, through the gullies and alongside the creek to discover some interesting characters and some of the history of the cemetery as well.
Please note: If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you on the day 1 hour before the tour starts by email and on our Facebook page.
The booking fee is non-refundable.
Please meet us at the shelter (shown as the Historic Chapel on the map at the main entrance) We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.

events.id: Leftfield-Shed 6, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Leftfield
events.venue: Shed 6, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
UK electronic pioneers Leftfield will celebrate 36 years of music-making when they play Wellington in March. Their influence helped define progressive house and experimental electronic music. Leftfield is expected to bring huge energy to Shed 6. For the tour concerts, they will delve into back catalogue hits as well as their most recent remix collection ‘Full Way Round’. 
The group, made up of duo Neil Barnes and Paul Daley, emerged from London’s club scene in 1989. They were among the first to bring fully live electronic music production into large-scale venues and festivals. Their 1995 Mercury Prize-winning debut album ‘Leftism’, and its 1999 follow-up ‘Rhythm and Stealth’, placed them alongside electronica acts like the Chemical Brothers and The Prodigy.

UK electronic pioneers Leftfield will celebrate 36 years of music-making when they play Wellington in March.
Their influence helped define progressive house and experimental electronic music.
Leftfield is expected to bring huge energy to Shed 6.

events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Presented by: MG Live & Frontier Touring
MG Live and Frontier Touring proudly announce Leftfield – one of electronic music’s all-time greatest acts – with very special headline shows for 2026 as they continue their celebration of their 35th anniversary (36 at the time of writing).
Speaking on the shows, Neil Barnes shared, “It will be 36 years since I released the first Leftfield track, ‘Not Forgotten’, and 31 years now of Leftism. It feels like the perfect time to celebrate and I’m so pleased that finally we get to come back to New Zealand and Australia. Let’s make it unforgettable. Can’t wait to see you there!”
Leftfield’s most recent release was a collection of remixes of ‘Full Way Round (Ft Grian Chatten)’, and they have also been touring across the UK and Europe throughout 2025 to bring their 2022 album This Is What We Do to life.
“Pure Genius? It wasn’t far off.” — The Times (live review in 2025)

events.id: Review Revue - NZ Fringe 2026-The Gods - Paramount,29 Courtenay Pl, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Review Revue - NZ Fringe 2026
events.venue: The Gods - Paramount,29 Courtenay Pl, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Review Revue - NZ Fringe 2026
What if the review was the show?

For NZ Fringe 2026, an election year that couldn't come any sooner, musical comedy duo Bethany Miller and Logan Hunt imagine a best-of-all-possible-worlds-Aotearoa.

That's a tall order, so we've invited some friends (foes?) for feedback...

Each night we're bringing in a local theatre reviewer to critique us live onstage, and you'll get to witness the results, over and over again.

______

Presented as part of NZ Fringe 2026
3-6 March, 5.30pm
@ The Gods, Paramount

TICKETS AVALABLE NOW FROM NZ FRINGE https://tickets.fringe.co.nz/event/446:8283/

______


CREATIVE TEAM:

Logan Hunt - Co-Creator & Performer, Composer
Bethany Miller - Co-Creator & Performer, Producer

Finn McKinlay - keyboardist
Beans Wright - violinist
Chloe Marshall - lighting designer, tech operator
Austin Harrison - Dramaturg
Em Maguire - Publicist

Reviewers? - We are SO excited about who we have onboard, and will announce the who & when soon!

______


ABOUT THE DUO:

Nominated for "MOMENTOUS MUSIC" (NZ Fringe), Logan and Bethany have made a new musical comedy each year since 2023, complete with crunchy social commentary, witty lyrics, and loveable/hateable characters. Logan loves to write, Bethany loves to improvise. This time, they've agreed to do both, at the mercy of live reviewers.

Their previous shows have been described as:

"Supremely relevant social satire cleverly written and gorgeously portrayed" - Theatreview

"heartwarming, wholesome and features a wickedly talented cast showcasing the best of their abilities." - Wellyott

"It’s incredible how quickly Miller is able to get the audience calling out lyrics to a song they’ve never heard before. She is a consistently strong vocalist, as anyone who’s ever seen her perform will attest to." - Wellyott

"[Logan Hunt's] Tim Minchin-esque lyrics are brilliant and Miller’s performance of them a delight as she parodies the breathy, pouting sincerity of so many young popsters." - Regional News

"Delightfully ‘Fringey’, frenetic and buoyant with glorious energy and musicality" - Theatreview

events.name: REDEMPTION || NZ Fringe || Ginge & Minge
events.venue: BATS Theatre,1 Kent Ter, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
REDEMPTION || NZ Fringe || Ginge & Minge
2025 winners of ‘Most Spectacular Organised Chaos’, Ginge & Minge (Nina Hogg and Megan Connolly) are at it again, taking rejected comedy pitches and turning them into comedy gold!!!

REDEMPTION offers three hopeful ‘redeemables’ a chance to direct their dream sketches, improvised formats, scenes or comedic characters that haven’t worked, been rejected, or just didn’t receive the love they deserve.

With a cast of talented funny people (Lesa Macleod-Whiting, Ralph Hilaga, Mo Munn and Matt Hutton), prepare for epic flops and surprising superstar successes during this 50 minute special that combines Ginge & Minge’s love of sketch and improv comedy.

BUT THE POWER IS IN YOUR HANDS.

Only YOU, the audience, gets to decide what will be REDEEMED and what will be REDUMBED.

If you love witnessing magic moments being made right before your eyes, commitment to big stupid ideas, gambling, or just a good spectacle, this show is for you.

3-7 March, 6.30PM
Bats Theatre, 1 Kent Tce
TICKETS: www.bats.co.nz/whats-on/redemption-fringe

events.id: SwapRox | NZ Fringe-BATS Theatre,1 Kent Terrace, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: SwapRox | NZ Fringe
events.venue: BATS Theatre,1 Kent Terrace, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
SwapRox | NZ Fringe
Some people are tops, some are bottoms but here at PopRox we're all switches. In the age of Tik Tok and Reels, our average attention span has maxed out at 7 minutes so PopRox has crafted a show where everything swaps on a buzzer. The cast, the musician and even the tech operator swap roles with each other after just 7 minutes. It's a character based, high-speed romp pushing top improv comedians to the brink of their skills and their sanity. If you don't like what you see, you'll have the chance to change it up and swap it around.

Expect huge characters, heaps of laughs, stitch-ups and people so far out of their skill zone it'll remind you of the coalition government. No night is the same. Not even every quarter hour is the same.

PopRox is a professional improv theatre company entering its 5th year of operation. Having dazzled audiences across Te-Whanganui-A-Tara, the motu and even the world, PopRox's slick and stylish improvisation has received critical acclaim and delighted sold out audiences.

PopRox is:

Tara McEntee
Austin Harrison
Dylan Hutton
Jed Davies
Lesa Macleod-Whiting
Lia Kelly
Mamaeroa Munn
Millie Osborne
Nina Hogg

events.id: Tolerance | NZ Fringe-BATS Theatre,1 Kent Terrace, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Tolerance | NZ Fringe
events.venue: BATS Theatre,1 Kent Terrace, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Tolerance | NZ Fringe
Eight of Te Whanganui-a-Tara's most acclaimed emerging playwrights (Rachel Atlas, Rachel McLean, Campbell Wright, Zachary Klein, Viki Moananu, Amy Wright, Sophie Maree, and Matt Loveranes) tolerated one another, as they paired up to create four short plays on the theme of Tolerance. Come witness the result, an eclectic work about the ways we should (and shouldn't) put up with those around us, as the world burns down.

"Compromise was something special; I'm genuinely grateful that I got to witness this nexus of talent. Varied and out-there, yet restrained and expertly-crafted, it had it all. " - Salient

Tolerance is the continuation of a project started last year with Compromise (Nominee, Best Organised Chaos NZ Fringe 2025) focused on bringing together playwrights to collaborate, build community amongst writers and supply a little bit of creative chaos. It is once again directed by Lia Kelly (Most Original Production Wellington Theatre Awards, One Night Band), and features a cast of vibrant local talent.


Featuring plays about self care at the end of the world, the power games of celebrity power couples, office politics, and interventions gone awry, Tolerance is bursting at the seams with ideas, laughs, and fluids of all varieties. Make sure to "witness this nexus of talent" (Salient), only in NZ Fringe.

Come witness the result, an eclectic work about the ways we should (and shouldn't) put up with those around us, as the world burns down.

events.name: Wellington - Building Science Summit New Zealand 2026
events.venue: Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa,55 Cable Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wellington - Building Science Summit New Zealand 2026
Leading industry experts share practical insights and proven principles for advancing building envelope design and construction practices.

About this Event

Welcome to the Building Science Summit New Zealand 2026 in Wellington!
Join us on Wednesday 4 March 2026 at Te Papa, Wellington for a day filled with insightful discussions and networking opportunities. Bringing together leading industry experts from Aotearoa, Australia, Germany, and Canada to share practical insights and proven principles for advancing building envelope design and construction practices. Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity to connect with like-minded individuals and expand your knowledge.

Key Highlights:
Insights from international and local experts
In-depth discussions on building performance and durability
Case studies showcasing real-world solutions
Networking with industry leaders and peers

We are excited to welcome leading building science experts from New Zealand, Australia, Germany, and Canada. Including Brian Hubbs, Hartwig Künzel, Jess Clarke, Stijn Van den Eeden and Bernard Farrington.
Valid for 60 NZIA CPD Points.

We look forward to seeing you there!

Sponsors:
Nuralite, Oculus Building Science & Façades, Pro Clima, Outright Continuous Insulation, ROCKWOOL


Agenda


🕑: 07:50 AM - 08:20 AM
Registration

🕑: 08:20 AM - 08:30 AM
Opening message
Host: Peter Raimondo

🕑: 08:30 AM - 09:30 AM
TBA
Host: Bernard Farringon
Info: Bernard Farrington is a Laboratory Manager at Shelby Wright Test Labs while also working as a Senior Specialist at Oculus Architectural Engineering. He specialises in building enclosure performance, testing, and practical detailing, combining hands-on technical experience with consulting expertise to support high-performance construction and improved building outcomes.


🕑: 09:30 AM - 10:30 AM
TBA
Host: Stijn Van den Eeden
Info: Stijn has 25 years of experience in external envelopes and was involved in the design and construction of projects on 5 continents, before settling in New Zealand 15 years ago. His expertise includes building materials, façade system development, project delivery and remedial work.


🕑: 10:30 AM - 11:00 AM
Morning Tea Break

🕑: 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM
TBA
Host: Jess Clarke
Info: Jesse Clarke holds more than 15 years of experience in the construction industry. He holds the technical lead role of the Innovation and R&D Manager, servicing pro clima in New Zealand and Australia. Jesse is an active advocate for a holistic approach to the development of industry guidance, standards and codes.


🕑: 12:00 PM - 01:00 PM
Lunch Break + Networking

🕑: 01:00 PM - 02:00 PM
TBA
Host: Hartwig M. Künzel
Info: Prof. Hartwig M. Künzel is Head of the Hygrothermics Department at the Fraunhofer Institute for Building Physics (IBP) in Germany and an Honorary Professor at the University of Stuttgart. With a PhD in Civil Engineering, he has led pioneering research on heat and moisture transport in building envelopes for over three decades. Prof. Künzel is the creator of the internationally recognised WUFI hygrothermal simulation model and has contributed extensively to building standards and best practices for moisture control, energy efficiency, and indoor comfort. He has authored hundreds of publications and is a sought-after speaker at international conferences, sharing expertise that bridges scientific research and practical application in building physics.


🕑: 02:00 PM - 03:00 PM
TBA
Host: Brian Hubbs
Info: Brian Hubbs is a Founder, Principal, and Senior Building Science Specialist at RDH Building Science. With over 30 years of experience as a consultant practicing exclusively in the field of building science, he is a practical façade engineer and researcher. He has broad experience with a variety of building enclosure systems, delivering consistent innovative solutions. Brian brings a unique blend of theoretical and hands-on knowledge gained from designing façades for new buildings, as well as completing hundreds of forensic investigations, rehabilitation, and research projects. He has extensive experience with high-rise and iconic façade systems, components, and materials, designing new and innovative facade systems for high-rise wood and Passive House projects.


🕑: 03:00 PM - 04:00 PM
TBA
Info: TBA


🕑: 04:00 PM - 04:15 PM
Closing Notes and Comments
Host: Peter Raimando

events.id: Unlocking Accessibility in Microsoft Office - Wellington-11/15 Willeston Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Unlocking Accessibility in Microsoft Office - Wellington
events.venue: 11/15 Willeston Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Hosted by Amanda Mace & Dr Ann Knettler - this practical, hands-on session will teach participants how to create accessible content using Microsoft Office tools. Ideal for communications teams, educators, government staff, and business professionals who need to ensure their content reaches and supports the human rights of all users - including users with disabilities. This session will cover:
Understanding accessibility fundamentals in digital documents
Applying accessibility best practices in Word, PowerPoint, and Excel
Using built-in accessibility checkers and tools effectively
Structuring content for screen reader compatibility
Managing images, charts, and tables for inclusive access
Exporting to accessible PDF formats
Increasing your SEO through accessibility practices

Participants will leave with confidence and practical templates to apply accessibility immediately in their daily work.

events.long_description:
Here’s a chance to hear Sir Elton John’s music performed live by someone who cares about authenticity. Tom Cridland is an Anglo-Portuguese musician from London. The Opera House hosts his alter ego, Sir El Tom, in homage to one of the great living musicians. Sir El Tom performs Sir Elton John’s music in an exhilarating concert full of famous hits. You’ll hear songs like Can You Feel the Love Tonight, Don’t Go Breaking My Heart, I’m Still Standing, Goodbye Yellow Brick Road, Crocodile Rock, and many more.

events.id: RETHINK Fundraising Wellington 2026-2 Taranaki Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: RETHINK Fundraising Wellington 2026
events.venue: 2 Taranaki Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
INTRODUCING AOTEAROA'S NEWEST FUNDRAISING EVENT: RETHINK
RETHINK Fundraising 2026 invites you and your team to look at your fundraising programme from a fresh perspective.
Join us for a full day of inspirational talks, panel discussions and practical workshops that will leave you energised, AND armed with a toolkit of actionable learnings to take your fundraising to the next level.
Date: Thursday, 5 March
Venue: Mākaro Room, Wharewaka Function Centre
Time: 8am-5pm
Cost: $249NZD (exc GST)*
Contact: Anna Shere anna@changeand.co
*If you prefer to pay via invoice, please email accounts@changeand.co.
THE PROGRAM
For those of you who joined us for RETHINK Auckland 2025, please note that RETHINK Wellington will feature many of the same sessions from that event, with a few additions to the program and two new guest speakers.
Branding blindspots 
In a sector focused on campaigns, conversion, and compliance, brand is often overlooked. But brand isn’t just a logo or a nice story. It’s how people feel about supporting you. And if it's not clear, engaging, or modern – you’re leaving both money and meaning on the table. This presentation from Tim Dove at re:brand will challenge a few norms and show some examples of it being done well. He’ll get you thinking about your organisation and how you can ensure you’re avoiding the ‘brand blindspot’. 
Rethinking charity comms 
When it comes to getting people enthused about our cause, too often we focus on the what rather than the why. Worse, we risk boring our audience to death with earnest, organisation-centric communications which neither inspire nor instruct. Dominique Antarakis from Change&Co will show you a new and fun way to look at your charity comms for maximum engagement and donor retention.  
Workshop 1 
Facilitated workshop which will provide the opportunity to take the learnings from the morning sessions and give you the practical branding and comms tools to take back to your organisation - and transform your fundraising! 
Lunch break  
Take a break, mix and mingle, and enjoy a fabulous lunch selection.
Data, behaviour, and hyper-personalisation 
This presentation from MIMO/DATAM will show you how to transform raw data into meaningful, multi-channel interactions across email, SMS, voice, and direct mail - all from a single platform. This session will challenge how you think about personalisation - it’s not just about names in subject lines or open rates in eDMs, it’s about burning down the old school campaigns and rebuilding around behaviour, context and connection. 
Lessons from the legacy frontlines 
Based on interviews with practitioners from organisations large and small, this session shares unfiltered insights from Gift in Will managers who are doing the work every day—what's actually generating pledges, where they're getting stuck, and what they wish they'd known sooner. Through their collective wisdom, and guided by TEDIREX’s Martin Ruane, we'll explore the biggest challenges facing legacy programs today, the opportunities hiding in plain sight, and tactical takeaways that work for both beginners and experienced practitioners. 
Workshop 2 
Facilitated workshop which will provide the opportunity to take the learnings from the afternoon sessions and give you the practical personalisation and AI tools to ramp up acquisition and retention.  
CFRE ACCREDITATION
Full participation in RETHINK Fundraising is applicable for 7 points in Category 1.B -Education of the CFRE International application for initial certification and/or recertification.
EVENT PARTNERS
Change&Co, DATAM, mimo, re:brand and Tedirex. Special thanks to FIA/FINZ for their support of the day.
RETHINK has been designed by fundraisers for fundraisers, and we’re keen to make sure you get the most out of the day. We promise no hard-sell, no product placement, and a 100% satisfaction guarantee.
The idea is for you to leave at the end of the day with a roadmap to greater donor engagement – and a sense of renewed energy for what lies ahead.
events.description:

It’s how people feel about supporting you.
Dominique Antarakis from Change&Co will show you a new and fun way to look at your charity comms for maximum engagement and donor retention.

events.id: UN Women Aotearoa NZ International Women’s Day 2026 Parliamentary Reception-Ground Floor/1 Molesworth Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: UN Women Aotearoa NZ International Women’s Day 2026 Parliamentary Reception
events.venue: Ground Floor/1 Molesworth Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join UN Women Aotearoa New Zealand at the New Zealand Parliament Buildings for our flagship International Women’s Day 2026 Parliamentary Reception, marking the United Nations’ global observance of International Women’s Day.
This high-impact evening brings together over 220 influential leaders, changemakers, and allies from across business, government, academia, and the community sector to ignite momentum toward a more inclusive and equitable Aotearoa New Zealand.
Held in alignment with the United Nations International Women’s Day theme, this event proudly positions Aotearoa New Zealand at the forefront of global IWD celebrations, contributing to the worldwide call for gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls.
Why this event matters
In a world facing overlapping crises, from conflict and displacement to economic pressure and the rollback of human rights, gender equality is more urgent than ever. Despite progress, global data shows it may still take up to 123 years to achieve full gender equality without accelerated action.
UN Women is the world’s leading organisation for gender equality and women’s empowerment, working in over 100 countries to advance women’s rights, leadership, safety, and economic participation.
What to expect
This parliamentary reception is designed to both celebrate progress and catalyse action, bringing together leaders and changemakers committed to advancing gender equality.
The evening will feature:
Meaningful connection and conversation over curated refreshments
A keynote address offering insight and inspiration
A moderated panel discussion exploring leadership, lived experience, and pathways for change
Guests will leave inspired, informed, and equipped with perspectives and ideas to help drive meaningful progress within their organisations, communities, and networks.
Your impact
Proceeds from this event support UN Women programmes that accelerate women’s economic empowerment, leadership, and safety, particularly across the Pacific region. By attending, you are standing alongside a global movement working to ensure every woman and girl can live with dignity, opportunity, and choice.
Ticketing
To encourage early commitment, tickets are released in phases:
$85 Super Early Bird tickets are available until 31 January, or until allocation is exhausted
$100 Early Bird pricing applies from 1-16 February
$125 Standard tickets apply from 17 February up to 01 March
We encourage early booking, as capacity is limited.
We warmly invite you to be part of this important United Nations observance and to stand with UN Women in shaping a fairer, safer, and more equal future.

events.id: Aotearoa Jazz Orchestra tickets-Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: Aotearoa Jazz Orchestra tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The Aotearoa Jazz Orchestra (AoJO) returns to Wellington with a contemporary re-imagining of one of the most influential works of the 20th century: George Gershwin’s Rhapsody in Blue. The performance takes place at Meow Nui on Thursday 6 March at 7.00pm, featuring acclaimed pianist Ben Wilcock.

First heard in 1924, Rhapsody in Blue broke new ground by fusing jazz language with symphonic form. In this performance, AoJO honours the essence of Gershwin’s original while re-examining the work through a modern big band lens — expanding its orchestral colours, rhythmic drive, and improvisational possibilities for today’s audiences.

AoJO Musical Director John Rae says the orchestra approached the piece with both respect and curiosity:

“Gershwin was writing music that looked forward, not backward. Our aim with this version of Rhapsody in Blue is to treat it the same way, to honour the original while allowing it to speak in a contemporary jazz language that feels alive right now.”

The performance features pianist Ben Wilcock, widely regarded as one of Aotearoa’s leading jazz artists, whose international career spans Europe, the UK, and New Zealand.

“Ben brings an incredible combination of authority, imagination, and openness to this music,” says Rae. “He understands Gershwin from the inside out, and he’s not afraid to take risks, which is exactly what this piece demands.”

Wilcock has been praised internationally for his distinctive musical voice: “Wilcock combines dazzling technical command with a rare sense of musical narrative — his playing is both fearless and deeply expressive.” — All About Jazz

Another review described him as “A pianist of remarkable clarity and imagination, equally at home in classical repertoire and cutting-edge jazz.”

Alongside this project, AoJO continues its broader mission of developing large-ensemble jazz in Aotearoa and creating meaningful performance opportunities for local musicians.

“The Aotearoa Jazz Orchestra exists to celebrate, develop, and present contemporary large-ensemble jazz in Aotearoa — supporting our musicians, engaging new audiences, and placing this music in a living cultural context rather than a museum one.”

Event details
What: Aotearoa Jazz Orchestra: Gershwin’s Rhapsody in Blue
Featuring: Ben Wilcock (piano)
Where: Meow Nui, Wellington
When: Friday 6 March 2026, 7.00pm

AoJO Musical Director John Rae says the orchestra approached the piece with both respect and curiosity: “Gershwin was writing music that looked forward, not backward.
“Ben brings an incredible combination of authority, imagination, and openness to this music,” says Rae.

events.id: Lloyd Cole - Wellington-Old St Paul's,34 Mulgrave Street, Thorndon, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Lloyd Cole - Wellington
events.venue: Old St Paul's,34 Mulgrave Street, Thorndon, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Lloyd Cole - Wellington
Lloyd Cole announces a run of solo shows throughout New Zealand in March 2026, proudly presented by Plus1.

His elegant solo live performances in recent years have been predominantly acoustic, but for these concerts he has decided to go electric.

The performance will run the gamut from his masterful debut with the Commotions ‘Rattlesnakes’ right up to 2023’s acclaimed ‘On Pain’ touching on all points in between.

Says Lloyd: “In 1999, in retreat from mainstream ambivalence, the idea of becoming a troubadour was perversely alluring. Two acoustic guitars, a suitcase, and a round the world ticket. It took a while for me to become comfortable with it, but The Folksinger Show became my staple.

"And then, somehow or other, twenty-five years were gone, and now I find myself approaching the end of my career, and wanting to be seen more as just a singer, who wrote a body of work, very little of which one would reasonably label ‘folk’. So I’m back with my Telecaster, my Princeton amp, and my solo show is now electric.”

events.long_description:
Gazley Škoda Karapoti Classic
Established in 1986, the Gazley Škoda Karapoti Classic is the event that kick-started mountain biking Down Under.

Based in Upper Hutt's spectacular Akatarawa Ranges near Wellington, this ol-school adventure ride combines a huge but achievable challenge on trails that are both historic and scenic.

Karapoti really is the one race on every mountain biker's wish list. The Classic 50k is the ultimate, but the 20k Challenge & Kids 5k are great intro's to the Karapoti experience. Entries are limited to 1000 starters, so enter now at https://www.karapoti.co.nz/.

events.long_description:
Fresh off a completely sold-out 2025 New Zealand tour, Avalanche City returns with a renewed creative spark and a live show that highlights the heart of Dave Baxter’s songwriting. Since breaking through with the global hit Love Love Love, followed by another #1 hit Inside Out, Baxter has become known for his warm, cinematic indie-folk.
His performances are intimate, engaging, and full of the storytelling that has earned Avalanche City a devoted following.
Joining the tour is Mountain Boy, an NZ Folk-Rock artist who has made waves internationally with their EP From The Dust and self-produced debut album The Days. Mountain Boy has toured with The Paper Kites, Ziggy Alberts and Boy & Bear and sold out headline shows locally. If you were lucky enough to attend a show in the Avalanche City 2025 sold out NZ tour, you may have caught a glimpse of his multi-instrumental genius, on this tour he will be returning with a full set.
Audiences can expect a powerful blend of fan favourites and new material, an evening shaped by honesty, connection, and the unmistakable charm of Avalanche City + Mountain Boy

Here's your chance to experience everything from waiata you’d hear on the marae to exhilarating stadium anthems, The music of Aotearoa is sure to comes to life in a performance of tribal futurism that ignites the senses. events.name: Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival 2026
events.venue: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall,Tutanekai Street, Paraparaumu, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival 2026
Get ready, Kapiti – something bold, creative, and totally unforgettable is coming your way. On Saturday, 7th March 2026, the Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival makes its explosive return at the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, bringing together the ultimate fusion of ink, art, and live entertainment for one epic day of creativity and connection. Whether you're a tattoo enthusiast, an art lover, or someone who thrives in high-energy, artistic environments, this festival is your ticket to something truly extraordinary.

This isn’t just another tattoo expo — it’s a full-blown creative takeover. Expect to see over 40 talented artists under one roof, from the regions leading tattooists to visionary painters, sculptors, illustrators, and local craftspeople. You’ll witness live tattooing, explore interactive art installations, shop handcrafted works, and dive into workshops designed to spark your imagination. Plus, with non-stop local entertainment on the main stage — from musicians to performers and DJs — the atmosphere will be electric from start to finish.

What makes this event truly special? It’s powered by the team at Kapiti Castles — the creative minds behind the popular Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo. Known for producing vibrant, community-driven experiences, Kapiti Castles has crafted this festival as a platform for creative expression, community connection, and artistic inspiration. Whether you're an artist looking to grow your brand or a visitor eager to explore the region’s creative heartbeat, this is your moment.

The Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival is more than an event — it’s a movement. It’s a chance to meet incredible artists, get inspired, celebrate culture, and maybe even walk away with some fresh ink. With something for everyone — from art collectors to curious newcomers — this is a must-attend event for 2026.

So mark your calendars for 7th March, gather your crew, and get your tickets now. The Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival 2026 is where creativity comes alive, and you won’t want to miss being part of it. Tickets are on sale now — don’t miss your chance to be part of Kapiti’s boldest new festival.

Also check out other Festivals in Paraparaumu, Arts events in Paraparaumu, Business events in Paraparaumu.

events.id: Mild Orange: The//Glow Tour-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Mild Orange: The//Glow Tour
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
Mild Orange, most well-known globally for their viral singles ‘Some Feeling’, ‘Mysight’ and ‘Freak In Me’, are hitting the road again revitalised after an impressive UK & Europe run that saw the band sell out shows from Paris to Bucharest, whilst touring their latest album The//Glow.
Few southern hemisphere artists possess the global reach, devoted fanbase, and sheer tenacity of Mild Orange – an independent band capable of selling 1100 tickets on a Monday/Tuesday night in Croatia and Serbia, while within the same year drawing thousands to a festival stage in South Korea, and co-hosting their own annual beachside concert in Morocco.
Despite their global orbit, New Zealand remains at the heart of the story for the London based Kiwis. Expect radiant, powerful, sun-drenched dream rock as Mild Orange makes it return to Aotearoa with Heavy Chest. Come be a part of their next chapter.

“A joyfully cathartic explosion of indie” – DIYMag UK, Bristol 2025 concert review
“A night defined by nuance, texture, and the careful, deliberate crafting of sound - an unforgettable experience for all who attended” – Scottish Music Scene, Glasgow 2025 concert review


06 March – Auckland – Tuning Fork 
07 March – Wellington – San Fran 
12 March – Brisbane – Brightside 
14 March – Melbourne – Corner Hotel 
15 March – Sydney – Marys Underground 
21 March – Bangkok -- TBC

events.long_description:
TEIWA 

Rob Ruha with the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra 

Platinum-selling, Silver Scroll-winning Maori artist Rob Ruha and the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra transform the Michael Fowler Centre into TEIWA - a supernatural performance house of tribal futurism that will transport the senses.From waiata you'd hear on the marae to the exhilaration of stadium anthems, this is Aotearoa music turned all the way up, amplified by the unmistakable haka power of special guests TOA (Te Taumata O Apanui).

All Tickets are Mobile Ticket Only. 
Mobile Tickets are like Print-at-Home tickets but instead of having to print off the tickets yourself, you can just show the barcode on your mobile phone. It is the easiest way to access tickets to your events. For more information visit Ticketmaster.co.nz/mobileticket

events.venue: Wainuiomata Swimming Pools,Lower Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
SHE Hutt City
The SHE Women's Triathlon Series is more than just a swim, cycle, and run or walk. It's a powerful opportunity to hit pause on the demands of daily life and invest in yourself.

This is your invitation to join a community of Kiwi women of all ages, shapes, and fitness levels for a shared challenge designed to help you rediscover your focus and put yourself first.

Race Distances:
Triathlon: 300 m swim (pool), 10 km cycle, 3 km run or walk.
Duathlon: 1 km run, 10 km cycle, 3 km run or walk.

Team Options:
Teams of two or three women sharing disciplines are available for both Triathlon and Duathlon.

events.long_description:
Artisan Craft Market (08/03/25 Wellington)
The Artisan Craft Market is a premium handmade event that takes place across various locations in the broader Wellington region. This high-quality market is designed to foster a welcoming and friendly atmosphere.

Our vision at Artisan Craft Market is to make the market accessible to those who appreciate shopping locally. We aim to provide a platform that supports local artisans, allowing them to showcase their meticulously crafted, high-quality products. By bringing the market directly to the people, we hope to celebrate and promote the unique talents of our community’s skilled artisans.

COME SUPPORT LOCAL CREATORS IN WELLINGTON CITY

events.long_description:
Rātapu, Tuawaru o Poutū-te-rangi
Waiata | Kai | Ahurea | Mahi Toi
Aotearoa’s biggest and best free music festival and street fair returns for its 32nd year! A shining calendar highlight, Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s most colourful suburb invites everyone to come along to their favourite street party. From dawn to dusk, the streets are packed with people of all ages, stages, backgrounds, cultures, locals, visitors, whānau and friends. The beloved Newtown Festival brings you more than 420 stalls, 200 artists, 1000 performers, 16 stages, and heaps of activities for the whole whānau. Join us in a celebration with a mass concentration and extravaganza of local cultural identity, creative expression, and a day of community togetherness and joy.

Teacher Comedy Night - Wellington
🔥THE FIRST TIME EVER IN NEW ZEALAND!🇳🇿
After a sell-out 2025 Melbourne Comedy Fest show, award-winning comedian and ex-teacher Daniel Delby brings his sell-out hit show Teacher Comedy Night to Dunedin for the first time ever! Get ready to experience the comedic sensation sweeping Australia!

EVERY SHOW IS DIFFERENT
Ex high school teacher and now comedian Daniel Delby hosts the night with stand up comedy, interactive games, video sketches on the big screen, hilarious student work samples, and crowd-sourced teacher stories from the audience! Whether you're an educator yourself or simply love a good laugh, don't miss this unforgettable night.

If you love a good laugh, don't miss an unforgettable night with interactive games, relatable video sketches on the big screen, side-splitting student work samples, hilarious teacher stories and non-stop laughter!

events.id: Xero Basics + Workshop-Sass,Affinity Cruises, Main St, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand, Blenheim-All Events In
events.name: Xero Basics + Workshop
events.venue: Sass,Affinity Cruises, Main St, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand, Blenheim
events.long_description:
Xero Basics + Workshop
👉 #XeroBasics+ Workshop - Blenheim - Thursday 20 November, 9am to 11.30am - Rangitane House, Level 4

Refreshments included.

📣 Want to navigate Xero like a pro and save valuable time?
📣 Looking to gain the confidence to manage your accounts with ease?
📣 Interested in gaining practical knowledge through hands-on experience with real-world scenarios?

As this is a hands-on workshop, you will be required to bring your own device. However, if this is not possible, let us know at time of booking so we an arrange you with a loaner.

Learn how Xero can help you achieve better efficiencies within your business during this hands-on workshop.

This is a Xero basics course with an edge. This course is suitable for beginners through to current users of Xero who want to learn how to use Xero properly – you don’t know, what you don’t know.

Gain a basic+ knowledge and learn how to use Xero efficiently. This course will set you up with a strong understanding and practical knowledge of Xero to advance your business. We will also offer you extra hints and tips on Xero features and best practices for bookkeeping that other beginner Xero courses may miss out.

Ideal for small business owners who manage their own bookkeeping or to empower your staff by offering hands-on training. Perfect if you have a new accounts person starting or a current staff member that would benefit from a refresher course.

YOU WILL LEARN:
- Dashboard Overview
- Banking Essentials
- Sales Management
- Bills Handling
- Contacts Management
- Files Organisation
- Bank Reconciliations
- GST Processing
- Xero Resources
- Good Bookkeeping Practices
- Interactive Q&A

events.id: The Effective Speaker, Auckland, 10th & 11th March 2026-8 Customs Street East, Auckland Central, Auckland 1010-Humanitix
events.name: The Effective Speaker, Auckland, 10th & 11th March 2026
events.venue: 8 Customs Street East, Auckland Central, Auckland 1010
events.long_description:
1 or 2 Day Presentation Skills Workshop
Limited tickets available. Get in now so you don't miss out!
When effective presenters speak, they do more than inform - they influence, persuade, and inspire. That isn’t magic; it’s method. With the right tools, anyone can build genuine connection and move a room.
This workshop is for leaders, emerging leaders, technical specialists, and professionals who want practical tools and techniques for speaking in both formal and informal settings.
Short on time? Attend 1 Day (Foundations) for all the core skills. Ready for a bigger shift? Choose 2 Days (Advanced) for one on one coaching and deeper transformation. Pick what’s right for you.
You’ll leave with the tools to present more clearly, confidently, and with the influence your role demands. This is not just for the stage. You will use these skills everyday.
The workshop format
Small group format for maximum practice and feedback (no massive groups).
Learning is adapted and personalised for maximum value (no cookie-cutter approach).
Hands on, practical learning, with easy to apply tools and techniques (no sitting around listening to theory).
The Effective Speaker - One Day Workshop (Foundations)
Tues 10th March
A hands-on day where you’ll learn our step-by-step SpeakerMap™ system to plan valuable presentations quickly and with ease.
You’ll learn the principles behind useful visuals, how to manage nerves, and three delivery techniques you can use immediately.
Foundations is best for technical experts who know their stuff but struggle to get it across, and nervous presenters who want a safe, practical reset.
What you’ll learn
Plan engaging content (fast)
Use the SpeakerMap™ to develop a clear Key Message and structure that keeps audiences attentive without overload.
Plan faster, make better decisions about what to include (and what to ditch).
 Design useful slides (not wallpaper)
A simple but revolutionary way to design slides that support — not sabotage — your message.
Practical guidance on using AI to fast-track draft slides and create supporting documents.
How to use PowerPoint to keep you on track without putting your audience to sleep.
 Keep nerves under control
A proven psychological approach to calm the mental chatter that causes waffling, speed talking, and blank moments.
Build a personal plan to shift focus from “me” to the audience and the outcome you want.
 Deliver in a natural, engaging way
Three delivery techniques that help you look credible, be engaging and feel confident.
How to vary pace and emphasis so your key points actually land.
How to cut the filler - the “ums” and “ahs” - and keep your flow.
 Plenty of practice
You’ll practise each technique in pairs or threes — supportive, safe, and highly practical.
Includes
A full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
The Effective Speaker workbook
30minute one on one follow up session
Investment: $1,200 + GST (Early Bird Pricing $995+GST)
 
The Effective Speaker - Two Day Workshop (Advanced)
Tues 10th & Wed 11th March
Gain all the skills from Day One - and then take them further. If presenting is central to your career growth, this is the coaching workshop you need.
Over two full days, you’ll create a significant shift in your communication skills.
Day One gives you the foundations to make presenting easier and more effective.
Day Two consolidates and extends these skills. You’ll go deeper into content planning, adapt the tools to your real work presentations, and get personalised coaching to develop your own authentic style.
You’ll also learn strategies for handling even the toughest audiences. The workshop is practical, hands-on, and focused on learning by doing - presenting, receiving coaching, and observing your peers.
If you’re ready for lasting, transformative change in your communication skills, the two-day option is the best choice.
What you’ll learn
Everything from Day 1 (Foundations) PLUS
Go deeper with planning
Apply the SpeakerMap to plan an actual presentation that you can give. 
Dive deeper into crafting valuable messages that you can use in the future. 
Rehearse in a way that actually works
A practical way to prepare when time is tight — so you own your words.
Shift from competent to compelling
One-on-one coaching targeted to your specific needs.
Video feedback plus our inside-out coaching methodology to reconnect you with the techniques you use naturally in conversation.
How to use silence, pace, notes, and the remote without looking stiff or artificial.
How to speak with energy and authenticity, not speed and panic.
Eliminate “ums” and “ahs”, look confident (even when you’re not), and create a sense of commitment that audiences feel.
An understanding of your personal communication strengths and the areas you need to focus on for growth.

Handle audiences like a pro
Strategies for side chats, interruptions, distractions, disagreement, and the odd angry voice - while staying calm and in control.

Includes
Everything in Day 1, plus:
A second full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
Videos of your presenting and coaching sessions
The Effective Speaker workbook
60minute one on one follow up session
Investment: $2,500 + GST (Early Bird Pricing $2.200+GST)
What past participants say:

"The overall experience of the course far surpassed my expectations. I came in hoping to gain some valuable insights and tips for better public speaking, but what I received was so much more. I developed a newfound confidence in my ability to communicate effectively, learned how to captivate an audience, and discovered strategies for managing nerves and overcoming stage fright. I would recommend this effective speaking course to anyone looking to enhance their communication abilities. It's not just another course; it's a transformative experience that will empower you to become a more confident and persuasive speaker" Alex Goryachev, New Zealand Green Building Council
“This course not only met my expectations, but it completely exceeded them. This has been one of the most transformative courses I’ve attended. Jane totally revolutionised the way I now approach presentations. Having felt fear in the past each time I have to present to large groups, for the first time I now feel like I have the tools, understanding and ability to approach presentations and conquer my fear. I can’t thank Jane enough.” Nadia Marsh, Head of Bids, Tonkin & Taylor
"I have never been in such a well-run course (I've done a lot) Jane was amazing she held our attention from start to finish each day. I feel we all learnt so much and I will definitely be taking her advice on how I can improve myself. This course was well above what I expected, Jane had a great way of communicating. Typically, people tune out or lose interest by the end of the day. This was not the case for us. I honestly thing it’s the best course I’ve been on in my 4 years with WCC." Joshua Harding, Team Leader Consents, Wellington City Council

“The course is awesome. The balance between talk time, practical learning and feedback is perfect. The trainer really made the course for me - she is sensitive and responsive to people’s needs and is genuine in her approach to give the learners as much out of the time as possible. A very polished and well-planned course.” Huia Grey, Department of Conservation
"By far the best course i have attended in any organisation, either here in NZ or abroad. The format of the course was engaging and there was a great balance between listening, engaging and participating. I look forward to using the skills used presenting at our next Team Hui!"
Matthew Townsley, Medical Council of New Zealand


"Really great course, no pressure environment with a good mix of interactive and book work. Have walked away feeling more confident in how I am going to put my presentations together."

Jessica Stokes, Emergency Management Team, New Plymouth District Council
"It was good, practical and useful tools "not rules" for business comms and pressos. Good to learn some of the other things you don't often learn in traditional presentation skills training. Really good engagement and interaction - the team were impressed we were all engaged right until the end! Easily one of the best courses I have been on in this line of work. Keep up the good work! "
Brad Stansell, Channel Account Manager, Pax 8

events.id: The King's Singers-cnr Hill & Molesworth Sts, Thorndon, New Zealand 6011,Cellar-Cafe, Molesworth St, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: The King's Singers
events.venue: cnr Hill & Molesworth Sts, Thorndon, New Zealand 6011,Cellar-Cafe, Molesworth St, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
The King's Singers
Double-GRAMMY Award-winning vocal ensemble The King’s Singers return to New Zealand following standout performances in 2024 and 2018.

For over half a century, they have represented the gold standard in a cappella singing. Renowned for their unique approach to “close harmony”, they seamlessly weave their voices across centuries and styles.

Spanning Renaissance sacred music and English folksong to jazz standards and pop classics, this programme journeys through their history. From Byrd to Billy Joel, madrigals to The Beach Boys, Disney classics, contemporary works, plus two songs specially selected for Wellington.

Significantly, this concert is one of the last in Aotearoa for baritone Chris Bruerton, a proud New Zealander and key member of the group for over ten years.

Whether you’ve followed them for decades or are hearing them for the first time, Close Harmony at Wellington Cathedral promises an unforgettable night.

events.id: Authority Zero (usa)-Valhalla,154 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Authority Zero (usa)
events.venue: Valhalla,154 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Authority Zero (usa)
Champions of skate-punk for more than three decades, Mesa, Arizona's Authority Zero are finally touching down in Aotearoa New Zealand this coming March, hitting Auckland's Double Whammy and Wellington's Valhalla. Still fronted by founding vocalist Jason DeVore, Authority Zero broke through in a major way during the '00s with the anthem-packed triple punch of A Passage In Time (2002), Andiamo (2004) and 12:34 (2007), and they now have eight studio long players out in the world including their latest, 2021's Ollie Ollie Oxen Free. Don't flub this opportunity to finally catch these legends letting rip on local stages — brought to you by Sticky Fingaz Tour Management...


Authority Zero (USA)

Monday 9th March - Double Whammy Bar, Auckland
Tuesday 10th March - Valhalla, Wellington

events.long_description:
Lloyd Cole - Palmerston North
Lloyd Cole announces a run of solo shows throughout New Zealand in March 2026, proudly presented by Plus1.

His elegant solo live performances in recent years have been predominantly acoustic, but for these concerts he has decided to go electric.

The performance will run the gamut from his masterful debut with the Commotions ‘Rattlesnakes’ right up to 2023’s acclaimed ‘On Pain’ touching on all points in between.

Says Lloyd: “In 1999, in retreat from mainstream ambivalence, the idea of becoming a troubadour was perversely alluring. Two acoustic guitars, a suitcase, and a round the world ticket. It took a while for me to become comfortable with it, but The Folksinger Show became my staple.

"And then, somehow or other, twenty-five years were gone, and now I find myself approaching the end of my career, and wanting to be seen more as just a singer, who wrote a body of work, very little of which one would reasonably label ‘folk’. So I’m back with my Telecaster, my Princeton amp, and my solo show is now electric.”

events.id: The King's Singers-2 Hill Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: The King's Singers
events.venue: 2 Hill Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
C L O S E H A R M O N Y
For over half a century, The King’s Singers have been synonymous with impeccable blend, radiant tone, and joyful music-making. Formed in 1968 by six choral scholars from King’s College, Cambridge, the group quickly earned an international reputation for their unique approach to “close harmony” — a seamless weaving of voices across centuries and styles. Today, their performances continue to enchant audiences from London to Los Angeles, and now, back in Aotearoa.
This bespoke programme, created especially for their March 2026 tour, offers a journey through The King’s Singers’ remarkable musical history. Beginning with their earliest repertoire from the late 1960s, the evening will move through Renaissance sacred music, English folksong, jazz standards, pop classics, and contemporary works. Expect Byrd alongside Billy Joel, madrigals alongside The Beach Boys, Disney magic alongside dazzling new arrangements from the songwriters of today.
The concert also carries a special significance — it will be one of the final New Zealand appearances for long-standing baritone Chris Bruerton. A proud Kiwi, Chris has been a cornerstone of The King’s Singers for over a decade, touring the world and helping shape their modern sound. His farewell tour offers Wellington audiences a rare chance to celebrate his artistry on home soil.
A highlight of the night will be the “Something Borrowed” segment, where the ensemble will present a pair of songs chosen especially for Wellington — a personal gift to the local audience, performed in their signature style.
With wit, warmth, and unparalleled musicianship, The King’s Singers promise an evening that is both a celebration of their legacy and a showcase of their continuing innovation. Whether you’ve followed their journey for decades or are hearing them for the first time, Close Harmony at Wellington Cathedral will be a night to remember.

events.id: GLORIA - A Triple Bill-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: GLORIA - A Triple Bill
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Witness a show in honour of the renowned choreographer and dancer, Douglas Wright. The New Zealand Dance Company and Co3 Contemporary Dance Australia will restage his masterpiece, ‘Gloria’. Set to Vivaldi's legendary score, performed live by the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra and Voices New Zealand. A celebration of life, dancers will fly, twist, and turn among the grandeur of the historic St James Theatre.
‘GLORIA - A Triple Bill’ was originally performed at the 1992 Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts. This contemporary trans-Tasman collaboration honours one of Aotearoa's most prolific dance talents. Producing more than 30 major touring works in his life and dancing across the globe, Douglas Wright was a celebrated performer and creative until his death in 2018.
The evening will also feature two new creations. ‘A Moving Portrait’ by Raewyn Hill is an intimate, meditative reflection on ageing and grace. ‘Lament’ by Moss Te Ururangi Patterson will take audiences on a powerful journey through memory and resilience. The performance honours the whakapapa  of contemporary dance in Aotearoa.
‘GLORIA - A Triple Bill’ is exclusive to Wellington. It's presented as part of the Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts 2026.

events.long_description:
Presented by: Cream & Live Nation
For the club kids, soundsystem girlies and music heads, Jyoty is Back.
Jyoty has built a global fan base around freeform, multi-genre DJ sets, championing real, no BS club culture and staying true to herself.
A seasoned raver with a sixth sense for raising the temperature, she moves through baile funk, gqom/amapiano/afrobeats, dancehall, Philly/Baltimore/New York club, Dutch bubbling and UK jungle/funky/grime/garage, plus hybrids, iconic SoundCloud edits and ’90s/’00s favourites.
You never know what’s next. Nothing is off the cards with Jyoty.

events.id: All in for Arts: He waka toi e eke noa nei tātou – TE WHANGANUI A TARA WELLINGTON 2026-Ground Floor/1 Molesworth Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: All in for Arts: He waka toi e eke noa nei tātou – TE WHANGANUI A TARA WELLINGTON 2026
events.venue: Ground Floor/1 Molesworth Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
All in for Arts: He waka toi e eke noa nei tātou is back in March 2026 and we’re bringing the good vibes to a town near you. 
Together with Creative New Zealand Toi Aotearoa, The Chartwell Trust, and Stuff, we’re gathering business minds, young creatives, community leaders, artists and arts champions for a morning of kōrero, connection and creativity over coffee. 
These events are free, and everyone is welcome – even if you haven’t felt creative in years!
The details:
Date: Tuesday 12 March 2026
Time: 7:30AM-9:00AM
Venue: Parliament Banquet Hall
Our mission is to unlock the creative potential of Aotearoa and show what’s possible when imagination leads the way. Be in the room to find out what it’s all about. 
A huge mihi to Creative New Zealand, The Chartwell Trust, and Stuff for making this journey possible.

events.id: Ocean Film Festival World Tour - Wellington Thurs 12 Mar 26 6:30pm-10 Kent Terrace, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Ocean Film Festival World Tour - Wellington Thurs 12 Mar 26 6:30pm
events.venue: 10 Kent Terrace, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Immerse yourself in a breathtaking 3-hour journey through the world's most spectacular marine environments. The Ocean Film Festival World Tour presents an extraordinary collection of short films that capture the raw beauty, untamed power, and majesty of our oceans.
These carefully curated films showcase stunning cinematography from surface to depths, transporting audiences into underwater realms and atop towering waves. Experience the ocean through the eyes of passionate divers, fearless surfers, dedicated swimmers, and pioneering oceanographers who live for the sea's call.
Featuring spectacular underwater scenes, heart-stopping wave sequences captured from impossible angles, and intimate portraits of ocean adventurers, each film is a visual masterpiece.
Through compelling narratives and breathtaking footage, the festival celebrates both the ocean's majesty and the remarkable creatures that call it home. The Ocean Film Festival World Tour is an unforgettable celebration that inspires audiences to marvel at the sea's beauty while fostering a deeper understanding of our connection to these precious marine ecosystems.
Find out more at https://www.oceanfilmfestivalworldtour.com/
SORRY NO REFUNDS : SEATING IS NOT ALLOCATED.
ONE SCREENING ONLY IN WELLINGTON
Photo credit: EvieWilderness

events.id: Ten Thousand Hours-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Ten Thousand Hours
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Multi-award-winning contemporary circus company Gravity & Other Myths make their Wellington debut with Ten Thousand Hours. It’s an adrenaline-fueled celebration of sweat, strength and skill that promises to “shock, awe, and delight” (Glam Adelaide). 
This whānau -friendly spectacular explores physical skill; how it’s obtained, perfected, and how it can transform lives. Accompanied by live percussion, each gravity-defying leap, hold, and fall tells a story of discipline and discovery. The show offers a rare glimpse into the countless hours and dedication needed to achieve the extraordinary. The show had sell-out performances at the 2025 Edinburgh Fringe. Ten Thousand Hours is a performance unlike any other in the Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts programme.

Harmony Education Aotearoa - Central
Join us at El Rancho for a fun, high-energy barbershop singing education weekend filled with ringing chords, hands-on coaching, and plenty of camaraderie. Whether you’re a seasoned quartet singer or brand-new to the style, you’ll sharpen your skills through engaging workshops, expert-led rehearsals, and live demonstrations. Come discover the joy of close harmony, meet fellow singers from across the region, and leave inspired—with new techniques, new friends, and a whole lot of resonance!

events.venue: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall
events.long_description:
JOURNEY TO SERENITY Yin Yoga and Sound Healing Special Series # 6
Welcome to the Journey to Serenity Yin Yoga and Sound Healing twice monthly session!!!

These beautiful, nourishing Yin and Sound Sessions are on the second and Fourth Friday of each month (between November 28th and March 28th 2026) and are held in the Meeting / Supper Room of the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall on Tutanekai Street.

It would be lovely to share this healing, nourishing restorative practice in the special energy and support you to give your life a boost of wellbeing and good feeling!!

INTRODUCING - SPECIAL WELCOME OFFER - TWO PEOPLE FOR $90 (You don't have to be a couple) - Book through bank transfer or message me directly

Unique Yin Yoga, Sound Healing, breathwork and meditation come together to create this specially guided, deeply relaxing and healing experience, held within a unique holistic framework that encourages reflection and self-care.

Take the time and space that this session offers, for yourself, and give yourself a gift of true nourishment.

Bryony Shanti from Heartsong Healing will use a wide range of special healing sound instruments along with her voice to guide you into peace, relaxation and stillness. The healing vibration of the specially chosen sounds will wash over you bringing deep clearing, balance and alignment. There is a experience of gratitude and blessing.

Bryony's sound works to strengthen and deepen the powerful work of Yin yoga teacher Bianca who will guide you through 90-minutes of restorative and uplifting poses that are intended for you relax, heal and to open more to receive the healing vibration of sound.

Bianca's Yin Yoga focuses on easily accessible and effective poses
which work into the deeper connective tissues of the body. These poses are held for anywhere between 90 seconds to 5 minutes to allow for an opening in the body, the perfect way to receive the sound vibrations.

Yin yoga invites us into stillness and gives space for both the mind and body to relax and release tension and stress.

OPEN TO ALL: Whether you have experience in either Yin Yoga and Sound Healing or are looking to try something completely new, you are very welcome to join in the journey into a sense of serenity. Beginners and experienced practitioners alike will find something nourishing for themselves in this session.

events.id: Ko au Te Taiao-55 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Ko au Te Taiao
events.venue: 55 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Ko au te taiao helps us all to form robust understandings of who we are – as both descendants and future ancestors – in living relationship with this beautiful land. We will:
explore the rhythms of the maramataka and ways we can organise teaching practices in relation to it with Kaupapa Māori Learning Specialist, Leroy de Thierry.
observe the characteristics of mamaku, ponga + whekī, (tree ferns) and consider their whakapapa with Curator Botany, Leon Perrie.
consider how to relate to mātauranga Māori in ways that honour Te Tiriti o Waitangi + imagine rich inquiries in relation to the online resource, Ko au te taiao with Head of Learning, Sarah Hopkinson.
